38863308.review:
I got this game on sale thinking it would be funny to play for a little bit, before getting bored and forgetting about it, but it turned out to actually be fun. You basically take on hoards of enemies before facing a boss character, and you can level up to unlock different combos, and earn money to unlock constumes and accessories in the store.

The amount of fan service is kind of absurd in this game. The boobies bounce all over the place and if you give or take a lot of damage, the clothes rip off.

But the game abruptly transitions to serious themes at times. Like the girls were in a onsen having more fanservice time, and the grandpa walks in like yo come eat at my resteraunt, and everyone is like what the hack is this pervy old man coming into our bath for. About five minutes later that same old man asking all these deep ass questions like does evil need to exist in order for good deeds to matter and shit. And the token pervy girl character turns out to actually have this back story where she's trying to restore the honor that her parents lost because they spared the life of some old guy who ran an orphanage.

It's unexpectadly entertaining.

One thing i didn't realize tho is that when you run in boarderless windowed mode, the game runs at your native res, no matter what settings you have. So when trying to run 1080p on a 4k tv with a gtx 660 ti i was getting a lot of slowdown until i switched it to fullscreen.

38186394.review:
Dynesty warriors with cute girls instead of samari, basically.  Yeah, it's a bunch of fan service, but that's on top of a pretty good game.  This is a Vita title port, so don't expect too much depth, but it is far and away the better of something like Neptunia Hyperdimension U.  The story is done largely with text, largely makes no sense whatsoever, and has characters that you never even see.  I won't spoil anything, but one big bad boss that has been secretly pulling strings and why you've been fighting one group of enemies at one point is never shown, never fought, and is "defeated" in a battle that takes place entirely in a few paragraphs of text.  Very strange.

My only real complaints are no English voice acting, which I accept would have been expensive, and that once it's all done there's not a proper vs. mode I could find to just pick my favorite fighter and beat on random other ones.  Dissappointing, especially when two of the powerful fighters basically only get really short "personal story" mission bits and I can find no other way to use them at all.

38125890.review:
This was my first time playing a game from the Senran Kagura series, and I'm thoroughly surprised by how much I enjoyed it. Ignoring the obvious main reason as to why people decide to buy this game ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°), there's some really solid beat 'em up gameplay here that I really enjoyed. The story is pretty good, I was actively interested through my playthrough of it and was suprised to see some pretty emotional moments. All 22 characters in this game have interesting personalities as well as unique fighting styles, and it was very enjoyable learning how to play all of them. There's a fair amount of content in this game to sink your teeth into, taking me about 35 hours to get all the achivements and 100% it. The music is also excellent.

My one complaint would be the content other than the main story can get pretty boring, however it isn't a major issue as you could only play the main story and still get around 28 hours from this game. Something I also want to mention is that playing with a keyboard and mouse is significantly less fun than playing with a controller. I spent hours changing the keyboard and mouse controls and getting used to them, but I still couldn't stand them. So if you plan on purchasing this game, I highly recommend using a controller if you have one. 

Overall I highly recommend this game if you think it looks like something you'll enjoy, as long as you can get over the [b] very	[/b] large amount of fan service. ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°

37963555.review:
Tras exprimir el 100% de los logros de Steam tengo que decir que es una compra más que recomendada para todos aquellos amantes de los Hack and Slash, independientemente del apartado ecchi del juego.

Puntos a favor:
*Jugabilidad muy fluida, con una notable variedad de combos que varían en función del personaje (más de 20 personajes)
*Los personajes suben de nivel y aprenden nuevas técnicas y combos cada vez más largos.
*Hay una gran variedad de trajes y complementos para personalizar a los personajes, contando con la posibilidad de guardar tus conjuntos favoritos.
*La historia es genial; si nunca has jugado a un Senran Kagura, te sorprenderá. Me atrevería a decir que es incluso mejor que la del Senran Kagura Burst de 3Ds.
*La banda sonora es de 10, esa fusión entre instrumentos orientales y occidentales es de lo mejor (muy al estilo BSO de Naruto).
*Gráficos muy coloridos y animaciones divertidas, aquellos amantes del ecchi seguro que esta parte lo disfrutarán como nadie.
*Diálogos divertidos.

Puntos en contra:
*Misiones repetitivas.
*Está en inglés, aquellos que no entiendan dicho idioma no van a disfrutar de la historia.
*La historia está únicamente narrada mediante parrafadas enormes y alguna que otra imagen, se echan en falta cinemáticas (ojalá la adaptación de este juego al anime).
*El online está muerto, no he podido disfrutar esta parte :(
*El juego es fácil, aún haciendo las misiones en modo difícil.

37836870.review:
So like hear me out on this, at face value you only see big breated teenaged ninja girls, but theres a bit more to it then that.
 Senran Kagura Shinvoi Versus is like a chaotic mix between visual novel and beat em up; the beat em up aspect of the game is simple and fun in a "turn your brain off" sort of way it doesn't really reinvent the wheel but the gameplay that's there is fun and works; light attacks, heavy attack, gurad breakers, super moves, parries, etc, but the real saving grace of this game is its characters beyond their obvious sex appeal, the game boast a roster of 22 playable characters, each with their own unique varrying fighting styles, personalities, backgrounds, and quirks. 
Going into this game I never would have expected that the game would make me "feel" for some of the girls awful past, as well as enjoying some of their banter. Overall I bought Senran Kagura Shinvoi Versus for $20 excepting a few hours of bouncing boobs and sub-par gameplay, what I got instead was mindlessly fun gameplay and seeing the beautiful souls behind the big breast and fell in love with this series (although the big boobs are nice add on) 
I rate Senran Kagura Shinvoi Versus 6/10 and recommed you pick up this game and its sequels during one of the varrious steam sales

37760173.review:
Sebbene le ambientazioni di gioco risultino meno che piatte, la varietà di nemici sia limitata e tutto il gameplay si riduca ad uno smashing-button compulsivo, complessivamente il titolo riesce a divertire.

Questo perchè la durata non è eccessiva, i dialoghi intrattengono, le animazioni sono bene realizzate (così come i move-set) e i personaggi sono tutti ben caratterizzati.

Ma sopratutto, ritengo che, limitatamente ai titoli action, non si possano utilizzare le propaggini femminili in maniera migliore di questa in un videogame.
Per questo nomino "Senran Kagura: Shinovi Versus", agli "Steam Awards 2017" nella categoria "Miglior uso delle Tette".


Tuttavia ne sconsiglio l'acquisto a prezzo pieno; pur essendo molto divertente, il suo valore come videogame è molto limitato, dato che parliamo di un gameplay striminzito, volto solo a giustificare l'apparizione di rotondità femminili a schermo.

Enjoy

36319829.review:
10/10 came4tits
DON'T JUDGE ME!

This is a great beat 'em up game with lots of different characters complete with their own unique play style and personalititty. The story was incredible to me when I chose the hebijo and when I advanced further through the hanzo story, although keep in mind that i came in with absolutely no expectations for any story at all as we all know what this game is really about. Its solid combat system complete with aerial combos, transformations and dodge/slide mechainics. To top it all off xseed is one of the best localization teams, which don't like censorship, as of right now and they're the ones who localize this franchise.

The graphics sure aren't the most impressive and there isn't english voice acting but it still is a fantastic game with a lot to offer, like a side story for each girl, a training more, multiplayer and a dressing room, all for a small price. Like you can genuinely enjoy this game without being a crazy oppai fanatic like Katsuragi because it is that good of a beat 'em up. Hell, it is even comparable to the warriors franchise. I honestly didn't think that character development would have existed in this sort of game.

Honestly if you are a fellow breast lover than you are doing yourself a disservice by not checking out something from the senran kagura franchise and this is as good of a spot as any to start with the series. Although if you aren't too interested in knowing the story and want a bit mroe out of the game than for a bit more you could just get senran kagura estival versus as they did improve a few things in that game.

10/10 game of the year

The bottom line with this game here is that, while the fighting mechanics are fun (especially once you get to grips with it's weird controls), the story mode is garbage. I mean it, it's garbage in the most garbage way possible. All dialogue is done by reading a text crawl that is plastered over some random background while listening to incredibly annoying kawaii desu animu blurbs.

There are tons of unlockables, the graphics are nice, the lewdness is good and lewd, but the story mode is just.... soooooooo boring. I finished one school's entire story and was half-way through the 2nd and felt like I had seen all there is to see, so, I'm done. Maybe the later games did more with their expanded budget and made a tollerable campaign. I doubt I'll ever play another one of these to find out.

35939122.review:
因为是先玩的EV，为了补剧情才收的SV，在一些方面也许会有些偏见，请谅解。

首先，作为一款掌机（PSV）移植游戏，SV画面瑕疵比较明显，渲染方式也不敬人意。
其次，相比后作EV，SV的角色移动以及进攻速度更快，小兵的攻击偏激烈，整体游戏节奏更紧张。也许这很过瘾，但也许太过瘾了……
再然后，SV本身不支持简繁中文，只支持日英双语，表示靠贫弱的日语水平看字幕＆听剧情语音来理解故事发展真的很累。

不过，SV也给了我不少的惊喜：
剧情方面
延续了真红之后的剧情，焰率领的旧蛇女一行人为了自己的信念选择成为逃忍隐居起来【刚开始游戏时为不可选团队】，半藏学院迎来了新的挑战：继承了黑影意志的雪泉率领的月闪学院，以及付出只为重振学院雄风的雅绯率领的新蛇女。
游戏通过以三所学院分设独立剧情的方式介绍了每个角色之间的羁绊，比如在半藏学院腹背受敌之时焰率领的焰红莲队出马救了飞鸟一行人一次，还有黑影是如何教导雪泉等人的故事，都很是详细。
最激动人心的莫过于将半藏、月闪、蛇女三所学校的剧情完成之后，焰红莲队就会解锁；全部剧情完成后还会引出飞鸟与焰的最终决战。光是剧情就能玩好一阵子。
声优的配音感情充分，并不会觉得尴尬【日配的一贯优点】

操作方面
之前说了游戏整体节奏偏激烈，让游戏的体验特别过瘾，这是大实话，尤其是其中的某些角色，上手快，手感特别好。
秘传忍法的过场动画除了第一个镜头有点尬以外，还是不错的。

背景音乐
每个角色都有自己独立的bgm，辨识度很高，一部分曲子有借鉴其他各领域音乐的旋律，也是挺有趣的。个人最喜欢咏和葛城的bgm。


如果是对系列剧情感兴趣的玩家，可以收一波；不过单论游戏体验，并不推荐这部。它的后作EV从整体上来说会有更高质量的游戏体验。

Pros:
-60fps.
-Alot of characters to try with different fighting styles (swords, fist, etc.).
-Combos. What I mostly love about this game.
-Customize costumes.

Cons:
-Hibari's jump attack is broken as hell, but will never get nerfed anyways.
-Story can be a bit boring. It feels like reading a chapter book. 
-The edge of the models isn't sharp enough. Kinda feels like you're playing without anti-aliasing, but it's not a huge deal, though. I guess it's just a bit distracting to me?

The game is indeed good. They have alot of characters with different personalities and different fighting style. Although I wish the story is more interesting, otherwise it would end up like all their anime series.

7/10

33868162.review:
To sum it all up, button mashing with boobs and panties.

Gameplay wise, you're either fighting dozens of trash mobs who take no skill to defeat, or these erratic, cheap AI "bosses" all who have the ability to infinitely air juggle you to defeat if you don't know how to break out of it or avoid them. From the very first mission in the game, the AI reacts and behaves the same way, there's no noticeable ramp in difficulty or challenge.

The very last boss will play the same as the very first boss does. The only way to defeat these enemies is to cheese them out or exploit them back with undodgeable combos and attacks. Some fights are literally over in seconds, you can spam your powerful attacks and 1 or 2 shot the enemies. I don't see how there's any kind of skill in that. Combos are practically the same for every character too, you mash the attack button a couple times, launch someone in the air and follow it up with an air combo. Rinse and repeat for the dozens of missions throughout the game until you finish the whole thing.

The only challenge comes from the aforementioned 1 on 1 boss fights, where you've got no powerups from the get go and have to tap dance around the area avoiding the AI so it doesn't stun lock you and drain your entire health bar off in a cheap series of combos. Most of the time you'll level up mid fight however and be able to take the boss out in a single attack.

Outside of all that crap is a bazillion different useless cosmetic items to unlock, none of which are all that good visually.

I like T&A in my video games, I don't care if it's anime either, but the gameplay is so lopsided in this one that it makes the whole thing less enjoyable. The positive rating the game has received is easily from the content itself, than the actual core of the gameplay which is sloppy as all hell and completely unrefined.

33858210.review:
Ho conosciuto Senran Kagura tramite recensioni online e, come credo chiunque, ho voluto provarlo spinto dal fanservice. E di fanservice il gioco è pieno, nei modelli delle ragazze, nelle immagini, nelle trasformazioni shinobi...tuttavia non è questo il motivo per cui il titolo è, a mio parere, valido. Non che il fanservice sia un elemento negativo, anzi, ma dietro ad esso si nasconde un gioco capace di divertire per molte ore sia per il sistema di combattimento che per le innumerevoli e fantasiose tecniche che le shinobi utilizzano contro i loro nemici. Giocare a Senran Kagura è divertente, frenetico, a tratti pure impegnativo (anche se la difficoltà è in genere molto bassa). Utilizzare Yumi per la sua capacità di congelare gli avversari, Ikaruga per la velocità con cui maneggia la spada (no doppi sensi) o Daidonji perché riesce a massacrare chiunque le si pari davanti non annoia mai. 
Anche il comparto musicale è ottimo, con tracce che vanno dal calmo e rilassato, all'energia che sprizza nei combattimenti, alla tristezza che traspira da alcune scene. Sì, perché ciò che sorprende di più di Senran Kagura è la profondità delle storie delle ragazze, molto "da manga", che vanno a toccare elementi delicati come la situazione degli Hikikomori (coloro che hanno scelto di chiudersi in casa e non uscire per paura della società), oppure il legame affettivo che si instaura fra degli orfani e il nonno adottivo, o ancora il dolore che si prova alla perdita dei genitori. Sono sinceramente rimasto sopreso da tali tematiche, che certo non mi aspettavo sarebbero state approfondite da un gioco come Senran Kagura. 
Per quanto riguarda il fanservice...bé, basti pensare che esiste una Dressing room, tanti vestiti attillati, bikini e lingerie a non finire e la possibilità di "interagire" con la shinobi in maniere che non sempre le faranno piacere (tranne Ryona, per la quale vi basti sapere che un tocco non è mai abbastanza).
In definitiva, il gioco regala ore di grande divertimento, sia per il combattimento che per..."altre cose". Unico pecca che mi sento di fare è l'assenza di giocatori nel multiplayer, dato che con l'uscita di Estival Versus e Peach Beach Splash essi si sono trasferiti lì.

33775398.review:
[h1]My Thoughts:[/h1]
A game about [b]big breasted[/b], teenage, high-school, anime, ninja girls, fighting each other until they destroy their opponents clothes... sounds like the best game ever right? In all seriousness this is a pretty fun game with a decent story and fun characters.

This is the 2nd game in the Senran Kagura franchise, being the sequel of the first game [b]Senran Kagura: Skirting Shadows / Burst[/b]. The sequel is set in a sub series or [b]2nd timeline[/b], also yes the franchise has 2 timeliness, why? I don't know lol. You have [b]Timeline 1[/b], the "main" timeline [i](the first 2 3DS games)[/i] and [b]Timeline 2[/b] [i](the first DS game and all the Versus games)[/i]. Shinovi Versus is set a few months after the first game and is told from 4 different viewpoints that follow 1 of the 4 groups [i](each group represent their Shinobi School)[/i] as the inter-school "Shinobi Battle Royale" competition unfolds.

The overall game is surprisingly long [i](being around 30+ hours if you focus on the main story and read the long visual novel cutscenes)[/i], and is even longer if you attempt to do everything that the game has to offer. The game is an action Dynasty Warriors inspired game with a cast of 22 characters, while containing visual novel cutscenes with a Shonen storyline with tons of fanservice. The cast of characters is the best part of this game, they're very colorful, have different traits and personalities, [i]big[/i]... umm... assests... Yeah the game and the overall franchise is infamous for the huge amount of fanserivce they contain and this game has a lot of it. However despite if being a game with lots of boobs, it does have a decent story and fun characters. It's a little hard to believe that if you just watch random youtube vids of people playing the game or look at the images, or just playing an hour of this game. But if you actually attempt to pay attention to the story when you play it, you'll notice that the long visual novel cutscene contain a lot of character development and characterization for the characters.

The game like I've stated before is a Dynasty Warriors inspired game with different missions for you to tackle [i](the game has over 120+ missions)[/i], where you fight random enemies and then a boss at the end. You can tell by playing it for a few minutes that it used be a portable game. Despite that the game is stil a lot of fun to play with the different characters it has to offer. Is it worth a buy? I recommend it only for the people that like anime.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]the game has nice anime style visuals.
    [*]the cast of characters is varied, colorful and fun to play with.
    [*]the game contains 4 different viewpoints or stories, they contain a good amount of characterization and development for the characters.
    [*]the music and voice acting is great.
    [*]this is a superb translation done by XSEED, the only thing they've removed is the characters ages.
    [*]the game has a good sense of humor.
    [*]big boobies lol.
    [*]tons of customization.
    [*]fun gameplay, each character feels different and are fun to master.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*]solid pc port, however it doesn't have many graphics options.
    [*]the shadows look awful.
    [*]the gameplay can get repetitive.
    [*]the customization with the accessories could be better.
[/list]

[h1]Score: 8.5/10[/h1]

33770719.review:
Senran Kagura, infamous for its crude fan service, busty ninja girls, and over-the-top ability animations. The game runs very well, and I have had zero issues in terms of performance and framerate on my end, running on a rather below average laptop. Lots of characters, lots of customization, and a host of stuff to do to scratch anyone's completionist itch.

Pros

-Many playable characters (20+) that all have a unique personality and abilities.

-Expansive customization options. From hair styles, to clothing and accessories, there are a lot of options you can have with each character, and any item you unlock for one is available for any other. You can also fully manipulate the position, size, and angle of any accessory, allowing for some "interesting" options.

-Multiple playable stories. Each school has a playable storyline revolving around their respective 5 shinobi. While it tends to follow a story very similar to other schools, it is a nice introduction to each character and their individual and group goals. 

-Many side missions. Each character has 5 "Shinobi Heart" missions to complete, afterwards unlocking additional cosmetic options and library assets. It can take quite some time to get through all of them, 

-Fun over-the-top animations. Character abilities are very colorful and energetic, and it feels very satisfying to watch that combo meter go up.

-Very good as a "pick up, put down" game. If you only have a bit of time, you can do a mission or two before having to head out. It can also work well if you plan on sitting down for longer sessions.

Cons

-Characters start off somewhat weak. First few levels with any character means shallow combos, lower health and damage, and a tougher time in higher level missions. You may have to grind missions a bit with characters you are not as skilled with.

-Later missions drag on a bit. Bosses begin to have a lot more health, and use tactics that might make it a bit harder to take them down. Early missions can also be easily cheesed later on by abusing frantic mode.

-Some characters are overall a bit clunky to use. Characters like Mirai are difficult to play due to weak damage, and unreliable crowd clear without scrolls. Other characters may attack too slowly, and are easily interrupted mid combo.

-Story is "meh". Not really complicated, and each school is basically an alternate-world version of the others.



Misc/Other

-Humor and fan service is extremely hit or miss. I personally enjoy it, but some people may find it more or less detracting from the experience. It can be disabled in-game, however.

-The "Lingerie Lottery" is more or less just a time-consuming random-chance lottery to unlock 100+ pairs of different lingerie. There's also [b]NO[/b] achievement or unlocks tied to it besides the lingerie itself.

-It can be a little bit frustrating navigating between menus if you want to customize multiple characters.

-You can't play Shinobi Heart Missions as characters other than the one they are meant for, even after completion

-You will almost never use your ultimate shinobi art, as the requirements far outweigh the benefit. You must have 5 shinobi scrolls, and be at critical health to use it.



Overall, I actually really enjoyed Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus, and for more reasons than the fan service. The humor, while hit or miss, did make me laugh out loud at some moments, and the short-session method of slowly unlocking everything in the game made it a nice game to pick up and put down. I was able to obtain all achievements and unlock everything in game pretty reasonably, so it isn't too much of a challenge for any sort of completionist. Noticeable flaws would be that it can become a bit repetitive, and some missions begin to feel very similar to previous ones. Otherwise, I do definitely recommend this game, whether you are a fan of Dynasty Warriors-like games, or a connoisseur of fanservicey games.

8.5/10

[*] The cutscenes are terrible, when the characters speak their mouths just go up and down like a 3 second gif or something and the characters just slide around when they move off screen or look another way and there are a few times where half the characters speaking aren't even on screen, there are also a few times where you're just looking at a background image with a load of text all over it, its like they ran out of budget or something.
[*] There are only like 10 enemy types in the whole game if you don't count all the playable characters
[*] Throughout the whole game you're just playing as and fighting against the same 20 characters randomly over and over
[*] Some of the story missions are random and pointless, it's like half of it is filler
[*] Speaking of filler the gameplay itself feels like filler because once you know how to play you can speed through the levels in under 2 minutes and then have to sit through 10 minutes of cutscenes

[/list]

Overall its an alright game, better than some of the other anime games I have played before but you can tell it had a low budget and its not very detailed at all. I'd give it a 5.5/10.

33438079.review:
一直欠这系列一个好评，今天该补上了。


我第一次接触这系列便是这部《闪乱神乐-少女们的证明》，起初以为就是个打的爽的无双游戏，可玩久了之后反而是她的剧情吸引了我。

出于对剧情的好奇，我在PS4上购买了她的下一部，也就是《闪乱神乐-少女们的选择》，连续好几天一直玩，最后在通关的同时也达成了白金奖杯。

之后又赶上了《闪乱神乐PBS》的发售，当然要预购限定版了，只可惜当时资金紧张，买不起那个5周年纪念版，也就与那个等身大的雪泉半身鼠标垫无缘了。

之后是这系列的作者高木P发布消息说下一部要出在switch上，我二话不说直接就买了个switch。到现在，都没开过几次机，吃灰好几个月了。等发售新作了我再开机吧...

之后我又找同学借了个3DS补之前的老作品，本来是想买个3DS的，但只玩这一个游戏感觉犯不上，就一直没买。还好我同学愿意借给我，让我补完了之前的作品，我很是感谢他。（明明说只玩这一个游戏犯不上，却还是买了switch吃灰，打脸啊打脸）

3DS上一共发行了三部，分别是《少女们的真影》，《红莲的少女们》，《闪乱神乐2真红》，其中《红莲》就已经包含《真影》的全部剧情了，我买之前不知道，直到我点完了确认付款......


到今天，我已经补完了这系列所有的剧情。

你要问我说这个剧情哪里吸引我了，我只能说是"成长"吧。这系列主要讲的就是少女们为了成为神楽（カグラ）而努力奋斗的故事。第一部《真影》和《红莲》的时候，少女们进行忍転身是没有卷轴的，那时候的她们还都没有掌握秘伝忍法書的能力。对《真影》的故事比较好奇的，可以看动漫了解了解，但差距还是很大的。比方说3DS上的这几部都可以打妖魔，PC、PS4和动漫的这几部却从来没打过，最多也只是提到而已。


如果你全系列都玩过的话，你可以了解到她们每一个人所发生过的故事。

焰红莲队的5人是因为什么进入蛇女子学院成为恶忍的，又是因为什么离开了那个学校成为逃忍。
飞鸟和焰是如何相遇的，又为何成为了最好的朋友。
日影这个没有感情的人，又因为什么爆发过感情。
未来曾经因为自卑，又干过多少傻事。
柳生为了保护云雀，又做出过多大的牺牲。
焰为了拯救同伴，一个人斩杀了多少妖魔。
葛城为了保护父母，又怀着怎样的心情。
月闪的5人对黑影，又有着多深厚的感情。
四季为了爷爷的约定，又付出了多少的努力。
两奈兩備送走姐姐的时候，又下了多大的决心。
雅绯见到母亲的时候，又感动了我们多少人。

这些场景现在回想起来都历历在目。正是因为她们一直不断的努力，才会有今天敢直面面对心的勇气。(虽然剧情还没到打心的部分)（你问心是谁啊，建议玩玩EV，也就是《少女们的选择》，传说中的神级妖魔，睡觉的时候仅动一根手指头就能打败大道寺学姐）


总之这系列的故事还有很多，时而感动，时而欢乐，时而悲伤。如果你愿意去体会这个游戏所带来的故事，相信你会收获与奶子完全不一样的感受。

33301518.review:
I heard about Senran Kagura ages ago but for the most obvious reasons - basically boobs and panties - and while I'm not a huge fan of this kind of fan service (I honestly need "more" than panties, if you know what I mean), I would be lying if I said that i hadn't fun with it. Infact I started playing only a few days ago and I'm really enjoying my time with its fast paced combat and "dynasty warriors" elements. Plus there's also some nice story bits inside - more serious than I anticipated - and lots of customization options to unlock, including lingerie...for those who haven't enough of panties.

In other words, the game is lots of fun and even with the fan service that would cringe the most players (I played neptunia and even that game is more tame on the panty shots and boob jokes!), I definitely had a blast and can't play the next one.

But I do have some issues with the game that I couldn't ignore, both technical and gameplay, but let's start with the obvious one which is the technical issues. This game was supposedly a PSVITA game and it shows.

Arenas are super small and lack detail, the enemies aren't "that many" on screen and the game lacks a lot of graphical polish, especially on the characters, resulting in having bouncy boobs but barely anything else: infact it feels so weird to see breasts bouncing so wildly, while the girl's hair or skirt barely even move! Consistency people it's all I'm asking for!
Secondly, the arenas are super small and won't take more than, maybe, 5 minutes to complete each one, sometimes even less than a minute: on one part this is a good thing because as a portable game quick matches made more sense so that people could quickly end their game. On the other hand this is a pc port so it doesn't work "as good" as it should. 

Another small issues i encounted is how sometimes the character models are glitched after a fight, making them look weird and have weird stains on their bodies ("If you know what I mean"). It doesn't give too much issue so consider this a nitpick at best

For the rest, the game has many cutscenes à la visual novel but also not: it's often text on screen with spoken dialogue (which is japanese only, and makes sense even though I'm definitely not a fan of the japanese dubs) and besides some customization lacks and other technical issues, I have to at least admit I never had a slow down so that's something!

For the gameplay section i only have a few things to say, but they're really big and aan't be ignored: one is the fact that your enemies (the main cast mostly) will ALWAYS - I do mean ALWAYS - stun lock you and never let you go as soon as they hit you and even if i press jump to recover and dash to move away, they always seem to attack and stun lock me in position. That is not fun. Sure you have a "limit break" that allows you to break from stunlock at 10% of self hp, but I wish we had some sort of hit immunity for a while after certain hits. It feels like a cheap band-aid fix rather than a design choice.

And the combat, while fun and very fast paced, it's very repetitive and easy to learn: most girls have almost the same moves. I mean SUUUURE, they do have different move sets and changing into a shinobi  and Frantic mode changss their playstyle a little bit but I can't really say that they feel that different. I might have pressed triangle more times on a character than another and that's about it. 

For the repetitive part, the fact that the game has very quick matches that don't last more than 5 minutes, actually makes the game less boring: it never overstays its welcome and unlike Dynasty Warriors - where you legit spend nearly 10 to 20 in certain matches and maps are bigger too - you never feel "too" tired to keep playing. It's like eating small portions of food: you might feel sated, but you got space for another bite.

And with that said, all I can say is "give it a shot": I know there's Estival Versus and it seems bigger and better but I wanted to try this one since it's cheaper and has no dlc (it's included it seems). It has tons and tons of fan service but beneath it there's a pretty fun little game that just wants you to feel like a badass shinobi....or Kunoichi maybe?

I mean it's a shinobi academy but you only see girls so, why isn't a kunoichi academy? Bah, details....

33195493.review:
If you look past the gratifying fan-service and fluid hack-n-slash action, you may find surprisingly deep character arcs that will make you really like the characters. Suddenly they are no longer just a fan-service object to ogle at, but rather a real person with complicated real-life issues.

Ofcourse, the striperiffic fun will distract you time and again during battles, between the visual novel style story segments. There are 3 (+1 secret) ninja schools with atleast 5 girls in each of them. Every girl has their own individual stories on top of the main school story. Overall, that's a lot of hours worth playtime.

[b]THE GOOD[/b]

- Fun and Fluid Combat, complete with combos, parries and aerials.
- Easy to pick up and play.
- Solid 60 FPS (even on older PCs).
- Stylized Cel-shaded art style.
- Plenty of Waifus to choose from.
- Great variety in character's fighting style and secret ninja arts.
- Character customization in the form of dressing up.
- Surprisingly deep back stories for each girl explored during School story modes.
- The biggest "Plots" in this side of weeabooland.


[b]THE BAD[/b]
- Hardly any more players in multiplayer. Not like you came for that anyway.
- Disappointing lack of a photo mode during combat, in a fan-service filled game like this.
- Jiggle Physics that puts DOA to shame. Who doesn't love that, but this here is ridiculous!
- Personal missions for individual characters feels like those omake episodes with a silly plot.
- Most mooks are repetitive and easy. The rest are annoying (damn pandas).

[h1] 8/10 [/h1] CAME FOR THE "PLOT". STAYED FOR THE CHARACTERS!

33143339.review:
I think half a days worth of playing is enough to properly judge this game right?
No?
Who cares.

Senran Kagura is probably the HARDEST game I have ever had to review. Not that it's hard difficulty wise (more on that in a bit) but that it is just a weird game to talk about.

Bottom line though, this game is merely alright at worst and a fun distraction at best. 
Have you ever heard of Dynasty Warriors? If yes, you've played the better version of this game.


**GAMEPLAY:**
This game takes the traditional 1v1000 gameplay from Dynasty Warriors aaaaaaaand breaks it. Enemies are often too aggressive or just plain tanky when they shouldn't be, and the maps are often so small and boring that it turns into a repetitive button mashing nightmare, keeping in mind I love the 1v1000 game style. But this is like a bootleg reproduction of that style, where you are mostly doing the same attack hearing the same voice clip from the same playing character AND THAT'S ANOTHER THING.

Characters are barely unique from each other because there is a very easy solution to just about every single fight in the game that turns every character the same. Go Frantic, use your AoE. Instant kill on any target. 

Every character controls virtually the same, with vague differences in fighting style although the amount of impact feels rather muted to me. I think that the game would've benefitted from not trying to make these characters so fast since it sacrificed impact for moving at the speed of light when walking or slashing or... anything-ing.

**Animation**

In a 1v1000 style game you HAVE to get your animation correct, absolutely HAVE TO. Does this game?
Sort of.
This game has most of it's animation in Breast physics, and they suck. Look the breasts in this game for almost every character (Discount Mirai from this) are constantly bouncing and flopping so much fuckin DOA would blush. 
Being someone that this shouldn't bug it sadly bugs me GREATLY because things like hair and movement of the body get utterly trashed as a result of these boobie physics and their over emphasis. This game is animated like it was made on a budget, it looks like a budget game.

As for the graphics, their alright. See the issue here is that even in the anime style (which I am obviously okay with) the characters still have some serious issues keeping normal looking with things like the environment looking very blocky and certain faces looking ridiculously bad. Whenever you bust off the clothing of opposing Shinobi (which is a key feature of this game) the cutscenes afterwards will almost always have graphical bugs all over the character's body which is VERY noticiable.

**Originality**
What does this game bring to the 1v1000 formula that others have not?
Well, it's surprisingly dark for an anime game about tits. It also is pretty self aware about how silly the concept of itself can get. But if you've seen any ecchi anime in recent years you've seen this whole game. So this game brings very little to the table.


With it's lack of characters, awful animation, and rather unpretty graphical errors... well.
At least it stays at a consistent 60fps on a Dell Laptop.

5/10.

Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus has a lot going for it but there are some Caviats. 

Pro:
+It's Colourful and looks very nice
+It's well optimised, playing at 60FPS at all times, with no hint of dipping
+The Combat is very fast, furious and fun
+There's a lot to do, with various characters to level up, Missions to complete and Clothing items to collect
+It's pretty hilarious and doesn't take itself too seriously

Con:
-It's missing a lot of PC specific settings. Video settings are Basic
-The Ecchi stuff is sometimes a little 'too much'
-It can make you feel pretty silly to play it around other people
-It is a port, so there aren't many enemies on screen at once. 

If you're a big Weeaboo and you know it, you'll love it. The same is true if you like Brawlers like Dynasty Warriors or other Koei Tecmo games. It's entertaining and it's full of things to do, but just don't take it too seriously and you'll have fun.

32821209.review:
看见大多数评测都在说女乃子，这里写个对想买这款游戏的人稍微有点参考的意见吧，当然我是第一次接触这个系列，可能很多观点比较主观，请酌情参考。

此外，本系列另一作我有“附带*摇动图、场景效果动图、战斗动图”等的详细评测，大家可以感受一下这个系列：
http://pc.tgbus.com/pingce_30/89649/

    [b]事先提醒，这个游戏（闪乱）跟另一款（女武神）貌似有联动，买了这个送另一个的优惠券，买另一个送这个的优惠券（我先买的这个，送了优惠券我就去把女武神买了……又送了这个的优惠券……），没试过退款重买，还请实验。下面是我对这个游戏的看法。[/b]

    [h1]大致而言，这是一款毫不做作的萌豚向游戏。当然，如果你用明亮的双眼看，它也很健康[/h1]

所以，如果你抱着“只要有萌妹子什么都无所谓”的心态，那么下面不用看了，买吧，这游戏有很多性格鲜明的萌妹子，每一个都很萌，各种属性，高冷、傲娇、萝莉、反差萌（个人最喜欢戴面具那个……）等等……附带一堆服装、内衣、配饰，可以换装换一天……

声优也是十分给力，你选不同的妹子，菜单配音也会变化，几乎你在菜单中的任何操作都有相应配音，换个衣服，妹子都会有不同评价……（面具害羞妹子会说默认服装是我平时穿的衣服，换成其他会说自己不好看穿什么都一样……）

每一个妹子都有自己的专属任务，跟其他角色互动的对话也是十分有趣。建模和材质方面，看宣传视频就可以知道，卡通风格，要求不能太高……但是游戏中每个角色的动作都有自己的风格，动画包括表情动画都十分传神，算是弥补，配合卖力的声优，将角色塑造得很好。

总之，如果你的要求是“妹子”，“很多妹子”，“活蹦乱跳的妹子”，对其他方面要求不那么高，那么送你三个字，”买买买“，你不会后悔的。

    另外，这个游戏除了换装还有有爆衣、变装系统，最多到两块绷带和小内内，爆衣变装有特写动画，人物都附带*摇和*摇（←-←其实我不在意，看多了就腻了，还是声优更萌。 众：打死你啊！ (╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻ 最重要的事情最后才说！！）。

    接下来是详细评测。

    [h1]1.画面：[/h1]

无须多说，这类游戏画面一般要求不能太高，只能说还行。但是，这个游戏的UI和人物立绘之类的2D画面做得却是出奇的不错，买衣服的Shop里的大姐姐甚至都有*摇。3D方面，建模还是有明显棱角的，材质很一般，好在卡通渲染不影响实际体验，妹子还是一样萌……场景就有些问题了……不过谁管呢，我不信你会不看妹子盯着场景看……

    [h1]2.游戏性：[/h1]

这得看你吧它当做什么游戏。

如果是当做“无双”，那么的确是有群战场面，但是模式是来几批“一模一样”的小兵，一样的来一堆，大约十几二十个，十分耿直，小兵几乎没有AI，可以站撸，分数应该是不及格……

如果当成格斗，这个游戏动作模式跟猎天使魔女差不多，有两种攻击，一个远程一个近战，根据按键顺序有不同组合（但是组合不多），打中敌人或是被敌人打中硬质很大，新人很容易被电脑一套一套连死（并不华丽，单纯的平砍连死），反之亦然。游戏有跳跃，可以跳很高，空中也可以攻击，有简单连招。除此之外，附带一个格挡键，似乎有防反（未测试，按出来过），一个闪避键（别想骚操作，这个键貌似有冷却，用来跑路躲开敌人大招有点用），一个变身键（结合能量槽变装，回满血）。其他的，没了（还有个键组合好像是脱自己衣服……欢迎指正）。

单纯来看，这个系统极其不平衡和无聊，要么被别人平砍致死，要么平砍死别人，应该也是徘徊在及格边缘……

    但是，如果你不把它当做格斗或是无双游戏玩，那么，这个游戏就很有意思了。

    [b]首先是每个鲜明的角色[/b]，每个角色的动作模组都不同！动作完全不一样，甚至走路都不一样（跨书包的小萝莉会一蹦一蹦地……）。每个人的必杀也各有特色。这就为游戏增加了很多可玩性。每个角色也是需要培养的（有升级系统，但其实做完专属任务就基本解锁了所有动作了，升级额外加点血和攻防）。你可以当成角色培养游戏来玩。

    [b]其次是丰富到爆炸的收集要素（刷刷刷）[/b]，比如商店有个游戏，花钱抽胖次，一共98套，会抽到重复的，分十几个等级，way sexy、hot、nice之类的（毫不做作=_=）……WTMCB！每个角色任务还会解锁额外衣服，商店也会卖，包括校服（未变身前穿），忍者装（变身装），配饰（兔耳朵、项链眼睛之类的），内衣，成吨的衣服……此外还有语音、CG、音乐。全都要做任务（角色专属剧情、三个阵营的阵营剧情）或者刷钱买（战斗之后给）。如果你是收集癖或者强迫症，有得你刷了（个人感觉做角色专属剧情任务赚点钱买喜欢的就够了）。

    [b]然后是沉浸感和氛围[/b]，这些个人感觉是这游戏最棒的地方。首先，你会选择自己的“忍者学校”和“角色”，之后你就身处一个大厅里，打开菜单可以选“做任务”，“商店”，“换装”，“切换学校、角色”之类的，也可以去大厅的对应地方触发菜单功能。你的操作角色都有反馈语音。换角色的时候两个角色还会互相打招呼交接。你做完任务，回到大厅，所有人还会给你打招呼。这些细节我个人感觉是十分亲切的，会让你感觉这些角色是真的活着一样。这个游戏尽管自由度并不高，没办法做很多角色互动，但是这些小细节却能让玩家感到轻松，融入游戏里。尤其感谢声优，让这个游戏热热闹闹的，你玩完绝对也会这么想的。

    [h1]3.剧情：[/h1]

有人会关注剧情么……这个游戏没有中文，所以我也懒得看了……开场有段大叔介绍，直接跳了……角色个人任务，我目前只做了yumi和murakumo两个人的，已经被反差萌的murakumo（平时戴着面具充大姐头，实际上是面具依存症的不自信软萌妹）萌出血……两个都很有趣（高冷有点小呆的yumi经过艰难险阻终于发现了正义的真理：可爱即是正义……marukumo被人抢了面具一路快哭着找面具……）主线我真不好说……不过我不信风格会有什么大的变化……应该还是很轻松有趣吧？吧？吧（望一眼小圆）……

    [h1]4.音乐：[/h1]

我不太懂音乐，感觉有些和风，总之就是好听……你要说不好听我也没办法……总之我开着大厅听着音乐写的这篇评测……另外，这游戏声优真勤奋……感觉就是你选了角色，这角色就一直跟在你身边一样……做什么事情都会说几句话出来秀一下存在感……

   [h1]5.操作、优化、bug之类：[/h1]

操作的话，我是用的Xbox one手柄玩，还可以。bug我没遇到过……有些人反映游戏会默认集显……我因为是最近换的笔记本，1050ti，没遇到什么问题……这游戏画面没有性能设置选项，可能要去显卡控制面板里设置。另外，闪乱这款游戏还有另一作比较新，但是贵一点，DLC比较多，我暂时没买，大家也可以对比着看看。

    暂时就这么多，毕竟这游戏我还没深入了解，但个人感觉就这个价格而言买了应该是不亏的。我打折入的。

    [h1]总结：[/h1]

如果你想玩一款无双游戏或者格斗游戏附带看妹子，那么这个游戏也许不适合你，它的系统还不太完善。但如果你的目的本身就是活蹦乱跳、吵吵闹闹的可爱角色，对动作要求不那么高，喜欢收集要素、喜欢换装，那么这个精心制作的游戏绝对适合你。（虽然我不太在意，还是再提一下吧，*摇*摇变身换装爆衣……╮(╯_╰)╭其实我不在意。 众：guna！）

    ps：选择角色后，做任务时应该有很多角色打不过第一个电脑，被一套连死……（等级1血量薄攻击力低都是小事，主要动作没解锁），这个时候，请找箱子之类的东西，打碎吃能量，用远程攻击（或者有的角色远距离攻击）磨血，敌人眩晕后上去打，不要莽，自己血量快空变身回血。实在打不过，活用防御键，回合制……

    以上。

32629354.review:
¿Que puedo decir? Me encanto este juego, sin duda represento bastante las ganas de jugar en pc para lograr jugar titulos que son exclusivos de ciertas consolas y pc, en este caso Senran Kagura fue un buen juego para mi, el sistema de peleas logro entretener a mis amigos y a mi de manera que fue demasiado atractivo, aun que para algunos se les dificulto bastante el adaptarse para poder jugarlo adecuadamente, tambien si puedo decir es que le juego mas alla de la historia (que nadie vino por la historia a decir verdad) logro dejarme entretenido por querer seguir utilizando a los personajes, cada uno diferente a otro y puedes probar con cualquiera que gustes, para ser la entrega del año del 2014 no estuvo nada mal.

Si debo decir las ventajas de tenerlo es la forma tan fluido que se siente y la diversion que se da a pesar de que las fases son repetidas creeme que no es algo que te arruinara la experiencia de juego ya que trataras de buscar tu punto de diversion (fanservice) como gustes.

Pues que decir mas que 8.5/10

Nuevamente no le pongo el 10 por los siguientes motivos:
-Camara no fija
-Se centra mas en la ropa interior en comprar objetos que en la ropa mas llamativa
-Los escenarios son repetidos 
-llega a ser aburrido cuando lo acabas totalmente (los logros si le pones empeño en 35 horas los acabas)
-No detecta otro mando que no sea Xbox 360 como preferencia
-La configuracion del teclado esta un poco incomoda y basta con que la configures tu mismo
-Pocos usuarios en linea para jugar (por 3 meses solo 2 veces eh visto que gente se conecta a jugarlo)
-Totalmente en ingles.

Se que los puntos en contra de este juego no son tan batallosos pero para mi en su momento fue complicado jugarlo de esa manera si no tienes un mando y posiblemente te confundas demasiado.

En todo caso recomendado por si gustas del fanservice y un sistema bastante comodo en peleas y crear combos con personajes que le rebota el busto.

32227672.review:
I finally did it. I finally finished my 100% clear of this game.

This was a very fun experience. Obviously since it's Senran Kagura you'll come into this game expecting a ton of fan service and you wouldn't be wrong. Nothing is too over the top though. I wouldn't be emberassed to play this in front of anyone I know or something like that.

The characters all have their own fighting style that you have to learn, but it's not too overbearing since the combos are all very similar. The combat is too "basic" for some poeple, but I found it to be enjoyable. 

I treated this game more like a visual novel than a fighter, and I had a great experience. All of the characters have their own stories to work your way through, learning about their backgrounds and why they became ninjas. The combat gives you a nice break from reading. I think it was very well balanced.

There's a ton of items/outfits/lingerie that you can mess around with, giving yourself some very unique characters.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience playing Shinovi Versus and I look forward to being able to buying and playing Estival Versus in the future.

32215462.review:
Well... I was gifted this game as a "challenge" of sorts to suffer through it.

It's kinda fun to waste time with for a bit, I suppose, but the gameplay gets repetetive around 10 minutes in, so if you're here for that, I wouldn't really bother.

At least if there was some sort of objectives to fulfill, but really just hitting Frantic Mode, murdering a bunch of chaff, and then using your super to 1hko the "boss" really finishes it fast.

I respect the devs for being completely over the top and reveling in it, and their PR amuses me to no end, but as far as a "game" goes... Aside from the aesthetic, which let's face it you can find all that for free all over the internet via a Let's Play or even just go ahead and find unedited stuff on many other websites, there's really nothing here that I personally enjoy.

Also, the story is watered down Bud Light as far as stories go as is its method of delivery. I can't really reccomend it, but I also highly suspect I am not the target audience.

'interesting' multiplayer modes (UNDERSTORM- lollll). 

All in all, this series is great if you're looking for something to play where you can sit back, relax, and grin like an idiot because you bought a legitimately fun game that doesn't take itself the least bit serious.

秘传忍法！二刀缭斩!
秘传忍法！飞燕凤闪·一式!

秘传忍法！乌贼卷!
秘传忍法！忍兔冲击!

《闪乱神乐》是由Marvelous AQL（原Marvelous Entertainment）开发的游戏系列
《闪乱神乐 -少女们的真影-》发售于2011年9月22日，登陆任天堂3DS平台。
《闪乱神乐 Burst -红莲的少女们-》发售于2012年8月30日，作为原作的续作，包含原作内容。
《闪乱神乐 NewWave》发售于2012年11月28日，为网络游戏。
《闪乱神乐 忍者对决 -少女们的证明-》发售于2013年2月28日，登陆PlayStation Vita平台。
《忍乳负重 闪乱神乐》发售于2014年3月20日，登陆PlayStation Vita平台。
《闪乱神乐2 -真红-》发售于2014年8月7日，登陆任天堂3DS平台。
《闪乱神乐 ESTIVAL VERSUS -少女们的选择-》发售于2015年3月26日，登陆PlayStation Vita与PlayStation 4平台。
《闪乱神乐:沙滩戏水》发售于2017年3月16日，登陆PlayStation 4平台。
《闪乱神乐》同时还具有小说，电视动画，等周边产品，电视动画《闪乱神乐》由ARTLAND制作，总共12话+6话特典，2013年1月6日开始播放。

《闪乱神乐 忍者对决 -少女们的证明-》最初为PlayStation Vita平台发售的游戏，移植PC版《SENRAN KAGURA SHINOVI VERSUS》于2016年6月2日登陆steam平台，语言版本为英语和日语，支持日语完全音频。

《闪乱神乐》描绘了一个存在忍者的现代世界，忍者们属于各个组织，被各类大人物雇佣，于是，就出现了代表黑暗的恶忍，为了对抗，国家在国立半藏学院中秘密成立机构，培养善忍，对抗邪恶。

《闪乱神乐 忍者对决 -少女们的证明-》中登场的角色为
 国立半藏学院	 飞鸟	 斑鸠	 葛城	 柳生	 云雀	 雪泉
 死塾月闪女学馆	 雪泉	 嶪	 夜樱	 四季	 美野里	 
 秘立蛇女子学馆	 雅绯	 紫	 忌梦	 两備	 两奈	 
 焰红莲队	 焰	 咏	 日影	 未来	 春花

《闪乱神乐 忍者对决 -少女们的证明-》包含
故事模式：
讲述了在学炎祭中国立半藏学院，死塾月闪女学馆，秘立蛇女子学馆，焰红莲队的相关剧情及战斗，从不同组织的角度出发，每个组织有不同的章节和敌人，当玩家进行不同章节时，角色处于不同的相关背景环境，可以进行自由移动和互动。
特殊任务模式：
包含了有关人物和剧情的特殊任务。
忍道场：
多人对战模式，可支持在线对战，具有多种对战方式，可以选择游戏中的角色与其他玩家进行对战。
更衣室：
在更衣室中，玩家可以观赏，购买，更换角色的服饰，服饰分为各种部位和不同种类，获取全部内衣需要完成商店的抽奖。
商店：
在商店中，玩家可以购买游戏相关内容和进行内衣的抽奖。

正義のために舞い忍びます！
悪の定めに舞い殉じよう！

Bought Senran Kagura partially as a joke and partially for the anime tiddy. Ended up sinking close to a hundred hours into the game. Shinovi Versus is a 3D fighter/musou with an extensive storymode, nearly two dozen playable characters and near endless cosmetic customization AKA waifu dress-up. Even after getting an A-rank with every character in every mission on all difficulties, purchasing every cosmetic item from the in-game store and unlocking every achievement, I still find myself hungry for more of Senran Kagura's satisfying gameplay. The fanservice becomes secondary to the solid gameplay, which took me by surprise.

31480897.review:
Si te interesa este juego no es por la jugabilidad o la historia, vienes a ver tetas, pues dejame decirte que encontraras lo que buscas.

Si, Senran Kagura esta repleto de tetas botando por todos lados, pero realmente es mas que solo eso.
Para empezar, como se puede medio apreciar en el video trailer, tiene una jugabilidad Hack and slash. (Este genero tiene muchos otros nombres, dejemoslo en que es picarle a lo loco y matar personajes debiles). Esto representa una de las dos jugabilidades del juego, la otra se basa en peleas muy rapidas, con diversos combos, poderes especiales y transformaciones.

Despues de eso, la otra parte mas importante que puedo mencionar es el dressing room, todos los personajes son customizables, es muy importante mencionar esto por que pasas una cantidad similar de tiempo en los combates como en el cambio de vestuario (esto es literal por cierto). La personalizacion es bastante amplia, aunque despues de unas horas comienza a verse un tanto limitada. 

La vestimenta se parte en 5 secciones, ropa, ropa despues de transformarse, lenceria (IMPORTANTE), estilo de cabello y por ultimo accesorios, al inicio solo tienes un espacio, pero puedes comprar unos cuanto mas, igual los accesorios son bastante mediocres, muchos ni siquiera encajan bien con el modelo del personaje.

¿Cuanto me durara el juego? Pues mas o menos lo mismo que dures en una paja xD
No ya en serio, el juego te durara una cantidad decente de horas puesto que es bastante extenso, primero se parte en 4 escuelas de shinovis, cada escuela cuenta con 24 misiones de historias, a su vez cada escuela alberga a 5 chicas, y cada una viene con 5 misiones, entonces si 4x24, 4x5 y luego otra vez se multiplica por 5, se suman los dos resultados, luego le resto el numero de pajas que llevo hasta ahora...
Al final termina dando un total de 196 misiones aproximadamente, yo llevo aproximadamente unas 70 en 14 horas jugadas, para que se haga una idea de cuanto dura cada mision y por ende, cuanto dura el juego.

¿Lo malo? 
Pues mira, hay de donde sacarle a este punto, para empezar es increiblemente repetitivo, si, tiene un monton de misiones, pero todas son lo mismo, llegas, oprimes todo a lo tonto, llega el enemigo principal, le das en su madre y se termina, otra vez pero con diferentes personajes.
Ademas, las peleas son lo mas facil que puede haber, literalmente pueden terminarse en escasos segundos. La razon es que los creadores pensaron en batallas donde se mataban una y otra vez, se los digo por que lo jugue una vez con un amigo en Online, mueres y revives varias veces.
Pero esto no pasa en el modo historia, la derrotas una vez y se termino, por eso digo que no estan bien pensadas las peleas, deberias hacer a los personajes mas duros no lo se.

Tengo una tostadora. ¿Podre jugarlo? 
Depende, si no eres muy orgulloso con la resolucion y los graficos si, por que por alguna razon, este juego necesita un buen procesador para correrlo, en caso de que estes como yo y tengas apenas 2 tristes GHz, entonces tendras que resignarte y jugarlo en una resolucion muy muy baja para alcanzar los 60fps (se necesitan 60, con poquito menos ya se vuelve injugable)

Bueno, la historia es mala. ¿Que hay del Online?
Una porqueria, una total porqueria, arriba digo que ocupas mucho procesador para jugarlo bien, pues para el online ocupas el triple, cuando entre con un amigo, ambos teniamos un enorme problema de fps, no pasabamos de los 15fps, ademas de que nos teletransportabamos y cosas similares. Para mi este juego practcamente no tiene online, por que aunque pudieras jugarlo estable, carece de comunidad activa.

Entonces... ¿Lo compro?
Pues si lo recomiendo, pero es demasiado caro para los enormes defectos que tiene, por que el juego si es divertido, si te ayuda a matar el tiempo y si alienta a que te masturbes de vez en cuando, pero solo es rentable si lo tomas en un descuento, por que para mi 270 pesos (mexicanos) me parece demasiado, con ese dinero me puedo comprar otras cosas que me den muchas mas horas o que sean mas divertidos.
En cambio si lo tomas en unos 120 pesos mas o menos, pues ya esta un poco mejor, asi que ahi esta mi veredicto, si es buena idea comprarlo si esta descuento, o claro si tienes mucho dinero.

31370660.review:
hehehehehe....boobs.........joking aside lets do this review. I will be going over the game in a pro/ con style and end it with my final thoughts on the game. I will try to be as detailed as can.

Pro:
      The game is nice looking. I really enjoy the battle scenery and i like the pictures used in the VN text dump sections. The models for the characters are solid though there are moments where there is come clipping or Z fighting but it is small and not really a big deal.

       The music is fantastic, the sad song that plays at those moments of deep sorrow is on point. Really catches the entire mood of the situation as well as combat music is nicely varied so theres alot to listen too. Also if you want there is also voices of the characters you can listen to if thats what you want to do....i dont speak any other language besides english soo i dont understand it....dont remember if it is englished subtitled for the voice recordings.

        The game story is good. Well to be fair most of the game has a good to great story. At the worst possible scenario aka the gensson squad or however you spell it; i didnt like their story. It just was not that interesting but besides that the rest of the game is great.

         Characters are great. Theres a lot of different characters that have different combat styles so you can never get tired from the repetitive fight till enemy hp reaches 0 moments because the game in story mode switches you up between 5 girls that are on their respetive team. Most are pretty nice to play as but there are a few that when you are forced to play as the combat is such as drag and i say that for the slow hitters and the weak attackers.

         Character dialog is solid. I did find a good ammount of characters i enjoyed in the game and i am petty so if their combat sucked in the game i immediantly hated them as a character but in the VN sections the remaining characters were on a spectrum of ok to very enjoyable. Most were very enjoyable except the Gensson squad, shiki was the only good one i enjoyed because her dialog was fun to read and her combat was really cool.

        Theres different costumes, hairstyles, and acessories to use. Technically you can dress up any character how you want them which is really nice. I didnt do that often but i got to say i enjoy rin alot that the leader of hanzo has her shinobi costume. I didnt change anyone's hair styles because i was never interested in that because all i wanted to do was fight and enjoy the story....not play dress up but hey the option is there if you want it.

         Rpg elements. I dont know why but i always enjoy in RPG games that when i level up i feel stronger and here i do feel stronger whether i take more hits, visually see my hp bar get progressively bigger, or deal more damage to end fights faster. I like feeling like a badass. As you level up you gain more attacks to chain in the combo which is awsome to have a more flashy combo but with exp gain you also gain exp for your mastery skills. They act as passive abilities but i dont really focus on them and never saw anything really amazing or must have.

Con:
      Enemy AI is cheap. Many times when fighting the goons especially the ravens or bird like enemies. They always spawn in with an attack off screen so it maks the dodge slim to none. Its not fair that they get a cheap shot like that. Also the AI shinobi's always act cheap the further you are in the story mode. They spam cheap attacks and stun lock you pretty easy. Sure you can get out with a limit break but it is frustrating to see that everytime you get one hit on them they get 20 on you because of cheap tactics.

      The frame rate is horrible. The game is not well optimized, the ingame combat is super sluggish probably hitting 10fps if even that unless if you have a nivida card and set it to high processing or whatever it says. Then the game will run alot better frame wise. It might not be that big of a deal but why make it so the player needs to work around it?

Conclusion:
        Honestly i thought the game was great and was tons of fun from the story, music, gameplay, and characters. It is realy hard to choose what character i truely enjoyed that is how much i enjoyed of many characters provided. Also i forgot to mention that their was battle damage on clothing so you slowly strip away clothing of your oponents. Thought i should mention that. Sure i had frame rate issues at first till i fixed it because the hyperdimension neptunia rebirth 2 game had the same issue with the frame rate. There are so much good that this game provides that it is hard not to reccomend the game to friends or to other players in general. The game is more than eye candy with boobs and what not. With the developing characters it adds an understanding of a character's struggle in a given situation and hopefully the player feels attached through the story and invested in the characters through the journey.

Pros:
- 208 missions to beat (97 Story + 110 side-missions + After story fight),
- Silk smooth 60FPS (even on pretty bad 740M),
- Surprisingly entertaining story (4 Schools - 4 stories, lots of funny moments, even have few really touching moments),
- 22 Characters (each with different fightstyle),
- Not bad graphic (it not "over the top" but still good enough),
- Very fast paced action fits perfectly to game like this,
- Voice Acting (Asami Imai as Ikaruga is more than perfect, other VAs are awesome too).
- Many accesorries to personalize girls,
- Fanservice (yeah i like it, bite me! ).
- Little additional pro for perverts like me - Many yuri teases.

Cons:
- Graphic could be better ( but it's not bad),
- Sometimes hairs/clothes pass through 3D models, it looks quite funny,
- Too easy (except some of Chapter 5 missions and DLC vs Rin fight missions are easy even on "Hard" difficulty)
- Oppai made from jello (really, i love fanservice, but these are hilarious, they [almost] all wearing bras! Why their "plots" jiggling like crazy ?)
- oh, yeah, multiplayer is pretty much dead (wasn't a problem for me).

If you like / are resistant to fanservice and like fighting games - Highly recommending this game.

31033879.review:
Para analizar este juego toca verlo en 3 puntos:
1.-La historia es muy típica del anime, no esperes perderte en el lore de este juego, si quieres un abre bocas busca: "senran kagura", es el anime de este juego y la linea en cuanto a historia es la misma, por lo tanto no es un juego con el lore más elaborado pero le es fiel por lo menos a su base; si eres un aficionado del anime estoy seguro que no te importara mucho la carencia que tiene la trama.
2-Su jugabilidad aunque no llega a ser repetitiva porque cada personaje es unico y tienen diferentes abilidades y progresión de nivel, puede resultar un poco aburrida, las misiones si son repetitivas y al final tu recompensa por completar la misión es un poco de historia que no tiene mucho que ver con lo que acabas de ejecutar como jugador, aun así pienso que si eres un chino farmer y te gusta subir de nivel y comprobar que recompensa trae esta acción te gustará bastante el sistema de niveles.
3-Su multijugador es nulo, tengo el platino solo porque los logros enfocados al multi se podían conseguir en una partida privada con bots, no tocarás el multijugador, creeme.

Finalmente diré que es un juego de niñas anime que cuando pelean se quitan partes de la ropa (con censura) y existe un mod con el que puedes quitar la censura y es miu facil de instalar y no te afecta en lo absoluto tu experiencia de juego.
Al final la historia de enganchará y te dará una que otra sorpresa mientras más avances, te puedes sacar el platino del juego solo en 30 horas como es mi caso y ahora le daré fuertemente al estival versus ya que por lo que se ve mejoraron muchos aspectos de este.
Muy recomendado si te encanta el anime y los juegos de peleas (hay combos rotísimos) así que no esperes más y compralo.

-Mega

Your hopes get dashed at every turn from start to finish. You begin hoping for good combat (its not). After you're dissapointed by that, you'll hope that the story is at least decent (it isnt). What you're left with after play this game if you dont happen to be one of its hardcore fans is a large portion of dissapointment.

30885132.review:
Eu preciso confessar, primeiramente eu vi esse jogo e pensei "Uau, garotas colegiais brigando e se rasgando!! Ja é!!", e para minha surpresa o jogo é exatamente isso mas não somente isso.

Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus possui um dos melhores sistemas de combate de um jogo nesse estilo (Hack'n Slash) dezenas de personagens com estilos de luta diferentes e um modo história de cair o queixo.

A história foi o que realmente me surpreendeu aqui, eu não estava esperando muito e fui agraciado com uma trama rica, envolvente e profunda que te prende, te deixa querendo saber mais. Uma narrativa agradavel, contada no ponto de vista de varias personagens difrentes que em momentos fica divertida com varias piadas e situações engraçadas e em outros momentos fica tensa com problemas sérios envolvendo morte e vingança. 

Personagens bem construídos com personalidades únicas te fazem criar um vinculo de afinidade e querer jogar cada vez mais.

Recomendo Shinovi Versus para aqueles que gostam de garotas lutando e se rasgando e para aqueles que gostam de uma boa historia.

30813865.review:
Lacking, but really fun action.

The good:
+Very fast paced action, the girls respond to your inputs almost instantly with attacks and cancellations, a real treat to action fans, unlike the sequel Estival Versus, which completely butchered this and the fast fluid combat is nowhere to be found.
+Ludicrous fanservice, done in an exagerated but also funny way. I often chuckled to the jokes instead of cringing, which is nice 
+The story and the girls' backgrounds are entertaining, surprisingly deep, and sometimes even dark.
+Loading times not notwithstanding, the game runs very nicely with no slowdowns no matter how fast you're performing comboes in the thousands, on dozens of enemies at once.
+Big and varied roster, despite the simple movesets.

The bad:
-Content wise there's only the story and the "Shinobi Girls Hearts" side missions, which is relatively enough but poor replay value. I'd have liked some extra modes where you could just fight with your favorite characters instead of replaying story missions.
-Relatively long and frequent loadings, pretty lame for a game that doesn't have huge scenarios nor has super demanding graphics.

The so so:
+-The combat is pretty shallow/simple, but I found that given how fast and fluid it is, the simplistic controls are more than enough to have plenty of fun.
+-The dificulty ranges from fun enough to non-existent even on hard depending on level and character

30630562.review:
I enjoyed all of the Senran Kagura games released for steam thus far. That is to say: Senran Kagura Shinovi versus, Senran Kagura Bon Appetit, and soon to be Senran Kagura Estival Versus (At the time of this review, it, and the DLC for it are being downloaded).

The action of this game is fun and rewarding with "special views" and flashy combos. Each of the characters play different and provide a unique experience for each one. Each character has a personality and different elements to them to keep them from feeling too sterotypical and refreshing. 

The retention for this game is alright. It isnt the most replayable thing in the world though it can offer a lot of play time and replayability for the right people. 

I recommend this game on sale, though it doesnt go on sale often enough. If it ever goes on sale it is worth picking up!

30608621.review:
マーベラス社の利益に大幅に貢献し
今や長期シリーズ化した
最胸の爆乳ハイパーバトル(自称)閃乱カグラ。
日本語は実装されています。

国立半蔵学院
死塾月閃女学館
秘立蛇女子学園の三つから学園を選択して
女子高生を更衣室でセクハラしたり
敵の服を剥きながらストーリーを進めていきます。

[h1] ・アクション性[/h1]
アクション性は一言で言えば無双系です。
大勢の敵を広範囲攻撃やコンボで
薙ぎ倒してボスを引きずり出します。

・弱攻撃
・強攻撃
・敵が吹っ飛んだ時にBでエリアル
・緊急回避(空中可)
・サイクバースト
・ガード
・ダッシュ
・二段ジャンプ
・弾き
・超必殺各キャラ二種類
・特殊イベント後、瀕死の時に逆転技

他にも自ら脱衣して防御を犠牲にして
攻撃力を上げる命駆システムなど
アクション性は無難に整っています。

敵が下着状態の時に超必殺でフィニッシュすると
下着を破壊、逆転奥義で倒すと泣かせて全裸KOなど
紳士淑女へのケアも行き届いています。


[h1]・個人的な不満点 [/h1]
プレイ中に個人的に感じた不満点ですが
投げが無いなど細かい部分は数多くありますが
お色気ジャンルとして見るなら

1.クリア評価
被弾の少なさとクリア時間の早さが影響しますが
倒し方は評価に含まれないため、
ゲームの目玉である全裸KOを狙うと時間がかかり
評価が下がりやすくなるというお色気ゲーの矛盾があります。

2.能力値のバランス
LVが少し上がると敵の攻撃を被弾しても
全く減らなくなりヌルゲーになります。
さらにコチラの火力が大幅に上がり、
服を剥く前に倒し易くなり、全裸KOを狙いにくくなる
うっふんゲーの矛盾があります。

3.露出の低い服が少ない
露出の低い相手を剥くのが
個人的に脱衣の醍醐味だと思います。
KOFで脱衣KOは人々の記憶に残っても
不知火舞の演出が痴女と化していたのは
誰も話題にしないが如く。

コスチュームは元々半裸の様な格好や
布の少ない衣装が多いので
あまり剥いても変わらない衣装が多めです。
純粋に服を剥きたい方への配慮は今ひとつです。

4.Co-opがない
これは個人的な願望ですが、
無双系ではCo-opが結構モチベーションになるので
あればさらに評価が高かったです。


[h1]・総評[/h1]
アクションゲームとしてのバランスは大味ですが、
お色気ゲーとしては熱意を感じます。

先人達が築いた長寿ブランドの続編を中途半端に
萌えゲーやギャルゲー化する開発はﾌｧｯｸ!( ﾟдﾟ)と思いますが、
ぎゃるがんやどきどき魔女神判、
閃乱カグラのように開発者が「全力でこういう作品を造る！」と
新規タイトルで気合いを入れて
メリハリをつけているゲームは個人的に敬意を表します。
CSより安く、さらに日本語実装なのも
おま国問題の多いSteamでは評価の一つです。

ちょっと気楽なアクションをやりたい人や
おっぱい星人は購入を検討してもいいと思います。

30597641.review:
良い点
・おっぱい、おしり、着せ替え
・一応成長要素がある（RPGという程ではないですが負けまくってれば楽になっていくのは嬉しい）
・↓→弱Pとかめんどくさいコマンドが無く、XXXXXYみたいな簡素なコマンド。おっぱいのために複雑な操作なんか覚えたくないですよね。
・携帯ゲーム機で出た時はDLC含めて結構なお値段がしたらしいですが、全部込みでお値打ち価格。

悪い点
アクションとしては雑な作りですが、それでいいんです。おっぱいが目的ですから。
ただ、その雑さがプレイヤーが爽快という方向に限られていないあたりが難点。
ハメが使えるし、使われまくります。俺は女の子にハメたいのであって女の子にハメられたいわけではないです。まあ、春花様にハメてもらえるのならまんざらでもないですが、雅緋あたりにハメられるとイラつきますよね。正々堂々とハメさせろと言いたくなります。衣装破壊でとっとと股を開かせればいいのですが強いんですよ敵。

それと訓練所で動かない敵を相手に練習できるのですが、木偶人形ではつまらないですよね。両奈ちゃんがおしり差し出してひたすら待機してるのなら練習して百連閃を撃ち込みまくるのですが。


あとは細かい点を挙げるとこんなもの。
・ノーマルとハードしか無いのですが、格ゲー苦手勢にとってはノーマルでもストレスで、イージーが欲しい所です。
・十字キー↑で敵をロックオンするのですが、これ忘れて秘伝忍法（ゲージ消費技）使うと盛大に空振りしたりします。秘伝忍法使う時は大体ボスと一対一の時なので、ある程度オートロックして欲しいです。
・道中で雑魚100人前後と闘う→ボス戦というのが基本的な流れですが、ボス戦で負けると道中からやり直しです。ボスの所からコンティニューで良かったと思う。

全体的にもっと知能指数を低くしておっぱいとおしりの道を究めて欲しいゲームです。おすすめ。

가장 큰 문제가 이 게임은 락온이 불완전합니다.
락온을 해도 적이 내 뒤로 이동하면 시점이 자동이동하는 것이 아닙니다.
그래서 시점을 옮기는 버튼을 따로 둘러서 화면을 돌려야 하는데
문제는 이 락온이 거리에 따라서도 풀린다는 점입니다.

30521020.review:
Very repetitive. Unlike some of the Dynasty Warrior games, where you can combine light and heavy attacks to do a variety of different combos, this game has almost no variety in that regard. 

The one interesting mechanic is the transformation. Transformations heal you and allow you to use your special moves, but you can only transform once per fight. It's an interesting little bit of resource management that I really liked.

Another positive point is the soundtrack. It has a bunch of rock remixes of classical music. I love it.

On the sexual nature of the game: I'm no prude, but it's a little excessive. I was very pleased to find that there were many different costumes to unlock, but I was a bit disappointed when I found out that ALL of it is geared towards various fetishes. Its very limitng, and makes the wide variety of costumes actually fairly boring. Very few of the costumes look nice outside of their sexual appeal. Even then, most of the costumes aren't really all that sexy, in my opinion. I'd be all for sexy girlfs fighting in sexy outfits. I just don't think this game does a very good job of it.

On the plus side, some of the girls default costumes look great. Yumi and Hikage's outfits are very sexy and cool, and I love Asuka's Strider-esque scarf.

Also, I don't think this is outright stated in the game, but the implication I get is that not all the girls are over the age of 18. I didn't know this until after I bought and played the game. It's a bit icky, and really unnecessary. Nothing about the story necessitates the girls being underaged. One of the younger characters is a masochist who begs other characters to beat her. Having a young teenager do something like that is a bit much, I think. I guess it's not HUGE deal, since they're just animated characters. But I know it would bother some people, so I thought it was worth bringing up.

If they refine the combat system and improve the costume options, then I could really enjoy this series. For now, though, there are better action games you could be playing, and better booby anime you could be watching.

Everyone has already written things in detail so I will just note a few things.
Pros-
Boobs-butt-refernces to boobs/butt being shown by accident unbeknownst to the flasher

story is generic but not stupid

music is nice

combat can be fun

Cons-
BOOBS AND BUTTS/ASS whatever you like to call parts of the body: I know that is the type of game this is but I need to type this out- you don't notice it much while fighting regularly, you notice them when the ripped clothes scenes and transformation cutscenes happen HOWEVER while this can be disabled (why would you... if you do't care to look there are plenty of much much better fighting games..just minus the oppai...) it is better to leave them on b/c that is 90% of the content. PROBLEM is that the cutscenes can inerupt combos which the enemy will magically free herself from just b/c a scene happened, like i said, it is fine if you disable them, you can cont. the combbo, but there goes your content...

Gets repetitve

ONLINE... well ppl say there are issues of lag and unbalanaced characters.. IDK nobody plays online... typicall what one would hope to be the main portion of a fighting game like this..

Characters ARE NOT balanced I often like diversity in games, you go mage I go swordmaster whatever fits YOUR personality and play style.. Not all characters are equal here... after learning how to play all the characters, I have know learned 1 important thing. I am severely disadvantaged if I am playing the brat throwing jolly ranchers while facing the girls using swords/daggers/ and firearms.. Some characters are great, others are ok, some suck...

Difficulty: Normal/Hard Hard Normal enemies have the intelligence of acorns...I was mid-mission and had my reasons for wanting to lower my hp (won't explain but it is for Ultimate skill) i sat there for like 5 minutes AFK and the enemy BOSS hit me 4x... Hard is also boringly easy some missions did give me trouble b/c I am bad with dealing w/ giant pandas... The only times I really lost were the begining when I was lvl 1 and didn't know what button was to attack, and when I deliberately let the enemy take me down to 20% hp in hopes of using ultimate skill, just to accidently fall into one of their chain attacks.

Chain attacks... well like i said, combat can be kinda fun, if you are the one attacking, chains are sometimes easy as hell to escape, and sometimes you are trapped with the highest stats at full hp in 1 enemy chain attack that kills you.. (there is a blast move to get them off at the cost of some hp, this really only troubled me when i had  low hp to begin with for other reasons (if hp is too low you cant use that move and may be trapped in the chain for a while.)

That... was much more than i hoped to type.. I am sorry. But you might be wondering why I gave this a positive review with just a bunch of negative things to say... Well... Oppai, panties, mod it to get rid of pesky censorship. Lolis #LoliIsJustice and #FlatIsJustice, outfits you can pick out to appease all of your desires... Yeah IDK why I am giving this a positive review.. I don't feel right giving it pos/neg.. i wish steam had a "Meh" rating... I gave it a positive b/c all said and done, I had fun with it. cute little fighting game I guess.

30446343.review:
[Insert generic unfunny meme #752 in desperate attempt to appear funny so people notice me.] 

With that out of the way I will say that I first heard of Senran Kagura while browsing /v/ years ago and the art grabbed my attention. When I heard it was coming on PC I figured may as well get it to see if the actual game is any good. I remember it released during my final night shift for the week back in summer and I snuck my laptop at reception so I can download it, because no internet down in the basement where the staff stayed. I tried it out after getting a few hours of sleep as I had the next two days off and I pretty much wasted those two days playing only this, stopping only for a short trip to the kitchen to get some food off the head chef and the occasional bathroom break. Needless to say this game occupied several weeks of my free time back then, so add another 30 or so hours of offline playtime to whatever my current online playtime is. Now on to the actual review.


[h1] STORY [/h1] 

For a game about titty ninjas destroying each other's clothes the story was actually surprisingly decent. It's nothing groundbreaking but it had its moments and all the characters had a decent amount of character development.

You have three main campaigns to play through with 25 missions each, an extra campaign that you unlock once you finish the first three and a special surprise once you finish it, but I won't spoil it. Aside from that every character also has their own personal side story which consists of five missions per story. Since the PC version comes with all the DLCs included you also get two extra characters which are normally not playable in the main story, so that's another extra ten missions.

Overall there's a lot of content to go through, but if you don't care for story you can pretty much skip everything and get to the action.


[h1] muh grafix [/h1] 

The game originally released on the PS Vita so next gen AAA graphics are out of the question here (not that I expect graphics sluts to be playing this). The PC version runs at native HD resolution so nothing is upscaled. It also runs at native 60FPS so the FPS police can sod off. I'd say it's rather lacking in the Anti-Aliasing department but you can easily fix that with something like NVIDIA inspector (or whatever equivalent AMD has). One thing I noticed, at least on my end, is that vsync is bugged in regular fullscreen mode. Regardless of how I tried to force it on I kept getting screen tearing. This stopped being a problem when I switched to borderless window.

The final thing I need to mention is that the system requirements posted on the store page are VASTLY overblown. This game will run just fine even on a toaster (I tested it).

[h1] MUSIC/SOUNDS [/h1] 

The soundtrack's pretty good, lots of metal, some of classical music and a lot of Japanese influence. The voice acting is also great but it's only in Japanese (I shudder to think what a dub of this would sound like). I'm no music critic, so I won't bother going in-depth here.

[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]

I would say this might get repetitive during extended plays if you aren't a beat 'em up fan, but in short bursts it's an absolute blast. The missions are mainly comprised of annihilating hordes of enemies Dynasty Warriors style and fighting one of the other girls.

The combat is not overly complex and it won't take you weeks to master it (unlike something like Devil May Cry), but it's really fun. You have a total of 22 playable characters to choose from and they all have their own unique movesets. Some also sport even more unique gimmicks which apply only to them. Every character also has three different states to choose from: Flash, Yin and Yang.

Flash is your default state. Yang is your shinobi transformation which completely heals you, makes you stronger and allows you to use hidden arts. Yin is essentially berserk mode which greatly boosts your own damage but you take a lot more damage as a result.
Each state also slightly alters the character's moveset and you unlock more moves naturally as you keep playing and level up.

There's a shop where you can buy clothes, accessories and other things with the money you earn from missions and a lingerie lottery to play when you have nothing else to waste your money on. There's naturally a dressing room where you can dress up your characters however you want (and you can do some fun things in there as well).
I won't bother talking about clothes destruction, you can figure that out by just looking at the screenshots and I don't really want to spoil everything now.

There is also multiplayer which I unfortunately didn't get to experience thanks to no internet at the time and it's currently pretty much dead unless you can get a friend to play with you or want to fight against bots.

Controls wise with a controller it works fine. The Vita's touch screen features are sort of emulated via the mouse. I haven't tried the keyboard controls so I can't comment on them.

[h1] TL;DR [/h1]

It's pure unadulterated fun, the port is fine and it triggers women and normalcucks alike. What more can I say about it? Wasted over 30 hours playing this in a basement that felt like an oven back in summer. Now I wasted another 30 just unlocking everything and having an absolute blast. Get it, it's great.

30290351.review:
Senran Kagura es un juego sobre ninjas o Shinobis como dicen los Ni hao.
Trata sobre una academia llena de puras mujeres, ahora, esos es progresista y gana puntos solo por eso.
Una lástima que todas sean unas gordas asquerosas y feas.
La parte buena es que nos enseña valores como la amistad y trabajar duro, sin olvidar aceptar las diferencias de las demás personas, incluso si esas son personas malvadas que hacen cosas malvadas.
El juego incluso te presenta una pregunta filosófica muy interesante. ¿Qué es la maldad realmente?
Hasta ahora no he sabido responder esa pregunta, pero filósofos durante generaciones lo debatiran, es así como Senran kagura se abre camino como uno de los juegos más innovadores en la historia de los juegos sobre ninjas en academias kawaii.

10/10 mucho contenido, precio razonable, lástima por las gordas asquerosas.

30238856.review:
모든 시나리오 다 진행했고 업적도 다 깼으니 소감을 적어본다. (시나리오 다 보고 업적 다 따보는데 40시간 걸렸다 이말입니다. 겜잘알이시라면 더 빨리 끝나겠고, 나같은 겜알못이거나 멀티도 하고 하드난이도도 다 하고 더 하실분들이라면 당연히 더 걸리겠죠) 

무쌍류 게임을 이걸로 처음 해보는 거였고 일본산 서브컬쳐 컨텐츠도 상당히 오랫만에 접한거라 신선함이 컸다. 재밌게는 했다. 나는 곧 스팀에 올라온다는 이 게임의 후속작 ev를 나오자 마자 살것이다. 하지만 왜 비추천을 매기냐 하면, 여긴 '키보드 마우스가 기본인' pc 기반 게이밍 플렛폼 스팀이니까. 내가 느낀 재미는 오직 '패드가 있을때만' 성립하는 재미다. 나는 엑박원 패드가 있고 이걸 써서 재밌게 했지만 패드가 없는 사람이라면 이 게임의 조작에 끝내 적응못하고 관둘 공산이 클거라고 생각한다. 

뭐 액션 단순하고 호쾌하니 할만은 하고, 줄거리는 없는것보단 낫고, 케릭터나 케릭터의 표현 혹은 소모 방식은 경우에 따라 마음에 들거나 극렬하게 역겹다. 일본산 서브컬쳐 컨텐츠의 전형적인 요소들을 떠올려 보시고, 본인이 그걸 얼마나 감내할수 있느냐를 생각해 보시기 바란다.

피시 포팅을 하면서 60프레임 지원은 성공했으나 그 외에는 '버리고' 간 느낌이다. 프레임 드랍 이슈도 여전히 존재하며 해상도 지원 범위도 좁고 조작은 와 이렇게 해놓고 pc로 게임하라고 내놨다고? 라는 의문이 생길정도로 처참하다. 삐딱한 시선이지만, 그래픽 품질만 보면 60프레임은 무슨 초당144 프레임을 고정으로 뽑아내야 납득할 수준이다. 선정성 요소도 막상 플레이 해보면 처음 한두번이야 오오 하지 그 다음부턴 설정가서 연출 오프 시키고 게임하게 된다. 그리고 냉정하게 말해 시대가 어느땐데 가슴과 엉덩이가 각져있는 수준의 품질로 선정성을 자랑하는건 좀... 선정성을 누리고 싶으면 차라리 한국산 스캇겜의 최고봉인 검은사막을 하는게 더 낫다. 검은사막은 무료고, 체격과 가슴 허벅지 등 신체 부위의 사이즈를 마음대로 조정 가능하고, 피부 텍스쳐도 이 게임보다 훨씬 낫고, 모델링 역시 우월하다. 심지어 물에 들어가면 옷이 젖기도 한다. 뭔가 오오오 하는 분위기의 선정성 요소도 까고 보면 스캇오브스캇 킹황갓워스트떵겜 검은사막 보다 못하다는 말이다. 게임에 선정성 요소만 있으면 스팀 리뷰에 hype이 끼는데 걸러들을 필요가 있겠다. 아 다시 말하지만 이 게임의 다른 모든게 마음에 들어도 패드가 없다면 구매를 더 고민해보시기 바란다.

권장: 엑박패드가 있다 / 무쌍류 게임을 해보고 싶다 / 일본풍 미소녀 케릭터들을 좋아한다.
비권장: 엑박패드가 없다 / 16:9를 제외한 비주류 해상도 환경이다 / 일본산 서브컬쳐 컨텐츠에 강력한 거부감이 있다.

30154965.review:
I swear I'm not weeb trash. I just really like panties. And cute girls. And Japan.

In all seriousness though, the gameplay is pretty fun for a game that seems like the only draw would be its perverted tones. Combos feel rewarding if pulled off and tons of collectibles keep things interesting. Getting experience can feel grindy though, and it's almost essential to beat the higher level enemies because they can win through sheer force and numbers if you have not trained enough.
+Panties
+Butts
+Cute girls
+Fetishes for every kind of weirdo out there
+Smooth gameplay
+Okay story
+Fun outifts
+Fantastic multiplayer

-Boob physics are over the top, but I guess that's to be expected
-Using skills can potentially cause players or bots to be stun locked if chained properly
-Repetitive when it comes to enemies
-Clothes shredding scenes disrupt flow of the otherwise fast and fluid gameplay (This can be disabled in the options though)

I bought this as a joke as first. I'm sure a majority of you did. I went in with low expectations, but I was surprised to be thoroughly enjoying myself. If you want to take a load off and blow a load off, this game can be stupid fun as long as you don't let the over the top aspects get under your skin.

30141355.review:
Worst ever combat system that i've come across, and i've played quite a few beat'em up games over the years.

Once you're hit and your character gets launched, there's nothing you can do. You'll stay in that state until the computer beats you and finishes you off, regardless of difficulty setting.

No matter how fast you are, you won't be able to get out of a lock. First to get a lock-on wins basically.

Skills doesn't matter in this game, only luck.

29715512.review:
Mon avis est assez mitigé sur ce beat them all, d'une part il commence a daté, cela se ressent dans les gaphismes en jeu et dans les menus, mais nous sommes d'accord cela n'est pas suffisant à discrediter un jeu, le plus important étant le gameplay. 
Ce dernier a pratiquement les mêmes mécaniques qu'un Dynasty Warriors bien qu'étant plus rigide et moins riche et agréable (surtout au niveau des déplacements). Les combats contre les sbires sont insipides et longs, n'opposant pas de résistance si vous êtes un amateur du genre. Le ou les boss de fin de niveau sont des héroïnes comme celle que vous contrôlez et là réside le challenge si on veut, car la plupart du temps le duel se jouera à celui qui spam le plus sa technique cheaté ce qui n'est guère intéressant et qui peut même être frustrant à la longue.
Ce jeu dispose d'une histoire et une ambiance sympatique qui se veut fun, mignonne et complètement débile mais globalement on ne joue à ça que parce qu'on est des gros perverts (prenez l'édition "nipples exist" obligatoire pour en profiter pleinement) pour le plaisir des yeux et c'est bien tout malheureusement.
