29648807.review:
Dieses Spiel der Senran Kagura Reihe ist eine gute Zeitverschwendung, die auch noch auf dem PC Spaß machen kann. Es gibt Vieles, was gut ist, und Vieles, was auch leider schlecht ist.

Gute Eigenschaften des Spiels : 

- 60 FPS, ein Muss.
- es gibt wirklich Chars, die etwas "Eigenes" haben ( jeder Char lässt sich anders spielen )
- verschiedene Storys der Schulen, welches einem Abwechslung bringt
- Geschichten aus dem Leben der Schüler als "Nebenmissionen"
- Weebs sind gut ausgestattet vor allen Dingen mit dem Shop
- Lotto spielen hat noch nie so viel Spaß gemacht :^)

Dinge, die akzeptabel sind :

- die Texte sind nur in Englisch und Japanisch verfügbar ( stört jedoch nicht, da ein Englisch-Vokabeltraining auch gut tut )
- Fremdschämen ist vorprogrammiert ( schlimm oder nicht schlimm = entscheidet selber )

Schlechte Eigenschaften des Spiels : 

- der Multiplayer. Es gibt keinen 1vs1 Modus, wo man sich mit einem Freund einfach mal duellieren könnte, obwohl man einfach nur etwas vom Story Modus wiederverwenden könnte und die Sache somit regeln könnte
- teilweise unbalanced
- mit einem Glitch kann man bestimmte Charaktere schon auf einem hohen Level haben, was einem etwas den Reiz am Farmen nimmt
- es "könnte" langweilig werden, wenn man die Story durchgespielt hat

Ich würde es jedem empfehlen, der sich für solche Fightgames interessiert. Ein Fehlkauf wird es auf jeden Fall nicht, wenn man auf einen Sale wartet. Falls Sie dies durchgelesen haben, bedanke ich mich für Ihre Aufmerksamkeit.

29470237.review:
Let's just get this out of the way up front. This game fucking sucks.

The combat that is ostensibly the whole point of the game is shallow, wildly inconsistent, and borderline incoherent. Some characters are laughably overpowered to the point of trivialzing any sense of difficulty (e.g. Imu and her magical stunlocking stick of boobie ninja beatdown) while other characters are profoundly useless until you level them up by repeatedly failing missions. Mercifully, this "grind" is quick so you won't sink much time into a character fruitlessly. Mechanics like juggling are temperamental at best, and the "clothing damage" cut-away doesn't seem to pause the action sometimes which makes maintaining momentum a crapshoot. Some bosses can be steamrolled in 20 seconds with little strategy or effort, while others seem intermittently able to pull off amazing split second recoveries and infinite combos, which leads to frustrating fights.

There's not a lot of content here either, a limited number of enemy types and arenas mean the story is a collection of slightly different permutations of arena and boss.

But the ultimate truth behind this is none of that matters. You don't play this game for deep emergent gameplay. You play it for the tiddies and because Ryōna pushes all your degenerate S buttons and you can put a collar on her. 
Forget I said that. These ninjas are the purest maidens. Except for Katsuragi, who is a habitual molester. And Haruka, who has canonically engaged in forced intercourse. And Ryōbi (no relation to the power tools) who is into some kind of breast inflation thing. Okay, maybe they're all degenerates too. Seems like most of them are hard gay for each other as well.

I can't seem to fathom why I keep playing this game as opposed to just browsing the Senran Kagura tag on danbooru. Perhaps it is because I am a piece of shit.

29438846.review:
离线时间没算上实际是24h全成就的日呆游戏，成就都挺简单的，都不难，有中文指南。闪乱神乐有出过tv动画，我就看了几集，可能当时追番有点多忘了看了
游戏属于看妹子割（爆）草（衣）无双类型，妹子爆衣露点是游戏主要卖点。有汉化和反和谐补丁，百度有答案。
1.模式方面有点少，不像无双有自由模式和，主要剧情模式+3个联机模式的类型。剧情就是3个学院（半藏 月闪 蛇）+红莲（原蛇院）的互相争夺学院战，存在感实话挺薄弱的都大同小异，反而后面引出来的妖魔有点兴趣，但是只是个背景233，这作到最后没见到。。。应该是后续的坑吧。不过角色关卡的剧情挺有意思的，我全程不跳过
2.游戏系统方面，人物一共22个，4学院队人各5个+大道寺+老师，满足你各种萌妹需求。每个角色招式性能不一，各有特色，设计的挺好的，比起爆衣这个更吸引我。普攻+C技不同组合，还各自有好看的3个秘传忍法（无双），玩到通关的时候也不会腻。还有就是冲刺 防御 防反 硬直的设置，不会显得太无脑割草，尽管难度也没多高就是了。
最重要一点忘了说，每个角色都有闪 阳 阴属性，对应状态下有不同招式，闪状态是通常状态，阳状态对应忍转身（变身），阴对应命驱就是内衣状态，所以可玩性还是挺丰富的。并且3种状态下的衣服饰品都可以自定义
3.游戏设置方面我建议手柄游玩的，毕竟是家用机游戏移植的，稍微会顺手一点，游戏画面的话这类日式游戏也就这样，常玩的都懂，不能强求太高体验，实际游戏有pc上60帧 1080p就很舒服了，不过读盘略多，不知道主机是不是这样的。
最后总结，你渴望力量吗？不，我渴望奶子。

==========
+角色及技能设计有新意
+难度适中，游玩流程合理

-游戏模式单调
-剧情薄弱
-读盘频繁

29375068.review:
Long story short: A good Musou styled game beyond all the tits and ass.

Long Story: I was honestly surprised I liked this game.
While I'm not huge of a fan of fan service (though I can handle it) I still bought it anyway wondering why it was rated so highly on the Store. (I thought it was just due the fan-service)
I'll start on the problems I found with this game during my time with it.
- The game's characters have cliches of various anime characters you might've seen before (which is sometimes the basis of their characters).
- Some in game dialogue and scenes that made me cringe (Thankfully that only happened a few times)
- This is a Musou styled game, so it could get rather repetitive rather fast.
But that's honestly all I could find (although I'm certain people can find more). The Positives I found in this game are as such.
- Still a Musou game, meaning it's still (in my eyes) a good hack and slash (except faster then any Warriors game I played).
- There's a legitamite story beyond the... Plot... and said story can be rather interesting.
- Every character has a different playstyle... somewhat. 
- I was able to play with a keyboard. (Still trying to find a controller for my PC)
- Good amount of Character Customization (although not as much as it's next main game Estival Versus)

Overall I had a good time playing this game.

Pelas imagens e vídeos você pode imaginar que é APENAS um jogo de fanservice, mas não se deixe enganar - a série Senran Kagura tem uma excelente jogabilidade pra quem curte um bom hack&slash. 

As garotas peitudas estão lá muito mais num sentido de ser "engraçado" que como intenção de te deixar com alguma sensação erótica. As interações entre elas também seguem essa linha, e podem ser uma boa diversão extra pra quem curte um pouco de cheap talk humorístico de meninas colegiais. Pra quem não curte, são completamente puláveis. 

Incontáveis roupas colecionáveis, unlockables, dificuldade progressiva e customizável. Vale bastante a pena, desde que vc não venha com a cabeça ocidental de "hãã gosto de jogos cinzentos, sombrios e carrancudos com tragédias da vida real".

This game is, to say the least, a little controversial and odd. If you don't already know (which if you don't, then you were SERIOUSLY not paying attention), Senran Kagura is a game series that is highly well known for the rampent fanservice it is filled with, especially the PC and Playstation games. However, behind the naughty outfits, jiggling tits, and cute, slightly one note characters, this is a fun, sometimes rather complex game that is worth checking out for those who love games like Dynasty Warriors and Sengoku Basara.

Story: Pretty simple, you are in the world of shinobi, or ninja, at one of several different schools. The characters you play as are each students at these schools who are learning to be the best ninja they can be. You fight, you win, and you strip your opponents. Have fun. ;)

----------

Pros: For those who haven't already guessed, this game is very silly fun with a good fighting system and plenty of girls to choose from. The controls for handheld controllers are easy to pick up on and even helpfully explained in tutorials (if you decide to view them). The story is also pretty interesting from what I've seen so far (only played the story missions and individual missions for the characters of Hanzo Academy so far) and the characters are likeable...at least, for the most part.

But while all that is important, one of the biggest points to make about this game IS, of course, its fan service. There are MANY different outfits to choose for your voluptuous fighters, from their fighting outfits to their underwear (there's actually a Lingerie Lottery you can enter to get more) and even special accessories like glasses, animal accessories and animal paws. They can even come in a variety of colors if you're picky like that. Also, the animations in which characters have their clothes torn off can be fairly exaggerated, with most giving cries of shock while some others may actually enjoy it, with one girl being a full-blown masochist who squeals in delight as you rip away her clothes. This all helps to keep the "SEXAH" parts from feeling too weird and awkward which really does help.

----------

Cons: The big thing that will likely drive anyone away from this game is, of course, the very thing I was just talking about, the fan service. If you are very uncomfortable with that, or consider it too tasteless, then you probably won't enjoy playing this game. This can be exasterbated by the fact that, while it's not openly stated, the girls are basically high school girls, which makes it rather squicky that you can put them into thongs, or a "Naughty Apron" outfit, etc. Granted, it never goes so far as to let players actually SEE nipples, butts, or nethers, but it will undoubtedly feel weird for some.

Also, not all of the characters are enjoyable to play as, with some easy targets being Hibari and Minori, who are both immature and unfortunately short ranged, or the girls of Hebijo Academy if you prefer the more lighthearted storylines. [spoiler] By the end of their storyline, they have killed every major character you'll have come to possibly love. [/spoiler]

And finally, the controls for keyboard are very awkward and difficult to use. If you don't have a good USB controller or prefer to play using the keyboard exclusively, then you'll likely find this game difficult to handle.

----------

All in all, I find the game enjoyable and fun for anyone who likes third person hack n slash beat'em ups. The customization can be fun to play around with, the fighting is pretty good, and the story is fairly easy to understand while having slight complexities to it. But I would recommend you at least watch someone play the game first before you buy, such as Gaijin Gamers.

Перечислев все достоинства как и в любой игре есть минусы и скорее всего они будут субъективны:
Графон не графонистый заставляют нас вернуться в далекий 2006 год и насладится небольшой деревянностью движений ходьбы бега, хотя выдающиеся особенности героинь двигаются весьма... "похоже на правду".

Глядя на все выше сказанное и недосказанное я бы сказал что эта игра сделана на большого любителя, поклонника данного анимэ сериала и малоизвестных файтинг игрушек. Решать вам брать её или нет.

29080754.review:
Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus is a beat em up kinda game where it's one character against an army of enemies, plus a boss fight towards the end. It's also a game that has a crap-ton of fanservice added in. You know, ass n' titties and such. Like any sane person, I enjoy that kinda stuff, so my interest was piqued when I first heard about it. The fanservice is what draws you in, but the gameplay is what makes you stay. I had a lot of fun playing this game, and I am very picky when it comes to beat em up games. When you start, you pick from one of 3 schools, each with 5 characters in it and they have a different fighting style and personality. For the most part, they are all pretty likeable. Some are obviously superior, like best girl Murasaki, while some are just kinda there, like Yozakura. Still though, you're gaurenteed to have a favorite character. Some of the character interactions were also a bit funny, so that's another thing I liked about the game.

So yeah, if you like anime, beat em up/hack & slash games, and/or boobs, then this is the game for you.

29042511.review:
A fairly simple beat-em-up with a likeable cast of characters and lots of oppai appreciation.

By the way, when people say they play this game for the plot, they're only half-joking. The premise is unironically pretty engaging, and the characters' backstories were emotional enough to make me tear up on a couple of occasions. This is coming from someone who only once teared up at Katawa Shoujo, which is widely considered to be some pretty heavy-duty feels.

Anyway, for all the joke reviews, memes about fanservice, and mediocre scores on Metacritic (I mean, we all know the AAA studios pay off the reviewers anyway, right?), it's actually a very solid game. £22.99 (or $29.99) is a little steep for something from early 2013, though, so if you've got a Vita or a PS4, you're probably better off grabbing Estival Versus instead for a little extra. 

Also worthy of note is that the multiplayer is perpetually dead. So unless you have designated friends to play with, don't just buy it for that. If you want a long and engaging campaign, though, the game delivers.

Simply put, grabbing Shinovi Versus on sale is a decision you'll only regret if someone walks in on you playing it. Turn your volume down and keep your finger on your monitor's power button if you hear someone descending into your basement lair.

기본적으론 세 가지 학교의 에피소드를 각각 진행할 수 있고(국립한조학원이 스토리 상 기본인 듯합니다.) 학교마다 5명의 캐릭터가 있습니다. ->플레이하다보니 캐릭터가 더 있군요. 스포가 될까봐 말하지는 않겠습니다.

액션 분야가 나쁘지 않다고 했는데 성적 어필 부분도 뭔가 퀄리티가 높습니다(..)
코스튬(의상- 단순 의상뿐만 아니라 속옷까지)이 상당히 많은데 (게임을 진행하면 매점에서 살 수 있는 것들이 새로 생겨납니다.) 속옷과 악세사리를 제외하고 전부 찢어진 모습이 따로 있습니다. 몇단계에 거쳐서요.
싸워서 데미지를 입으면  서로 점점 옷이 찢어지며 기량에 따라 적의 상반신이나 하반신만 찢을 수 있는데 정체를 알 수 없는 빛같은 걸로 가려지긴 하지만 알몸 상태로도 만들 수 있습니다.(맙소사)

참고로 스토리는 그냥 곁들여 먹는 정도로 생각하시면 될 것같습니다.
평가 전문가도 아니지만 실용적인 평가가 되도록 나머지 부분은 플레이 중에 번거롭다고 말이 나오는 부분을 쓰겠습니다.

이식 게임 특유의 조작 불편에 대해서 말하자면,
기존 A 버튼이 키보드의 스페이스와 엔터로 나뉘어 통일되지 못한 부분이나 조작키 설정를 바꿔도 몇몇 부분에선 조작키가 고정되어 있다는 고치지 못하는 등의(다행히 전투 중에는 이런 문제는 없습니다) 불편이 있습니다..만 사실 저는 그렇게까지 번거롭다고 느끼지 않았습니다.(참고로 이식 게임 처음 해봅니다.)
전 플레이하기 편하도록 키 설정을 마음대로 바꾸는 편이라 대시를 왼쪽  시프트, 약공격을 q, 강공격을 e, 점프를 스페이스 바, 변신을 f키로 설정하고 했더니 매끄럽게 플레이 가능하더군요. 조작 불편은 키 설정으로 상당히 해결할 수 있는 부분인 것같습니다만 예민하신 분은 엄청나게 거슬릴 수도 있습니다.

또한 목숨걸기나 콤보같은 전투기능을 모르시겠다고 하는 분들이 있던데 사용법 자체는 튜토리얼과 콤보 목록으로 90% 해결됩니다.
전투 중에도 콤보 목록을 볼 수 있는 데다가 내용도 간단해서 그냥 외워질 정도입니다. 히든 콤보가 엄청나게 많다던가 해서 제가 아만보인게 아니라면요.
솔직히 목숨걸기 어떻게 하는지 모르겠다고 하는건 그냥 꼼꼼하지 않으신 탓입니다. 튜토리얼 접근은 충분히 용이합니다.

..라고 말했습니다만 저도 충분히 세심하지 못해 모르고 넘어가는 인터페이스 편의 기능들이 있더군요.
이 부분은 로딩 중에 나오는 팁을 잘 챙겨보시면 많이 해결됩니다. (팁 모음: http://blog.naver.com/jyc3912/220904418518 :링크에는 이식게임이라서 그런지 있는 몇몇 이해하기 번거로운 인터페이스에 대해서도 써 놨습니다.)
탈의실에서 옷을 찢어볼 수 있다던가 캐릭터 교대창에서 능력치도 볼 수 있는 기능같은 것들이 있습니다.
굳이 여기에 하나 쓰자면 변신이나 비전인법 사용시 나오는 컷신, 전투 전후로 나오는 대화는 tab을 누르면 한번에 스킵됩니다.


결론적으로, 놀랍게도 살만한 게임이었습니다.
섬란 카구라는 게임성과 성적 어필을 동시에 챙겨줍니다.
전 게임할 때 특별히 미소녀에 목매는 성격도 아니었던지라 스스로 결론을 내리고도 뭔가 충격받는군요.
하지만 저만 놀라운 거고 이쪽에 익숙하신 분은 기꺼이 사셔도 되겠습니다.

추가-그래픽에 예민하신 분과 스토리에 예민하신 분, 2D미소녀 알레르기가 있으신 분께는 추천하지 않습니다. 비록 이 게임의 미소녀는 여러모로 3D로 나오긴 하지만요.

29008467.review:
ウィンターセールで安くなっていたので購入しました。
とりあえず実績全て解除したのでレビュー書くことにしました。

良かった点
・いろいろな女の子を選択できる。自分の性癖に合う女の子を選択可能でした。
・戦闘中相手にダメージを与えることで服を破くことができました。　☆全裸可能
・ストーリー終盤や「難」モードが用意してあり、無双ではなくアクションゲームとしても楽しむことができた。
・着せ替えモードで服を着せかえることができ、衣装も豊富　☆更衣室でいろいろ出来た
・おパンツおみくじがあり、おパンツを大量に入手できた
・学校毎のストーリーとキャラクター毎のストーリーがありそれなりのボリュームがあった。
・揺れる揺れる、おっぱいがすごい。

悪かった点
・もともとVitaのゲームということで、ボタンを押せの指示で「～をおせ」の部分がVitaのボタン表示のためキーボードでプレイする際に非常にわかりにくかった。ゲームパッド等は未確認。
・ストーリーのスキップを3・4回スキップしないと戦闘に行けないことがあり、再び同じ任務を受ける際不便であった。
・全裸シーンになっても衣装によっては衣装の一部が残ってしまうものがあった。バグであると思われる。
・チュートリアルで、はっきりした技の使い方がわからず分るまで苦労した。
・ロード時間の戦術指南も最初に悪かった点で上げたことが原因で読み取ることが難しかった。
・戦力値の確認が戦闘中にしか出来ず困った。待機中にも確認できる方法があればごめんなさい。いろいろしたが見つけられなかった。
・マルチモードは人がおらずCPU戦が強いられます。友達を誘うことをお勧めします。

総合的に
もともとVitaのゲームという前提を知っていたので、多少の画質の粗さとボタンの表示は我慢することができました。
戦闘して服を破るといった「アクション＋エロ」が非常に良いと感じました。
また、キャラクターの設定なども個々にちゃんと用意されており、存分に楽しむことが出来ました。
結果的に良い買い物を出来ました。
少しエッチなゲーム楽しみたい方は是非プレイすることをお勧めします。
最後に、ママに見つからないように内容は多少過激ですから。

28878489.review:
Being a fan of the Dynasty Warriors series and an adult male laking any sort of shame or irony, I've always been somewhat curious to take a look into Senran Kagura. Immediately I was able to get comfortable with the gameplay, though I did have to refer to my control screen for things such as targeting or Shinobi Transformation. The game seems a bit more challenging to me then it's musou brethren, focused more on smaller, slightly stronger enemy packs and character 'boss' battles. Though this difference is only slight, as AI still seems much to be desired and MOST of the mook enemies are rather easy to take down.

Graphically the game seems to work fine on my slightly dated computer. It looks good and seems to run a full framerate. The 2D opening looked rather choppy (making me have to skip it) and there was only one graphical hiccup where a character's hair started blinking out of existance in the Dressing Room. I will say though that the game is incredibly loud upon startup, which with all of the Japanese shouting (mostly of the same 3 or 4) one-liners and death cries, can start to get really grating on the ears.

At the point of writing this I've only finished the Hanzo campaign, and the story itself was a lot better then I expected it to be, if only because those said expectations were as low as they could be. It was a cohesive whole, mixed with moments character backstory, development and sympathetic moments when it wants to. Then you remember what game this is, and tone immediately falls into unintentionally comical or just plain stupid. Supposedly intense dialogue is ruined because not only is my enemy's fat tits out in the open while she tries to insult, but the nipples are also sensored by adorable chibi faces. Not to mention, it's hard to take my enemies as a genuine threat during a cutscene, when I just wiped thier sorry asses through the pavement and all I can think is "girl, just put on damn pants."

Speaking of this game being this game, there are a variety of outfits, accessories and, yes, underwear that you can dress each individual girl in to your hearts content. This is such a prominent feature to the point where the store literally has a "Lingerie Lottery", where you gamble money for 'Climatic' (thier word, not mine) underwear. I tried some of the alternate outfits during my playthrough, but honestly found thier base outfits (and those similar to them) to be the best option and the least cringy. If you're into the dressing up thing though, nothing will stop you. To be fair, I did change most of the characters' underwear out, if only to justify the existance of the "Lingerie Lottery." All DLC is included for the game, but must also be purchased with in-game currency via the item shop.

Overall, the game is exactly what it sells itself as: busty ninja girls beating the shit (and clothing) out of each other. It's a cocktease in combat, dialogue and content and if you're buying this that's part of the reason why. That being said, it's still a functional and enjoyable game as far as the actual gameplay elements go and has more emotional moments and character development then a game like this honestly deserves. If you like the genre (and tits) then you're going to be fine with this game, though your milage and tolerance may vary. If you're turned off (HA!) by the perversion but still want a game similar in combat style, the much more expensive Dynasty Warriors might be more up your alley.

28868664.review:
Gentlemen, from Righteous Boobage Producer, Kenichiro Takaki, comes an epic game of ninjas, and boobs: Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus.

I absolutely love this game. This is the main course to Tamsoft games that I was waiting for after Neptunia U, And it was absolutely worth it.
The characters are huge! (In that area obviously.) But aside from that, they're also incredibly well written and have great personalities and lots of hilarious quirks to them. A lot of their backstories are interesting too as well, and some of these backstories are pretty shocking too. They're also plentiful, 22 characters in this game. And they all have their own unique strengths and weaknesses. Some have faster dashing, others have heavier attacking, some can harvest a ton of combos (good luck getting 7,777 combos), not one character feels the same in gameplay.
The story is divided into three different schools each with five characters to play with. All these schools go through the same story, but made so that they all get to tie in with each other. The story may be simplistic, but thanks to these campaigns, they get bigger and easier to understand. The writing is excellent balancing comedy and drama. In addition, there's a hidden fourth campaign with an extra five more characters that you unlock later on. Plus... there's even a special surprise for clearing all campaigns. The story has a lot to offer.
Gameplay is easy to pick up and play, and it plays a lot like Neptunia U mashing Square/Triangle (I use a Dualshock 4 now), except you gain scrolls that let you transform into your Shinobi Form, or Go Frantic (strip down to your lingerie). You can then use the scrolls to unleash special skills that can tear hordes of enemies apart and also the clothes of all bosses. Boss fights make it feel like a fighting game of sorts where the AI, compared to the dumb AI of the hordes, is a lot smarter, especially on Hard mode (which I recommend playing all Story Missions on, Character Missions are fixed at Normal). Again, the main gameplay may be button mashy, but you know you're in it when you want to see the clothes get torn down, lingerie included when you use Specials and Ultimate. Aside from that, there's even a fun online mode with a variety of unique modes, including a free for all brawl, a ninja killing spree (the ones with Dumb AI Of course) and one where you search for panties.
This game obviously delivers heavy amounts of ecchi fanservice. Righteous Boobage Producer Kenichiro Takaki has openly admitted his love for boobs, and no doubt it shows. Loads of jiggle physics, cute and sexy lingerie to choose and play around with, the man delievers all the goods to you. Though if you're not the kind of guy who loves big melons, there are two characters that are fla-- *Ryobi transforms* NVM, one of them can transform into a bustier girl like Nepu. Only one remains flat no matter what happens. You can dress them in various clothes and swimsuits, and even play around with their body too! There's so much ecchi goods in it, the only thing you have to worry about is your mother or anyone in your family seeing the game you play. I confess, I keep skipping cutscenes as a result of my worry for my parents seeing.
This game is amazing. It may not be for everyone obviously, but this game will forever have a place in my heart. It's an excellent piece of work and I highly recommend playing this game. 28691880.review:
Edit2: I took a break and came back to do the Hanzo campaign, and the story is probably the best of the three. However, taking a break was a mistake.
I still don't have a controller, but I am very tempted to get one now. Because the keyboard controls are awful. Everything works as it should, however the camera is the biggest annoyance. Rotating it requires HOLDING LEFT CLICK AND DRAGGING. Which because I was rusty, it made it even harder. Locking on doesn't help either. Sometimes your character will even go out of the screen when getting hit to make it even worse. I don't hate the game now, and I still think everyone should enjoy it for the narrative (and get a fucking controller, for all that's bloody holy). But I couldn't enjoy the Hanzo campaign, even though it is the best of the three, as much as the other 2 because of the goddamn camera. So I'm getting one when I can, and then I'll do the Crimson Squad campaign.

Original Review:

While on the surface it looks like Anime Tits The Game, great storywriting and characters as well as great hack and slash gameplay makes Senran Kagura more than just fanservice.

I was surprised when I played through the Gessen campaign. Pleasantly surprised. Having no expectations whatsoever for  the game (indeed, I only got this because I wanted a hack and slash and I forgot Dynasty Warriors was on Steam), I was prepared for just some mindless killing and a bit of tits and ass. I am very picky when it comes to narrative in videogames. It has to grab me from the start, and Senran Kagura did just that. The campaign I played had a dumb as hell plot at first, with the stupidest of reasons for the members of the school to fight each other. However it eventually turns into a touching plot about mentorship, friendship, and the idea of good and evil. The 5 girls in this particular campaign at first look like one dimensional tropes, but you eventually learn of their tragic backstories which may or may not have used what I like to call the Batman Trope (You know what that is, and if you don't, I'm referring to the event that made Bruce Batman to begin with) that led to their current path as shinobis. The beauty of this is that they are characters you feel an attachment to, and enjoy watching grow, you also get to fondle their breasts and put them in the most revealing of outfits. So there's that.

Enough about the story, how is the gameplay? My answer, very good.
I can barely manage with Keyboard and mouse although this game is clearly meant to be used by controllers. But I do not have one at present, so I can't really say. Do keep in mind that the keyboard controls are actually alright by itself though (Q is LB and R is RB for menu controls. You're welcome.) The combat is well executed in my opinion with great visual effects, as well as a constant 60 fps despite how busy the screen is. The fanservice here is characters who take too much damage get their clothes ripped. And I have managed once or twice to even get the undies off my opponent if I hit her hard enough, so if you want that kind of fanservice this game has you covered.

Costumes are well designed and are what I can describe as Anita Sarkeesian's worst nightmare. You get all the dlc from the Vita version in this port for free as well.

The lingerie lottery though is a bit of an interesting system. 98 lingerie sets are waiting to be unlocked. To unlock one pay any amount of cash you want; but the more you pay the less chance there is of a repeat. Being a fan of blind bags and TCG booster packs and the thrill of packing something you don't have I love this feature. Though most of the stuff is HIDEOUS imo and of the ones I have I'll only use one or two of those. (also on a side note I have regressed so much that I snark at lingerie designs. What has my life come to.)

The Dressing Room is where you customise your shinobi to look as:
a) Hot and sexy as possible
b) Cute as possible
c) Cool as possible
d) Downright hideous
And the options can be overwhelming. Once you buy the stuff that is. Schoolgirl outfits, Christmas, nuns, aprons, any kind of fetish you have, there is probably a costume for it (Slight exaggeration, there are only a few fetishes here).
Though the fullscreen mode is a tad underwhelming. I like to call this the molestation mode, but all you can do is swipe their clothes off and fondle their breasts. That's it. They do have reactions to your actions, but they all use the same animations anyway. Not like I wanted this part or anything, but it does feel phoned in to me.

In conclusion, is Senran Kagura worth buying? I answer with a hearty YES. At least one of the campaigns is great and at the very least has me interested into playing the rest, and unlocking the rest of the characters. If you don't like fanservice at all this probably isn't for you, because there is A LOT of it. The gameplay is solid, performance is great and the customisation is pretty good as well. I will play the rest of it then update this review.

EDIT 1: I've played the Hebijo campaign. And while it was a bit weaker than the Gessen story, it was still an emotional rollercoaster, dealing with the topics of restoring honour, loyalty, redemption and revenge. The characters' backstories are also well written like the first, but the reason why I say it was weaker than the Gessen story is more of a personal thing, I just successfully predicted the ending of it and how it would pan out, making it less interesting and making me think it as very cliched. Overall though I recommend this part and this game even more, especially if it means that the other 2 campaigns are at least as good as this one. Also Miyabi's side quest is hilarious and I recommend you play it at least once.

28631160.review:
An entertaining ecchi comedy mixed with a 3D brawler/beat'em up game. There's no mistaking that this game, and indeed the entire Senran Kagura series knows it's audience. It's full of fan service, and there's no beating around the bush on that, if you dislike fan-service you won't like this game. Period. All the ladies are well endowed with jiggle physics galore and lots of revealing clothing and clothing damage to reveal their oppai and pantsu!

The characters are very trope-heavy, and it's easy to pick out common anime archetypes here, but the story works with that pretty well and presents a story where the relationships between the girls really shines through and you do end up caring to some degree how those relationships resolve (though whether they do or not is another story). You get to play as three schools of samurai girls, and an additional school after beating those stories. Each school has 5 shinobi girls to play as, with their own unique looks, personality, and move-sets. You can advance through most of the main story with the girl you choose, and each girl has a separate side-story for her alone giving you plenty of missions to advance through.

The main gameplay takes place on special stages where you often have to fight through multiple waves of trash enemies. These parts feel very much like a Musou game (Dynasty Warriors) but with a greater emphasis on aerial movement. The end of levels usually has you square off against one of the other shinobi, either in a friendly bout, or a serious rivalry. These sections are more akin to 3D fighters, with the closest I can think of being the Dragon Ball Z Budokai Tenkaichi series. You have a weak attack and strong attack, which you can further combine with aerial moves. There is also a limit break power, an aerial rave, blocks, parries, and you have 2 separate modes you can switch between. Panic which increases your damage output but seriously lowers your defense, and Shinobi which will heal you completely. When in Shinobi or Panic mode you can unleash special attacks called Ninja Arts after acquiring enough points (gotten through damaging opponents). You can cause clothing damage to your opponent through Ninja Arts and aerial raves. The stages themselves are fairly small but generally give you a decent area to fight in with some decent variety between them.

Outside of the combat levels, you have a shop where you can buy costumes, accessories, movies, music tracks, and so on for your girls. There is also a Lingerie Lottery mini-game where you bet money to unlock new lingerie outfits for the girls, by betting more money you reduce the chance of getting a duplicate. There is a dressing room where you can change the girl's outfits and even "test" their jiggle physics by touching them. The outfits are divided between the main outfit they typically wear, the shinobi outfit seen when they transform, and the lingerie outfit seen during panic mode and after clothing damage. There's also different hairstyles and accessories as well. There is a library section where you can view various art works and unlocked movies as well as listen to music tracks, and a dojo that lets you play in various multiplayer games. Finally in the main room itself you can talk to the various other girls of that school and their conversation changes a bit after several missions are completed.

Overall the game is rather fun, a tad repetitive at times but the core gameplay is solid. The fan service is rather good without being too explicit (there are bars of light censoring naughty bits). This is a port from a Playstation Vita game and it is done well, with even the button prompts being redone to match a 360 controller, and most of the game is in HD quality (although numerous lingerie outfits are noticeably low-res). Also all DLC formerly separate from the game in the Vita version is now bundled in the base game.

Yo soy fan de Senran Kagura ya que fue el primer anime que ví xd :v y luego me compre secretamente el Senran Kagura Burst en 3DS, y hasta ahora conseguí una PC gamer para jugar el Shinobi Versus así que les dejaré mis impresiones:

Es la secuela de Senran Kagura Burst y de el anime con el mismo nombre de la saga, así que el principio de este juego puede parecer bastante flojo para los que no conozcan la saga, sin embargo tiene muchas mejoras con respecto a su primera entrega como la "Lencerie Lottery" que es una de mis funciones favoritas e.e y obviamente sus mejoras gráficas, tambien me gustó que integraron dos escuelas, al principio solo eran dos.

La principal función de este juego es simplemente entrener, así que si lo que quieres es divertirte un rato y eres medio/completamente pervertido, este es tu juego. La historia tampoco está nada mal, hay veces que me concentro tanto en los textos que se me olvida porque empezé a jugarlo, no es un Final Fantasy ni un Xenoblade Chronichles así que no esperes mucho, simplemente no te decepcionará y cumplirá su misión: entrener.

Como este juego no es tan amplio (aunque no he probado el PvP) no tengo mucho más que decir más que si te quieres divertir, y puedes estar solo en casa para que no te descubran :v te recomiendo ampliamente comprar este juego, a decir verdad está bastante barato ya que cuando está en rebaja está incluso mas barato que la primera entrega :D.

After beating the first school arc, I think I am ready to finally review this game.

As a hardcore weeaboo and hack and slash fan, I decided I would pick up this game for the nice discounted price of 20 (CAN) dollars.  I didn't go into this game expecting much.  I already knew there was fan service, which is always a plus, but how is the game itself?  The game itself can feel incredibly easy at times but feel totally broken and unbalanced (sometimes not in your favour).  The difficulty isn't hard, even in hard mode.  I find sword user's and hibari are especially easy to combo and chain with and have an unfair advantage towards other chars. as the sword wielders feel way less clunky.  The damage output for some people are outright insane while others dish out rather underwhelming damage.  

Besides how the combat feels, the character customization is something to behold.  Lot's of uniforms, lots of underwear, etc.  You can pretty much make your ideal waifu with this game.  ATM my waifu is Yumi from Gessen.  Everything about her is splendid, from her eyes, to her curves holy moly guacamole, her curves.  If you're into dress up games and the price for this game does drop below 70%, pick it up.  It's waifu heaven.

Pros:
-Waifus
-Wide character customization
-60FPS even on my shitty pc
-nice controller support (no suprise it's a vita port)
-Good voice acting
-Neat characters


Cons:
-Combat is pretty repetetive, even with the diverse amount of characters to play as
-Boss AI can feel a little too OP sometimes.  
-Difficulty is pretty much easy
-Parrying/counter is incredibly hard and you need fucking super human reflexes to do that stuff

Final Verdict:  6/10

Good waifu simulator, with a subpar combat that feels more like a chore than anything else.

28122122.review:
If not for this game, I would never have given Senran Kagura another chance after watching the anime adaptation's first episode.

A great game by musou game standards (A single overpowered character batting aside hundreds of weaker foes).
While there are some downsides to the game, it's easily my second favourite title of the genre after the Dynasty Warriors spinoff, Samurai Warriors. Battles are fast paced and at some times challenging; the 22 playable characters all manage to feel distinct even though the combo maps only differ a little for the most part; the soundtrack is really, REALLY good!

The unfolding stories are distinct and important, filled with character strifes that paint a grim world that extends beyond the spotlight and makes them more relatable, despite their one-dimensional personalites.

If you are looking for a fast-paced and slightly mindless game, a game with both easy and rewarding achievements or even just a game with a little bit of teasing nudity, this game may be for you.

Pros:
Character artistic designs are varied and sexy
The Jiggle factor is extreme
They got lolis if you're into that
Flat-chested, big-chested, tomboys and masochists too!

The more serious Pros:
Character artistic designs are varied and sexy
Gameplay somehow manages to be diverse, despite the limitations of the system
The soundtrack is amasing
22 playable characters, associated with 4 shinobi schools and 4 story lines.
The stories show that even though these girls aren't "real shinobi", they certainly do live in a realistic world of shinobi.
The contradicting moral conclusions, that actually make more sense to contradict eachother than to agree.
Controller support and GREAT controller gameplay. Sorry "PC Master Race" losers, some games actually play better with a controller. Get one.
Worth the full price; an even better buy if you can get it on sale.
That one time someone [spoiler]****[/spoiler] and we all were genuinely shocked.
All DLC included

Cons:
The combo maps aren't any different between characters, a lot of the time
The character balance is atrocious
Daidoji is too butch for me. And too OhPee!
Estival Versus isn't available yet
The learnt passive skills are identical between all characters, which kinda annoyed me
There's only a few different maps, so the game gets repetitive faster than other musou games
At max character level, the game isn't challenging, even on Hard difficulty
Some scenes can't be read again without starting a new save, which is a shame because I really liked the story and playing the whole game again to read one scene is a big investment
You can't play with one hand.

Buy it.
If you don't enjoy it, come whinge to me before your 2 hour trial period is up and I will take responsibilty for saying that I think the game is good.
I won't refund you the time spent on it though, that's Valve's job.
Don't whinge to me if you were too busy having fun for more than 2 hours, to remember that you forgot to get your daily dose of whinging about things that you secretly enjoyed.

Don't forget to rate down this review. Rate Uppers will be shot. Rate Funnys will be shot again.

28110230.review:
Fun, but REMARKABLY repetitive. The only real saving grace of the game is the boobs and the storyline which is unfortunately mostly represented purely with text over a static image background.

The levels generally consist of a generic "beat em up" style linear walkthrough of a course, followed by a boss battle.

The biggest issue I have with the game, is that the 1 vs 1 fighting style is INCREDIBLY unbalanced. Its entirely possible to fight one boss without taking a single hit of damage, and then lose the next while landing almost no blows. There is no linear progression of difficulty because of how unbalanced it actually is.

Its also really common place to beat the 100+ enemies before the boss without taking a single point of damage, and then lose to the boss in under a minutes worth of fighting.

I would STRONGLY suggest that the developers of the game look at how the battle system actually works, and FIX it. Its impossible to break out of combos leading to the sort of button spamming style of win that most franchise had resolved in the 90's, making the losses incredibly frustrating and the wins worth almost nothing.

If you're playing the game purely for the CG boobs and expecting nothing else, than this game is a good fit. If you honestly want any sort of depth or balance in a game, you should probably look somewhere else.

On a side note, this is one of the most poorly optimized games I have ever played.  I can play GTA5 on ultra on my 3K monitor at 45fps, however attemtping to play this game on anything over 1080 causes the game to grind to a halt. The gameplay speed is also tied to the framerate, meaning that you WILL see large fluctuations in play speed from events as simple as NPCS spawning in the battle ground.

TLDR; I want to like this game, but I really cant. I want to finish the game, but honestly I dont think I will. I really wish I hadn't bothered with it.

28106955.review:
Senran Kagura is a series known for its ever growing cast of cute characters and its hack & slash gameplay. For those unfamilair with the series and need a reference, think of it as a Dynasty Warriors game on a much smaller scale, with a cast of characters that consist of young female ninja's.
The story to the game takes place six months after the second game, Senran Kagura 2: Deep Crimson (SK2:DC). Every character that was included with the vanilla game of SK2:DC is now back, and with the roster that doubles in size, more fan service, and customizable outfits for your characters. You have the choice of choosing between three different school's with five playable characters each to progress on how the following events to SK2:DC take place. With a foruth school of six characters to be unlocked. Hanzo academy, Gessen academy, Heboji academy, and Homura Crimson Squad. The Story varies depending on which academy you pick, and gives you the option to switch between academies in between missions. However they do not all co-exist alongside each other. Each main story consists of five chapters with five missions to play in each. You can either play through as one of your favorite characters the entire way, or rotate between the characters you have for the sake of variety. Along side the main story, each individual character has there own side story of five levels to play through. These stories are seperate from the main plot of the game and are mostly there for achievment sake to give the player more to do. During these side stories, you can only experience them all by playing as each individual character. Completing them simply gives players more achievements, experience points for the characters, and more items to purchase from the in-game store.

Cutscene's in the game however are very low in both quantity & quality. Majority of your time in this game will be spent simply reading tons of dialouge and exposition over gameplay. In a variety of two different ways, cutscenes will play out like visual novels that alot of japanese games have. With a background image thats partly faded, then paragraphs of information that a mandatory for understanding the plot to the game. Then there's more anime traditional cutscene's were various character models will appear on screen and interact with each other over their dialouge que's. This form of story telling is fine, however the character models themselves will distract you from the tension. Not because of the fan service or appeal that the game provides, but perhaps the biggest visual glitch in the game occurs, the game doesn't seem to know what outfit the characters are wearing, even if you haven't changed anything, the character models from their navel region; downwards will be patchy in a bizzare mash-up of color's, random pixel's, and piece's of outfits you can just barely recognize, even if said item thats showing up hasn't been unlocked yet. It can even be seen through the bright blue dialouge boxes. There are very few moments in the game when this issue doesn't occur and somehow it doesn't appear in any moments other than the cutscene's themselves. Whats noteworthy is you'll find yourself mashing the A button constantly as most of the dialouge is irrelevant, not contributing to the overall plot. By simply reading every other sentence or two your able to make out whats happening in the story to continue, so there's no need at all to see through and read every individual box of dialouge that makes an appearence.

The combat system & level design: After cutscene's, battle's will begin to play, each mission will take you onto a number of different locations, the only difference being which character you fight at the end, and how much ground you'll actually cover. It doesn't matter which story mode, academy, or character you play as, each level will play out the same. You'll begin in a fixed position on the map with a horde of enemies in your path, elminate them all without losing and you can progress further onto the map. Go through about two or three waves of enemies at each stopping point and you'll be given a boss character to fight. Beat said boss character at the end and you win. This is how previous Senran Kagura games have played out. 
Each character you play as has a health guage that gradually gets longer the more you play as them and level up, and a ninja scroll meter for transformation's, secret ninja art's, and entering "Frantic mode". this too, gets longer as you level up with each character and lets you hold more scrolls for longer combo's. The basic gameplay for combat set's you in 3D enviorments to fight the many hordes of enemies with hack and slash gameplay. Leveling up boosts the characters stats and lets you use even more attacks to make your combo's even longer, more effective, and more efficient. On top of that, each charcter has three more meter's that fill up and upgrade depending on how you play. those are: Yin, Yang, and Flash. 
Yin is applied when a player enter's "Frantic mode".  When a character has enough ninja's scroll's at one time, guard, the press their heav attack button, the camera will zoom in on your characters chest. Either press the heavy attack button again or move the character to the left or right and their clothes will fly off of them, down to their undergarments. in this mode your attack increases a ton along with your overall speed. However your defense will be reduced greatly. so use this only if your looking to get the job done quickly. However chances are you won't notice since the frequency in which combo's go, you'll only be hit if you either stand around for too long or just stop attacking.
Yang is applied when you use one ninja scroll and transform into your charcters ninja outfit, your attacks and defense are greatly increased. but you become slightly slower. howver you won't even notice becuase you'll be attack the opponents so frequently that you'll rarely be hit.
Flash is applied when you choosing neither option and go all out as you see fit in your standard clothes. Unless your struggling for extra health or just want to see the transformation animation again, this is how you'll experience most the game.
Once a level is completed you'll be given a grade based on how quickly you completed it, how many times you were hit, how many enemies you killed, and how long of a combo you were able to deal. Alongside some in-game currency and EXP, thats it.
How long will each level take you, and how tough is the overall experience? very little. This is the game's BIGGEST PROBLEM. The combat, and level's sound nice on paper, but the way they play out are overlly tedious and repetitive at best. Levels will only get shorter and shorter as you learn the controls and get a few level ups. at the start of the game levels many take anywhere from 6 minutes, and onwards. After learning the controls (and even simple attack spamming) levels will last as little as 15 seconds to close to a minute. (Thats no exaggeration either.) There's no real risk to dying since you level up during the combat itself and rewarded with any you didn't receive outside of battle right at the end. So there's no overall challenge, levels will take you back to the same arena so you'll contstantly be running to where the enemies spawn, use one or two attacks and they'll all die immedeatly. Little to no skill is involved here. This where its said that most of your playtime will be spent on the cutscenes since no level will keep you still long enough to really enjoy. Grinding is easy and simplistic, levels are small and lacking variety, its so brain dead that you'll quit playing to look for something with actual challenge and balancing to it.
The fan service and design are where this game stands out, but from the level of overlly reptitive gameplay and bad storytelling (compared to previous games), its just not worth the 30 dollar investment. Play a different SK game if you care that much.
5/10

焔紅蓮隊という抜け忍5人衆を使用可能にするために各学校（3つ）のストーリーモードをクリアするのが条件なのですが
終盤に近づくにつれ、敵が基本アーマー状態なのでコンボに繋げる初撃を当てるのにタイミングよくガードしなくてはいけなかったり（ジャストガード決まると強制反撃ができる）
必殺技を繰り出すために巻物をコンボで貯めなければならないのだけど、初撃を当てれてもなかなかコンボが繋がらかったりでボコボコにされます　攻略サイトを見ると安全に攻撃する方法やハメ技なんかもあるだろうけど、まずは見ないですすめることをお勧めします、考えてプレイすることによって上達するのでその過程がかなり楽しいです

そこらによくある無双ゲーよりも終盤の難易度は高いと感じました、格ゲー好きな人にも向いているかも
オンライン対戦はまだ未体験ですが　脱がし合い対決　パンツ争奪戦　などのモードがあるので燃えそうです

やりこみ要素◯

動作快適度◎（レスポンスめっちゃいいです）

キャラクリエイト◎

Плюсы:

-Управление не такое уж и неудобное. За полчаса привыкнуть можно

-Не завезли Estival Versus

本編と言えるであろう各学校のストーリーまではクリアしました。

ストーリーはシリアスで泣ける場面がありながらも難解でなく、ゲーム難易度もさほど高くはありません。
ただし、油断していると通常の難易度でも容易にゲームオーバーになるようなステージもあります、また、各キャラごとのストーリーはそれなりに難易度が高いのかもしれません(大道寺のみプレイして最終戦でめちゃくちゃ苦戦した)。

ただ、基本的には気楽に楽しめる内容なので気楽なゲームを求めている人にはお勧めです。
一方で戦闘が若干単調になりがちな部分もあり、また、キャラのステータスが多くのRPGのように上がることで同じステージでも徐々に難易度が下がってしまうためPVEにやりがいを求める人にはあまりお勧めできません。
(一応PVPもできますがそちらは未プレイのため、何とも言えません)


あとはまあキャラが気に入るならばおっぱいとお尻とパンツのために買うのもいいでしょう。
一部のパンツのデザインはコスチュームを選ぶのですがそれでも楽しく着せ替えができます。

27527867.review:
TL;DR: No se que esperas para comprarlo, 20€ - 70 Horas y 7.5 de Nota de mi parte.
/*En Proceso de Escritura*/

Esto va ser extraño, pero Senran Kagura: Shinovi Versus a pesar de las coñas de los demas diciendo "TETAS TETAS TEEEEEEEEEEEEEETAS". Es un Juego que graficamente tal vez no parezca de otro mundo y ademas de que este juego se le pueda resumir como "Sexo, Shinobis y Rock'n'Roll" (Tal vez hubiese quedado mejor Ninjas pero meh, ademas de que mas que Rock es Metal con toques japonees con algun Mukkuri u Sintetizador).

Este Juego tiene todas las cartas para no ser simplemente un juego de Fanservice tiene algo mas que eso, Es un Buen Juego, y voy a intentar defenderlo atraves de los siguientes puntos: 

Para empezar a nivel de Historia sin ser de lo mejorcito que ha dado el medio, realmente es muy Resulton.

Esta Historia va de 4 bandos/Escuelas Ninja-Shinobi  (Si seguimos la historia del SK:Girls Crimson):
-Una en que un principio pensaba que los Shinobis Oscuros, todos eran horrendos sin piedad, que solo lo hacen por dinero, en definitiva "Malos", pero al final vieron que no eran diferente uno de otros (Esto es de la precuela de este juego,SK:Girls Crimson dentro de SK:Burst perteneciente a la segunda historia).
-Otro Grupo de los Shinobis "Buenos" que Elitistamente quiere destruir todo lo que sea malo o tuviera contacto con el mal según su Criterio sin importar el contexto o la opinon de terceros.
-Otro grupo de los shinobis malos que vienen a remplazar a los del anterior juego (de la misma escuela), porque los anteriores fueron exiliados por motivos Empresariales y por Rebelion, y Quieren Venganza.
-El Grupo exiliado, que huye y se esconden en las tinieblas esperando no ser encontrados.

Y todo esto se nos presenta en 4 Arcos que nos permite vivir las historias desde su propio punto de vista.
Y no solamente el punto de vista general, sino tambien personal, porque esta gente tiene sus pasados otros mejores y otros peores. Perdida de Familiares, Viviendo de la pobreza, entre otros temas. Y aunque algunos personajes beben de algun que otro estereotipo tipico del anime, hay unos personajes que se destacan en los extremos que son.

Ademas de la Trama principal existen una trama "más personal" que tiran mas por la comedia y la coña y que da unos finales que son de risa (algunos mejores otro peores, no lo niego) pero antes de nada os comento, PRIMERO jugar la trama principal de la escuela hayais elegido y después las Personales porque salen personajes que no deberian salir hasta despues de terminar la historia principal, con lo cual descubris los personajes antes y sus habilidades especiales.

Y para aquellos que terminen las cuatro historias. Se os desbloqueara una de las promesas que mantenieron 2 personajes en el juego anterior.

PD:NO os recomiendoVEAIS EL ANIME, esta basado en Skirting Shadow (Burst: 1) y es muy plano, y la adaptacion no es buena

Una par de cosas que hay que comentar... La Historia esta presentada en forma de Visual Novel,
en dos modos, Uno en Formato Novela y otro a nivel Dialogo, y aunque esto a la gente que lee Visual Novels no le supone ningun problema, Algunas parte de la historia se hacen tan largas que tengo la necesidad de que hubiera un Save del modo Novela por temas de tiempo, y que al mismo tiempo Puede Ser Pesado para el lector que solo quiere poca charla y mas accion.

Otro tema que tal vez la gente le de cosilla, que Aunque el Modo de historia personal, va mas tirando de la comedia como what-if, No quiere decir que el Modo Historia sea 100% seria.
Sigue teniendo cosas moes y tal

Esto a nivel Historia...

A Nivel Jugable: Como Hack'n'Slash no es el juego mas dificil, pero la verdad deja una sastifaccion bastante buena, Entre 2 Tecnicas Secretas y una Suprema (Consiguiendo ciertos requisitos y Pulsando LB + B (Mando 360) con baja vida) que son expectaculares 
y Pudiendo adquirir ataques mientras subes de nivel (Si, tiene progresion de nivel) que ademas segun el modo que estes jugando (Normal, Transformado o Fanatic) se te habilitaran combos unicos para estos modos (aunque la secuencia sea igual, el ataque no). Como resultado tenemos un juego que a nivel jugable es aunque pueda ser un poco repetitivo es Divertido y realmente te lo pasas muy bien,NO es un Hack'n'Slash complejo como Bayonetta pero realmente Worth It! (Ademas, he nominado a este juego a "Solo cinco minutos más"  en el Steam Awards).
A Nivel Musica:
ES COJONUDO, vale que no sea la banda sonora mas importante de toda la historia, pero realmente me encantaria haber tenido la edicion "Let's Get Physical" que hubo es su momento para Vita por la banda Sonora (y tambien por el Art-Book).
Canciones como Wayward Thoughts/Ten jita Wake/Why we Turned que es la musica del Trailer de PC por ejemplo es muy Guay. 
El Opening aunque falla para mi gusto en varios tramos a nivel Visual/Musicalmente, A Nivel Musical teniendo la voz (es la misma voz que la Seiyuu de Yumi) que tal vez flojea un poco en segun que momentos, Instrumentalmente me tiene Encantado.

A Nivel de Port de PC:
Es un Cutre Port a Nivel de Settings, Tiene Sombras Pixeladas que tambien ocurria en la Version de Vita, Los Minimos estan algo exagerados, Pero eso si, Cumplen con lo que Prometen 1080p@60fps pudiendo Escalar a mas Resolucion usando la opcion de "Borderless Window" e inclusive haciendo pudiendo hacer DownSampling con software de terceros, Usando tanto el NVidia DSR como con el GeDoSaTo (Yo recomiendo el NVidia DSR a 4K, Uso un GTX960 con un i5-4670) Que en serio, Seriamente Si PODEIS, Hacer Downsampling de 4K a 1080p

Y llegamos al punto mas polemico Tal vez, El Tratado Visual y...
Y No Vamos a negar lo innegable, Este Juego tiene fanservice y aunque puedes quitar los Cut-scene de Transformacion y de desnudo, Aún ingame se puede ver la ropa del personaje yendo cacho a cacho y Tetas rebotando por todos lados (Menos Ryobi lol). Pero sinceramente que esto ocurre ingame no tiene porque afectar el juego en si mismo. Es mas Transformaciones como las de Yozakura que son menos sexuales y dan sensacion de poder. (Lastima que eso lo cambiaron en el Estival Versus), pero sinceramente todo este fanservice es para mi Secundario un añadido, he intentado analizar lo de antes para que no quede en plan "Tiene tetas 10/10", porque este juego es mucho mas que fanservice barato, y Si... Hay boletos para conseguir bragas y Si muchos de los trajes que tiene puede ser demasiado sensuales...
Solucion?, NO LO USES, si te molesta tanto que haya tetas rebotando en la pantalla y Desnudos, Desactiva todos Cut-scenes menos los ataques especiales (Que en serio, SON GENIALES) y usa la ropa mas abrigada posible, Juega Perfecto para que no te desnuden y no uses demasiadas Tecnicas Shinobis (que al final al cabo son las Principal Culpable que salga en pelotas), A mi personalmente no me Molesta y me parece mas grande el juego con todo lo que tiene.

Aqui en COntra pondria que la variedad de enemigos tal vez pudiera haber sido mejor, y los escenarios aunque no se queda cojo, lo mismo un poquito mas no hubiera hecho demasiado daño, y la calidad grafica no es la gran cosa.

Y Con la Duracion que tiene en completar todas las rutas algo asi de 70 Horas aproximadamente, con lo cual el Precio/Hora esta mas que garantizado, Vienen Con todos DLC que salieron de Vita tanto los personajes Extras (Originalmente Personajes Desbloqueables del Senran Kagura: Burst) 

Al Final Yo Puntuo este juego con un 7.5/10.
No Considero este juego como una obra maestra ni nada asi, Pero me parece un Buenismo juego a nivel Jugable, la Historia es suficientemente entretenida para que te enganches y las Misiones Personales Son La Risa y le dan vida al Juego. O sea para mi es un Recomendable e inclusive Indispensable si eres un Weeabo, Te gusta la banda sonoras con Guitarras de fondo, Y No te importa ver FanService.

//Si ya decia yo, que esto de hacer analisis era pesimo, Yo Soy Programador, No Escritor

27430553.review:
Nominando al Premio al Mejor Fanservice de Steam!

En qué estaba pensando Kenichiro Takaki cuando creó esto? Bueno, que a los juegos les faltaban muchas chicas!
Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus es el primer juego Spinoff (estilo beat'em up (Spectacle Fighter) en 3D) de la notoria serie creada por Tamsoft y publicada por XSEED/Marvelous, originalmente lanzado para la PSVITA en 2013/14. Controlas a un grupo de atractivas chicas Shinobi (Y para los que pregunten, NO SON KUNOICHI, son Shinobi fuertes y letales en su propio derecho, sólo por explicarlo...) en su eterna batalla contra las fuerzas de la oscuridad, y de la luz!?

La historia ocurre cuando la Academia Hanzo (las heroínas del primer juego) deben confrontar a las Shinobi de la Academia Gessen, que buscan purgar TODO el mal del mundo de los Shinobi, y eso LAS incluye debido a la "amistad" que han desarrollado las Shinobi de Hanzo con las Shinobi de la (no tan destruída) Academia Hebijo, las enemigas del primer juego, que además han vuelto con un nuevo equipo y más malas que nunca! Además de un grupo de rivales conocidas que buscarán convertirse en las mejores Shinobi de la historia, y sólo lo conseguirán derrotando a las demás Academias. 

El juego está muy bien diseñado con una experiencia de juego más fluída que la versión original de PSVITA: a 60 FPS, con opciones para jugar (y ver "mejor" a las chicas) en HD, y además con todo el contenido DLC lanzado para este juego ya incorporado (aunque tendrás que comprarlo con el dinero del juego de todos modos, pero no es nada que no pueda arreglarse con jugar la historia de un equipo de Shinobi de tu elección hasta el final). Eso sí, el juego al ser un port de la versión portátil, requiere algo de tiempo para acostumbrarse a los controles de teclado si no tienes un buen gamepad. El juego también cuenta con un modo multijugador con tres modos (incluyendo el siempre popular Deathmatch) para jugar con hasta cuatro jugadores en simultánea. Mientras que el Modo Historia te permite elegir a cualquiera de las tres Academias (más una) para seguir sus historias hasta el final, esto sin mencionar las historias individuales para cada Shinobi en un día de la vida de cada una. Las voces están en Japonés con subtítulos en Inglés.

Mencioné que el juego está hecho de puro fanservice? Si les gustan los ninjas, las chicas, la violencia y la comedia, todo esto combinado en un sólo título, consigan este juego y prepárense para seguir el Sendero del Shinobi.

27299989.review:
*Connected to a lie detector* I play it for the plot *lie detector explodes*

[i]Edited after completing the game 100%[/i]
[b][u]Pros[/u][/b]
- The girls' art is really nice
- The combat system is quite good even if you have just a few buttons to press for attacks
- Every girl has a different fighting style so you can pick your favourite
- You can turn off or skip certain cutscenes if you don't feel like seeing it for the 100th time
- The music is good and suits the situation
- Subtitles even during the battle for the attacks so you don't miss anything that they say opposed to other games that skip those.
- Many costumes to wear and of course, underwear. Because even if you are a shinobi you can feel sexy kicking ass
- Panties lottery. I would totally play it in real life (owo)b
- For now I don't see it to be too hard to level up or make money to buy items at the shop. It might change later
- It comes with all of the DLCs included (thank you <3 )

- The DLC characters fight is challenging enough for end game once everything looks too easy. I found one of them the hardest in the game.

[b][u]Cons[/u][/b]
- Playing without a controller is a bit hard but it was expected and certain actions might be impossible (how do you even rotate my joystick as fast as you can on a keyboard?)
- After you finish a mission your only option is to continue, so if you wanted to be back to the menu or just choose another mission you have to wait for the next mission to start and then exit it.
- The camera doesn't show the action properly if you don't actively use the targeting system and even so sometimes it won't face to the direction you need
- Censorship? You could see it as funny since it's an ecchi game, not hentai, and it's not just a black circle (I saw Asuka heads for now xD) or what it would have been worse, every "dirty" scene be removed just to get on Steam (could the game even had been released then?)
- The fights can be quite short, especially if you are rushing to finish it as fast as you can for your rank
- It's too hard to play single-handed :(

- I must add that for certain heavy damage chars at around level 30 - 40 you are too OP for most bosses. In fact you can defeat them in 1 - 2 hits with a regular secret ninja art. It's too unbalanced later on.
- Every boss has the same tactic: stay normal till getting her HP down to 1/2, then use limit break and transform into shinobi. It'd be nice to see any going frantic instead or transform earlier. It ends up feeling like fighting the same character with different skills.

Summing up, regarless of its flaws and the controversy about being sexist, it's a so good game with a fun kind of ecchi and a nice Dynasty Warriors-like combat. I can't talk about the story since I haven't finished it yet but it looks promising.
Recommended :)

27016718.review:
Senran Kagura: Shinovi Versus is a beat 'em up/musou game which features busty broads and perveted but fun humor. The game plays out mission based, and you play as any of the 3 academies (unlocking 1 more later on) which have about 5 or so different characters in each. With a somewhat serious attempt at a story the game uses it's stereotypical character archetypes to carry the bland narrative across to the end of the main section of the game. 

The combat in Shinovi Versus is maybe where most of the subtance is in this game, it's got a high volume of different girls you can choose from, all feeling different to play with the exception of a few of the different sword wielding ones, but even those have different ultimate abilities and combos that anyone will probably be able to find at least one character they like playing. The problem with the combat for me was honestly the lack of customization and depth that you don't get with the sheer volume of different characters to play as, and not only that, if you find a particular girl you like to play as, its mostly tough luck in the main story section of the game since you're forced to play everyone an equal amount of times. This is offset though by these little side missions where they are purely focused on one character and are great for letting the player pick and choose which characters they like and only play them. Which leads me to another problem is that not all of the characters are unlocked at the beginning and require you to beat the first 3 Academy's stories then you unlock another academy with a whole new cast of characters to play as. A bigger issue I have during combat is really the types of enemies that get to have 'Super Armor' Which if you haven't played many action games, it's basically whenever you attack an enemy and the enemy doesn't stagger at all, basically making it impossible or hard to combo these enemies. In Senran Kagura, this ability that some enemies have though, is not restricted to just bosses or really big enemies, even smaller and regular cannon fodder have it, and it gets extremely aggravating to the point of breaking it's own flow of combat. It's really the biggest single gripe with the game that I have to wonder if the developers of this game even ever played another action game before using this feature so heavily. It's not helped by the fact that you cannot cancel mid-combo meaning when you commit to mashing buttons, you better be 100% sure that you're going to hit all of your attacks before you even think about pushing the block or dash button.

Senran Kagura is all about the player experience, it's tailored to make the player feel good and with a game focused around big bouncy bosom's and cheeky dialogue, it's only a given that you should be able to play virtual Barbie with each and every character in the game, customizing even down to the type of underwear they have on, which the player gets to see in gameplay when you take enough damage so your clothes rip off, or that you do enough damage to the enemy so that their clothes fall off just as well. There's no nudity though, the game censors itself kind of hilariously but modding the censor's off isn't worth it since there just isn't any nudity in the game at all. I feel the censoring works in the game's favor and fits with the overall themes of the game, but seeing how raunchy some parts of the game can be I could see how some players might feel 'short changed' because of the no nudity. I have to mention that this game was a PSVita port though, and was rated by the Japanese rating's board, CERO, which does not allow games with nudity to be sold at retail, or rather they give the game a rating to the equivalent an AO rating by the ESRB.

So yeah, Senran Kagura isn't even a great game by any means, but it has a niche audience that it caters to and does what it sets out to do, actually pretty nicely. 

If the idea of Japanese high school ninja girls with big bosom's fighting sounds at all like something you'd enjoy, you'll probably enjoy this game in some way or another.

I absolutely adore the Senran Kagura series, I've been in love with it since the very first game on the 3DS and I continue loving every single one of them.

Back when I first played it, I expected it just to be a little silly fun that I would forget in a day or two, to my surprise, I found an amazing story with endearing characters. Just like it happened for me with Monster Girl Quest. You come for the "plot", and you stay for the actual plot.

When Shinovi Versus was announced for the PC it was like a dream come true. I "Platinum"'d(it was the first game I ever 100%) it back on the PS Vita and bought it again on PC, the port isn't particularly amazing but it is pretty functional, just the multiplayer runs terribly.

Aside from the great story, the "Musou-lite" gameplay here is also really enjoyable, the OST is fantastic, and customizing the girls' outfits is always fun. 

I do enjoy the fanservice aspect of it, but this series is much, much more than just that.

26753982.review:
I've played a lot of DW-styled games. A lot. And I tend to spend more than a reasonable amount of time playing them. As far as things go, this game is not revolutionary for it's genre, however it's is fun in it's own right.
I'd like to preface the rest of this review by saying this is a tentative recommendation. The game definitely has it's fair share of flaws, but for what it does, it does it competently enough for the game to be enjoyable to the niche market the devs are aiming for.

Pros:
-The story is marginally better than Burst. The writing feels a fair bit less stilted and most characters have a few good moments. The different academies have a variance in the tone of the story, which helps the whole thing feel less repetitive.
-The gameplay is not cream of the crop, don't expect a Dynasty Warriors or Pirate Warriors level of polish here, but it is satisfying and enjoyable in it's own right. There are enough complexities that you won't get bored as some games.
-The soundtrack is actually an improvement - there are a number of memorable and catchy tracks that you'll probably want to go back and listen to them again.
-There is a good amount of content here. Even if you avoid replaying anything, and ignore the collectables and achievements you can rack up 25-30 hours of playtime broken up neatly between four academies.
-Lots of cute anime girls (Hikage is best girl).

Cons:
-The game seems to struggle with difficulty. The AI seems to switch on the fly from utterly mindbogglingly stupid to aggressive infinite combo beatdown. It's very jarring to see an AI than was giving you a hard time suddenly drop everything to taunt several times in a row. It's also entirely possible you'll do the DLC characters (Daidouji and Rin) side stories without realising how the final fights are one of the hardest in the game because they aren't really labelled as much more difficult (isn't this the point of having the difficulty meter?) than the main girls.
-They need to calm the hell down with the status effects. With how liberally they are applied, they seem to last too long. In particular the loss of control ones like freeze and paralysis aren't very fun to play against given you have no input for around 5 seconds at a time. These rarely result in you dying, but it doesn't feel very fun to be stuck doing nothing for an uncomfortable amount of time.
-The camera is just bad. There's no other way to say it. Half of the difficulty in this game is trying to get the camera to cooperate. With long range characters like Mirai who still need to use their lock on, the distance at which it breaks is just annoying. In addition, you'll often find yourself staring at a wall while your view of the characters on screen is completely blocked by it.
-All girls were not created equal and there are a few who just aren't very fun to play (Minori). This problem is further bogged down by the fact that when you first play a character, the vast majority simply do not have the tools unlocked to make them function as they should. This means that the first few levels are deeply painful until you start unlocking more moves.
-There's a decent amount of information that isn't made immediately obvious when you first play, but greatly impacts how you play a character. For example, Minori can throw stuff in her bucket. Over time and as you gain more hits, it changes color and grants you an attack power buff. The only place that you can learn about character specific quirks like this is the loading screens. However, if you're not a fast reader, it's very difficult to get all the information you need without having to look it up.

In summary, the game has it's fair share of flaws. But the pros are big enough that for people interested in this niche, they'll generally outweight the negatives. It's not as good as some of Koei's best, but it's not nearly as bad as some other games like Nep U.

26601310.review:
I got more than I was expecting, and that’s a good thing.
I wasn’t expecting much more than a fan service extravaganza, but under this surface is an actually good game. Actually I stated to get annoyed at the fan service scenes during battle that show up when you rip part of your opponent’s cloths, since this very short cut scene will most of the time break your combo string and shift momentum to the enemy. I got really into the game and I love almost all the characters move sets. There are only two characters in the game I hate because they are not interesting and they have awful moves, but I won’t say which ones because I don’t want to get flamed.
Most characters have a surprisingly sad backstory for what looked like a light hearted game, which was also a surprise…
I realize now that by avoiding saying names to prevent complains I can’t go into much detail about the game…

But it’s good, really good. It has something for everyone. It has all the major fetishes covered  and a customization option for extra fetishism.

The major negative for me is the lottery. As you play the chance of winning goes down, and when you’re one piece short for completion the chance of winning goes to 1% to a max 3%, but my problem is not this, is that you can’t skip the “surprise reveal” of your ticket, even when you are fully aware it’s not going to be it.

26573641.review:
I normally play games a lot longer before reviewing them.  I'd normally do so for this game, but then then a woman lifted up her dress, dropped a phalic shaped crew served weapon larger than she is out of her skirt, yelled "This is my Valkyrie!" and proceded to blow my blouse off.  After I wiped the WTF look off my face, I decided it was ok to review this game.

So what is it?  Well...it's a game about anime girls with big gainax anime boobies beating the clothes off of each other for increasingly obscure reasons related to creating reasons for anime girls with big gainax anime boobies to beat the clothes off of each other...and friendship?

First, this sits in the overwhelmingly positive side of steam reviews and the reason for that is...it's an extremely well polished beat-em-up.  Forget about the gainax anime boobies, they were thrown on top of a well polished beat-em-up which combines a character action game, with a fighting game, and Dynasty Warriors.  It blends it together and produces the gameplay style for this game.  It likely also received the critical praise it has because there are few competitors in the beat-em-up genre on PC or Steam and few can match this quality.

As far as the gameplay there are about 20 characters each with their own fighting styles  (weapon reach, speed, status effects), move sets, close attacks, ranged attacks, and special attacks.  The characters are functionally unique and require differing playing styles to excel at, something any beat-em-up fan will celebrate.  The controller in the game is familiar to a beat-em-up player - weak attack, strong attack, jump, dash, block, special.  The game doesn't do too good of a job explaining the nuances of the game's system and I had to look up some help while I was doing the tutorial for things like air raids and frenzy mode.

Single player includes four story modes for each of the character groups in the game, each character also has a story mode of about five missions, missions can also be played on hard mode with tougher ai enemies or simply replayed, so there is no shortage of content to enjoy.  The flow of a mission is usually a mook wave followed by one or more bosses who may or may not be accompanied with mooks.  There are several different maps with different terrain, the other characters you fight all have their own unique fighting style and the situations will call you to treat the environment differently depending on who you are facing.

On top of that is a multiplayer mode (which I haven't delved too deep in) which includes 4 player deathmatch and 2v2 matches online.  Though, the multiplayer has few people on it, you'll likely have to run bot matches or bring friends if you want to play.

Next is the environment and story which can be described as all-together wierd.  There is a line between wierd, funny, and obscene and the game manages to skate right on the line without falling down and landing in a broken heap at the bottom of a pile of...dirty panties?  Anyway the game manages to avoid taking itself seriously and it doesn't try to be so silly you can't enjoy the game.  Titilation is carefully managed with either humor or as a means to keep the game from becoming too serious and it manages it all without becoming offensive (beyond being a game about anime girls with big gainax anime boobies beating the clothes off of each other).  It takes real talent to do that.  As far as the WTF moments I've posted above, they will hit you over the course of the game, sometimes when you're actually reading the dialogue or sometimes with you get blasted topless with the phalic HMG and it's hilarious when it does happen.

In short, if you are a beat-em-up fan this is a game that belongs in your library.

Cosa dire di questo gioco?
Lo aspettavo da tanto l'uscita su PC, essendo che non ho una PSP e una PS4, ho potuto finalmente provare questo ormai famoso gioco, posso dire che non mi ha deluso per niente anche se non sono appassionato della serie.
Iniziando col dire che è una Hack and slash abbastanza piccante ma non troppo, sicuramente non raggiunge i livelli di un Hentai perché non lo è, il gioco mi ha molto divertito per la massa di gente (chiamata da me "Carne da macello") che puoi far fuori raggiungendo il boss finale, ma alla fine i Livelli sono questi quindi può diventare molto ripetitivo ma può essere perdonato dalle grandi quantità di rotondita mostrate ;), I personaggi sono veramente tanti e le mosse speciali tutte diverse, Le cose che non mi sono piaciute sono state la personalizzazione del personaggio e la modalità online, Personalizzazione poco curata e alcune volte i risultati possono essere orribili questa e come la penso io, La modalità online l'ho usata più meno 10 min. essendo che non si trova nessuno che gioca quindi passerete la maggior parte del tempo a fare tutti i Livelli in "A" o cambiare immediatamente il gioco (cose che spesso mi capitavano).
Pro: 
- Tanti personaggi
- Rotindità sempre in mostra
- gioco molto divertente 
- messo speciali spettacolari
- Grafica gradevole per gli occhi
Contro:
- Online Inesistente (Per la poca gente che gioca)
- Personalizzazione dei personaggi scarsa
- può diventare molto ripetitivo
Valutazione finale: 
7/10
lo consiglio a chi piace molto gli Hack and Slash e il genere Anime.
