23804184.review:
[h1]It's the best of the three Tamsoft games on Steam right now. I would suggest this one over the other 2 if you could only pick one.[/h1]

This game has as many santa outfits as a DOA5 DLC, except all the DLC here is included at no additional cost.(there are an insane amount of DLC accessories and costumes to unlock in game)

Tamsoft knows how to make satisfying combat systems, usually focusing on half naked ladies (Oneechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad is their creation for example) Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus benefits from all their expertise with prior ecchi-action games. Even though there is a lot of cheesecake the combat is not compromised and is really well done. [b]Good animations, solid character art and a fun costume customization system are what you can expect from Tamsoft, and this game has all that going for it.[/b]

There are lots of characters to play as and plenty of costumes, music and artwork to unlock. It uses the Visual Novel technique for story-telling, and the story is stupid of course but still enough to keep you moving with objectives and character motivation. There are three schools, each with thier own story and perspective. On top of that each character has thier own side story you can play though to see a more personal story outside of the overarching theme of the competition. 

While I don't find any of the characters as interesting as Neptune from HDN, they are some solid choices for Waifu material, in fact I see no lack of options. I think all the character archetypes are present, so something for everyone. Or if you are like me, you pick your favorite based on thier outfit, and there are some cool, silly and sexy designs to be found here.

[b]The boob and butt physics here are pretty epic [/b]and make watching the transformations and clothing destruction sequences entertaining. Amazing what a bit of anime butt giggle can do for your brain. 

As I said earlier, this is better than HDN Action Unleashed and Oneechanbara.  While I own several HDN games, and a couple of Oneechanbara games, this is my first Senran gaming experience. So if there was any bias, it should have been for the other titles. However, [b]for a variety of reasons SKSV really is more enjoyable and a better product than the other titles. [/b]

Compared to HDN Action Unleased, the combat in Senran is more exciting and less repeative. Instead of fighting 200 boring mobs and falling asleep you tend to fight smaller assortments of enemies, often in duels and the fights can end very fast keeping you alert.

Compared to Oneechanbara ZII Chaos, Senran has an overall better story presentation and IMHO better character shapes and special attacks. I enjoyed Oneechan, but after I beat it I felt no need to go back and unlock more costumes, skills or anything. Thats because Oneechan is a visual mess when you play it. Senran obviously has a totally different art direction, and leverages the anime styling and presentation to show off their shape, personalities and costumes regularly. This is noticeable in the story scenes and during gameplay.  If your main selling point is smexy action, I want to see it clearly. 

Also the enemies in Senran are better looking than most of the enemies in Oneechan and HDN. [b]Most of your fights in Senran are against equally hot chicks[/b], that actually have their own special attacks that look cool. This won't sound nice, but [b]it's more fun to beat up on cute anime chicks and watch there clothes break than it is to cut zombies in half. [/b]

23753586.review:
After giving this game a day of my life or so, I 've finally gotten a good grasp of this game's [strike]boobs[/strike] content, totally meant to say content.

Fighting character to character, you find niches that work well, certain moves that are guarunteed punishers, and often times very annoying spamming (fucking Yomi, you spinning piece of shit). Once you find a character you're good with, they pretty much become universal, especially if you cap their Yin, Yang, and Flash skills. There's no hard counters in game, just fighting, which I'm okay with.

I fight mostly as Ryona, shooting and dancing everywhere, and it's fun. Does enough damage too when it's time to punish.

Also, there's alot of transformation sequences that can get old. Thank goodness they have a skip button for each one, even specials.

For downsides, well it's really close to your normal DW game. Mobs, Bosses that are just comboing mobs, rare 2v1 events, and so on. Then there's the lack of that DW feeling of going into a huge swarm ofenemies, since you go to alot of premade areas and paths that give you limited enemies. YOu'll find yourself repeating missions often just to grind one character, which can become dull if you try for multiple characters.

Also, get a controller. Even if it' a cheap one, it helps so much more than the keyboard. I could feel the cramping trying to dodge. DW had that in common, considering how you play anyways.

They're slowly but sure fixing the bugs in the game (they're very few from my playthroughs) and I look forward to fully completing the game.

Edit 8/14
So I've beaten the game with all schools and I enjoyed the journey. Knowing that there's even more before this game and after it, it makes me want to watch the series and pickup Esitval Versus, even if I have to [strike] become a peasant[/strike] buy it on console. Yes, I'm interested in the story too. The boobs just covered up alot of it.

The DLC char's Daidoji and Rin are broken to all hell btw, Rin moreso because of her speed. Daidoji is Jotaro and you cannot tell me otherwise.

Lastly... Well, there's modding now. Only a bit but I'm sure that there'll be more options to extend the lifespan of this game. Will it last long enough to reach Estival Versus on PC? Nah, this isn't Skyrim. But I'm positive that the mods will keep things interesting.

Alright, that's enough babbling. Go play some Boob Jiggle the Game already.

23669991.review: As I wrote somewhere else, if there's a game you shouldn't judge by its cover, that's Senran Kagura. I just did the test over and over, and the result was always the same. "Haha Fanservice - The Game" "Wow this game must have some great plot" and such. If you're trying to get into this game, and at least, understand what happened before, I'd suggest you to play Senran Kagura Burst or watch the anime first, as it explains the conflict between Hanzo and Hebijo schools, but hey, we're talking about a spinoff, so don't bother about it too much, as most characters' backstories are already explained there, and that's where SK gets good. Aside the monster-sized boobs, the characters are well developed, each one with its reason of why they became a shinobi, and how they relate between each other makes the game quite interesting. I swear, I was kinda disappointed by the plot in this game, as the 3DS titles (Senran Kagura Burst and Senran Kagura 2 Deep Crimson) had a much more interesting plot (and longevity), but I actually liked the gameplay here, kinda repetitive as you just have to smack a lot of foes and other shinobis mixed with ecchi stuff and boobs, but I really enjoyed the side-stories of each character, as some were really funny, and the online side, which let me check out how other players play, and actually improve myself through practice. Although my PC doesn't meet the reccomended requirements (got a GTX560 there) the game runs smoothly even at 1080p HD, while my old laptop (integrated graphic card) runs it at full speed ONLY if the game is on the lowest resolution, otherwise it'll just have costant framedrops. If you're planning to get this game I'd highly suggest to play the first game (Senran Kagura Burst, although the framerate might not be that good) or watch the anime (although it doesn't have the Hebijo's story side, and it has tons of fanservice) as it lets you understand what happened before SV.

23650776.review:
Gameplay-wize it's pretty fun, It controls pretty well and most missions involve first pitting you dynasty warriors style against massive hordes of enemies and being able to wreck them with relative ease before facing a boss, or on occasion just the boss with a horde around them.  

Of course that probably won't be the main reason you’re planning to by the game. To call this game a bit sexualized would be like saying Hitler was only a bit of an asshole. All of the playable characters wear outfits that can be damaged and destroyed by incoming damage and the same applies to bosses as well often meaning a hard battle will leave both fighters in nothing but their underwear. I believe about only a tenth of the space the game takes up on my computer is to do with gameplay and story. The games shop as a mini game where you can wager some of your money from missions to earn random pairs of undergarments, the bras of which seem to be rather useless and jiggle physics are incredibly prevalent and almost every action, even in the visual novel style cutscenes, causes their breasts to bounce and jiggle like there in the middle of an earthquake, It got to the point where I found it all more funny then erotic.

In the end I would recommend this game to anyone who likes stylistic combat but felt what was currently on steam didn't have enough soft-core porn and panties.

23647860.review: Why do I purchase this game, for cute girls or for JP CVs? If this is how otaku is, then I accept this life.

23647379.review:
Bueno, que les puedo decir este juego lo venia esperando desde hace mas de 1 año por un anuncio en una pagina gamer, y debo decir que dicha espera valio la pena, dejando el ambito sexista del juego, este cumple con su cometido ya que es un musou (sí, asi se llama este genero, no es hack and slash por dios) hecho y derecho con un muy buen sistema de experiencia que se dividira en el que ira a nuestro nivel base y la experiencia que gana el atributo segun nuestro modo de pelea. Ahora pasare a explicar punto a punto los aspectos del juego.

[b]Historia:[/b] La historia nos centra luego de la derrota de orochi, (si no tenien una 3DS para jugar a la precuela Senran Kagura Burst no se preocupen, vean el anime y asunto resuelto) en esta ocasion las shinobi deberan pelear en un encuentro entre escuelas adiriendo la academia Gessen, Hebijo y el escuadron de renegadas de Homura (ya ellas decidieron abandonar la academia luego del desastre). Todas las historias tienen algo que las conecta ya sea datos pequeños que complementan a la historia central del juego, pero obviamente veremos diversos finales segun la academia que elijamos y como un plus por terminar las 4 campañas tendremos una memorable batalla final.

[b]Jugabilidad:[/b] Bueno aqui señores aqui me pondre serio, muchos seguro diran: !Es repetitivo solo debes avanzar en un escenario y curtir hordas de enemigos totalmente inutiles!. A ver, esto es un musou, el musou no es igual a Hack and Slash, si piensas comprar el juego ten esto presente, ya que se te hara repetitivo, no tendras un mundo abierto para pasear, es elegir una misiones, curtir a la parda de enemigos que vendran y luego a un boss. En cuanto a combos, si bien las animaciones varian segun el persona debo decir que no considero combo spamear X y Y en distinto orden pero bueno   , me he topado casos peores asi que lo puedo perdonar. Las tecnicas especiales son impecables, cambian radicalmente segun el personaje, cosa que me facina y en cuanto al sistema de experiencia tanto de nivel como de atributo nos da nuevas posibilidades para hacer nuestro combate cada vez mas frenetico.

[b]Graficos:[/b] Es un port nada mas, no veran ningun avance grafico si lo quieren comparar con su version original de psvita. Pero debo admitir que me facina el estilo del mundo y su animacion 3D en los personajes ya que es sencilla y queda bien esteticamente.

[b]Contenido:[/b] El juego esta 100% completo, todos sus DLC respectivos y demas. En este aspecto me limitare a decir que me parece perfecto ya que estoy arto de comprar juegos que no tienen ni el 50% de su contenido y me obligan a comprar sus DLC.

[b]Online:[/b] Muy bien logrado a mi parecer, si bien hay personajes OP, la habilidad juega un rol importante ya que aqui todos tendran el mismo nivel para evitar desbalances.

Pros:

- Historia larga.
- Muchas misiones secundarias.
- Altamente rejugable (si te gusta el genero obviamente).
- Nivel de personalizacion altisimo en los personajes.
- Graficos muy llamativos.
- Banda sonora (en mi opinion es bastante buena).
- Variedad de personajes y tecnicas.
- Personalidad unica en cada personaje.

[b]Contras:[/b]

- Combo monotomo (spam X y Y para vencer).
- Nivel de dificultad medio pobre (aun jugando en dificil)

10/10 Ya que para mi la dificultad no hace bueno a un juego y los combos monotomos se compensan con el aditivo que dan los atributos y tecnicas.

23642615.review:
Despite it's art style which can turn as much people off as much as it does turn on, I honestly had fun with it. What you basically got here is a basically a Dynasty Warriors style game mixed with Dead or Alive-tier girls, it's a basic button masher where you fight through loads of enemies and occasionally clothes get ripped off. It's goofy, it's very Japanese, and it plays good, especially with a controller, and though the PC port is barebones as far as customization options go (some anti aliasing would be nice) it runs pretty well.

If I had to find some complaints with the game, despite the large roster of playable characters the game can get repetitive because you're mainly fighting in the same environments against the same characters over and over again. Though there are 4 story modes the plot isn't that interesting compared with it's sequel Deep Crimson on 3DS and you'll forget about it eventually. And the transformation/clothes ripping scenes get annoying when you do side stories as they cause the dialogue to repeat again and again.

But in spite of those faults, I'd recommend the game, provided you like beat em ups and can look past the artstyle, as there's a ton of content, and because it's a port of a handheld game, you can easily pick it up and play it whenever you want due to the fast missions. If you're still on the fence, I'd recommend picking it up for $20.

23617715.review:
This game is lots of fun and casual friendly! Thats a great option to be honest! I always wanted to play a game like this , thats doesnt make me go rage or getting frustating and stuck at one mission forever,because its to hard or so.The mission on "normal" are really easy and interesting.Of course there are mostly peoples , that search for challenge and this game offer you "challenges" aswell , if you go for hardmode for example , then its a bit more harder ...

This game is really nice for round about 25 different stories ( 4 "main" stories and rest some unique Character Stories).Some of them are really fun , Some are sad , some are weird and some are really enjoyable and encourage you to play it.
Honestly ? I never got bored , even , if i fought the same characters from each shool at one main story,because the background is totally different or you learn more background stuff about all those characters or understand stuff now more than before.
Of course ! All chats between those characters or stories end up in fights , which is kinda funny sometimes or kinda weird, but we shouldn't forget its a fight game!Hell yeah! Its a great one! 

How about combat ? The combat buttons are kinda same way like pressing 1-2 buttons for attacks , which can end up in a few combos, but they all feel different , because each character plays different for example some characters are better to be played with weak attacks ,while other requires more strong/slow attacks.Also each character got a shinobi mode , a normal mode and a frantic mode ,which give each character THREE differents ways to fight and to play, because frantic makes you more vurnerable but also more stronger ,while shinobi makes you more tankier and heals your health.
So you got like 60+ different fight styles,which is pretty nice tbh.
Of course you can block or dodge attacks ,which offers you some options to defend ,which some games lacks or makes blocking or dodging useless , but this game do it right and brilliant in my opinion ! 2 defend options are nice !

Also this game got a leveling system ,which keeps you busy after you completed the entire story and once its completed you can play each story stage with different characters of each shool ( Main story only and only with characters from that shool).You can improve your shinobi state or frantic or your normal state and also your health/dmg/def,which kinda makes you able to create your own fighting style or well play style.

And yes ! You can shatter clothes and lingerie until there is nothing left on their bodies.It does looks nice (!), but on some intense fights for myself . i wish i could turn it off ,because even , if i press a key to skip it .it kinda interrupts me in combat and makes it less smoothly or sometimes i press all those buttons too fast , that i accidently skip it.
The Physics is nice and the customisation of your characters is great , even , if some shinobi outfits looks soooooo much better than some "normal" outfits ,which makes it kinda difficult to find a good outfit+ with more money you can unlock more slots for accessoirs or more outfits.

Also the enviroment got some variantions not a lot , but you notice that there are like six maps ,which are a bit repetive , but the enemies changes or the way you go sometimes change, but honestly ? I dont care this game grants me some nice visuals fighting and shattering effects on clothes , have a funny/sad/weird/intense story,Characters with background+ different playstyle and fightstyle, simple combat lines ,a leveling system and of course a multiplayer mode ,which i haven`t tried yet+ ONE FINAL BATTLE mode which is one of the three toughest fight i ever had in this game and all DLCS ARE FOR FREEE !!!! 

I LOVE THIS GAME ! IM GLAD ITS THERE ! AND NOW IM HOPING FOR MORE GAMES OF THIS SERIES FOR PC !!!!!

I HOPE SENRAN KAGURA ESTIVAL VERSUS WITH ALL DLC'S WILL COME TO PC !! PLEASE STEAM !!!!

Если в кратце, то игра повествует о тяжёлой жизни девушек ниндзя: об изнуряющих тренировках, о фантастических сражениях(один... простите, одна против толпы), об их повсежневной жизни и всему прочему, чем так насыщена жизнь девушек обучающихся в подобном учреждении.

23561327.review:
There are no good Senran Kagura games except for the rhythm game Bon Appetit. I've played them all and they're all terrible. Shinovi Versus is no different.

With double the girls of the previous in the series (Though technically this is the second of five games, chronologically fourth...), Senran Kagura manages such little variety, and such little combat depth that even the weakest musou games look down on this mess. XXXYBXXXY. Bam, that's the game. Period for all 22 or so girls.

Don't worry about the chronology nonsense, the game does a respectable job catching you up. "But wait," you say, "Nobody plays a titdees game for the plot." Shut up. Literally half the gametime is plot. VN segments bookend every level with hokey tragedies (And hokey rehashes of tragedies we had LAST game.) pasted on to each girl so you're asked to pretend the girl who literally lusts after other girls boobs in so crass a way as to make Master Roshi blush is somehow a deep and fulfilling character. The only narrative trick on offer is juxtaposing the monstrous and the cutesy. Let me summarize how awful the writing is in this game with a straightforward example: The good girls team's story has them learn the lesson that zealously rooting out and combatting evil is itself evil and you're just a big mean stuck up jerk if you do that. The evil girls story? They kill every one of the good girls one by one. KINDA AT CROSS PURPOSES, HUH.

By now, you're asking, why the thumbs up? Well, I'm dumb enough to keep buying and playing these games for one. They are certainly doing something right. For all the crappy content in this game, and there is a lot of rehashed content, something like 80+ missions across 8 or so actual levels using all the different girls, for all the bouncy boobies, all the underwear you're collecting, all that waifu dress up you're doing, all the boring ninjas you either shred through or spam supers through... at some point the sum of all its crappy parts come together as an all-purpose otaku package. The girls are absolutely adorable, and when the game doesn't take itself seriously, it is so ridiculous as to be worth a laugh.  It helps that the port is solid, too.

I will never defend Senran Kagura. The series is trash. It fails as a musou, fails as a brawler, fails as a VN, but somewhere at the intersection of all this madcap failure and all these boobies and waifus and shredded clothes and this bombast, it is still fun to muck with in small doses. So yes, it's worth playing even if it is absolute garbage in every individual regard.

23551427.review:
Just finished the game. The game consists of four schools. You can choose any school to start playing with and can change to any other schools at any time you like. Finish the first three schools to unlock the fourth one (Or can use a cheat to unlock it earlier if you don't care about the story). Each school has 5 chapters and each chapters consist of 5 stories. Each school also have 5 different playable characters and 2 of the schools have 2 extra DLC characters purchasable in the store in game. Each characters also have their own story modes to unlock new arts, music, voices and lingeries. After completing all the stories, the final battle will be available.
Pros
Amazing gameplay (Yes, very similar to dynasty warriors)
Nice graphics (Originally from PS Vita but it is ported well onto the PC version)
Nice storyline
Great characters
Awesome music and sounds
All DLC are included in the game for you to purchase (No extra cost like the Vita version ;)
BEWBS! (Yes we all came for the plot ;)
Cons
Not too many downsides but one of the most frustrating thing in the game is the loading screen. After finishing anything in this game (even saving). The loading screen will appear and last for an average of 10+ seconds. 
Opening the game also takes a while (Once again the loading screen when opening your save files)
Overall it is one of my favourite games to be released! Especially on PC!
All hail the mighty BEWBS!
69/10 jiggle physics ;)

PSVITA版が出ていた時からやってみたいと思っていましたが、VITAを買わずに放置していたと所STEAM版リリースのアナウンスが！
しかも安い！

アクションゲームは苦手なのですが、割と簡単に技が繰り出せるので爽快感があります。（少々大味気味ですが）
それはともかく、皆巨乳ぞろいでゆれまくり。服を破壊すれば下着が、絆創膏やさきっぽをSDキャラで隠す等下ネタ満載。
おバカなゲームが好きな方にお勧めです。

惜しいのはシステムの造りが雑な点。
ローディングが頻繁にあるにも係らず、ストーリーを最初からスキップする等、ロード待ちのストレスを低減する工夫が足りません。レベル上げ等、バトルのみやりたい時にもどかしさを感じます。

尚、ゲームではなくwindouws8以降のシステムに不具合があり、application.exeのエラーで止まる場合は以下の方法を試してください。
ctrl+shiftを押しながらESCでタスクマネージャーを開きます。
サービスタブを開き、その中から「TabletInputService」を停止させてください。

この方法でゲームが止まることがなくなりました。

この情報を書き込んで下さった方に感謝申し上げます。

23518947.review: Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus secondo me, è un gioco molto divertente e sexy, infarcito di fanservice, per cui chi non adora tutto questo fanservice dovrebbe starne alla larga. Avevo provato per la prima volta quello per 3DS e da lì è stato amore a prima vista. I personaggi (o personagge lool) sono tutte molto belle ed esagerate nelle proporzioni come i giapponesi ci hanno abituato negli anime e manga. Però non finisce qua, ognuna ha un suo stile di lotta, la sua storia e il suo carattere, questa è una delle cose che mi piace di più di Senran Kagura. Il gioco è un clsssico hack n' slash dei bei tempi del megadrive e snes, che a me piace e non dispiace. La trama e il gameplay sono semplici e basta schiacciare a caso i tasti per riuscire ad andare avanti nella storia o livelli che dir si voglia. Poi i vestiti delle belle fanciulle vengono fatti a pezzi e lasciano poco spazio all'immaginazione lol XD. Io apprezzo molto questa serie anche se non è capolavoro. Per giocarlo bisogna amarne i personaggi soprattutto e la pazzia nipponica. In definitiva e un bel gioco che consiglio oltre che ai fan anche a chi piacciono i vecchi hack n slash alla tmnt dei tempi del megadrive e snes. Da provare!

23514159.review:
Lets go over some important points:
-Runs well on mid-tier hardware.
-Good keyboard/mouse support for a game designed around a controller
-Default border-less window mode
-Great backstories for the girls
-Tight gameplay with good visuals
-Lots of content and unlocks to keep completionists playing and average gamers satisfied
-VERY easy to mod

Cons:
-Balance. Some girls are flat out stronger than others.
-Difficulty seems to range from three separate spaces. Easy, medium, or questionably possible. Nothing in-between. Hanzo 6-5 is near impossible.
-Loading screens are a timer. Tested on a slower hard drive and my new SSD. Both took 26 seconds at the same loading screens.

vitaの体験版で迷っていたのですがSteamで公開されたので思い切って購入して正解でした。
おっぱいのことは他の方が散々レビューしてますので割愛するとして…
「アクションはちょっと苦手…」という人にこそおすすめできるアクションだと思います。
かくいう自分も実はシビアな操作を要求されるアクション物は(かなり)苦手なのですが
1つか2つのコンボを覚えればあとはどのキャラでもほとんど使い回しができるので
凄くプレイしやすいです。
あとは敵を真正面に置いてボタン連打で倒せます。

上記のことをメリットと取るかデメリットと取るかは人によるでしょうね。
あくまでも

・アクションが少し苦手だけど可愛い女の子を使いたい
・国産のゲームがやりたい
・余計なことを考えず手軽に爽快感を味わえるゲームをやりたい

というのに当てはまる人にはおすすめです。
逆に

・やりごたえ、歯応えのあるがっつりアクションがやりたい
・格ゲーのような駆け引きを楽しみたい
・自分でコンボを考えたり、組み合わせたりしていろんなキャラでいろんなコンボの組み合わせを考察したい
・エロ要素は邪魔なだけ

という人にはおすすめしません。
なので「おすすめしますか？」という問いにはどちらとも言えないというのが本音です。
あくまでアクションの苦手な私はハマれた、というレビューになってしまいます。

ぜひともこの次のシリーズに当たるEVも移植して欲しいですね。
なお、対戦システムは実績解除のためにCPUと1度しかプレイしていないので対戦に関してはいまいちよくわかりません。
(PvPなどの対戦するゲームも気持ち的に苦手なのです…)

実績は全て英語になっていますがvitaのトロフィーとたぶん同じようなので
そこはwikiでも見ながらやれば実績解除はわかると思います。

私の中で残念に思えたのは、
資料室で閲覧できる、一部のセリフ入りのイラストが、サムネイルでは日本語なのに
拡大表示させると英語になってしまうことでしょうか…

※パッチにて、現在は拡大表示させても日本語で表示されるようになりました

23496955.review:
I know what you're thinking: "BOOBS! GLORIOUS BOOBS! That alone merits it's purchase!"

And you'd be right! But what if I told you that boobs are merely the desert of the Five-star dinner that is Senran Kagura? That's right! The slick, silky-smooth and frantic combat will eat hours of your time as you level your waifu to her full potential! Don't worry too much about the game being too easy, there is a hard mode in the mission selection menu. The hard mode WILL test your skills.  

The characters, despite being a bunch of gimmicky pervs and almost litterally constructed from ALL the oldest and tiredest japanese waifu tropes, are actually pretty well-written. I found them to be quite nuanced and relatable humens.Every character has motivations, things they are proud of, hobbies they enjoy and flaws to overcome. The story is surprisingly engaging thanks to these girls. The drama of some of the stories is one of the thing I was surprised I stayed for. The feels are real, friend. It's not all drama, though. There is plenty of quirky fun to be had as well, likely involving their boobs.

And now we've come full circle. For a handheld port, it has some pretty nice physics and charater models. The clothing destrcution during combat also gives a nice view of the "assets." Though I do wish there was an option to turn off the cutscenes since they do interupt the flow of the battle. The dressing room is where you can customize your waifu. You can also stare at them and make them feel uncomfortable. And jiggle their boobs, and poke their butt. Despite all the glorious ways you can molest your waifu, you'll find the dressing room fun-times a mere intermission between the missions. 

 The game is surprisingly robust for a Vita port. Lot's to do and many waifus to choose from. You will find a favorite by the end. There is a waifu for everyone here. Don't fight it, just accept your fate.








Hikage is best Senran

23488936.review:
So, this is not a game to play if you can't enjoy extreme fanservice. It isn't a game to play if you dislike very anime writing. It isn't a game that I imagine most people will be able to get into for a variety of reasons... but me? I love this game. I've played at least tripple the time shown, most of it offline mode.

Background: I actually watched the anime for the plot, and enjoyed my way through about a quarter of the original 3DS game. Playing it on the 2DS was a little bit meh compared to a controller, plus there are benefits to a PC version for a fanservice game, like resolution. Coming to this game I wasn't sure what to expect, but I love the characters, and XSeed doing the release had me knowing the localization wouldn't be obnoxious like the later Neptunia Rebirths have been. Seriously, XSEED means quality.

Music and sound design are really solid.

The FPS does dip time to time, so I feel like bragging about 60FPS is a bit of a lie. If/when this changes I will note it here if I remember. However, it moves quite fluidly. Some combinations of stages/opponents just seem to make a bit of lag- but not input lag, so you can flow with it pretty well.

The gameplay is really fun. I've been told it's a lot like the Dynasty Warrior series in some ways, fight a lot of mooks, then go after a boss. The bosses are the game's real spectacle. Doing break attacks will destroy their clothing, weakening them, and encouraging them to transform into their second outfit - which you can do, too! Or you can break off your own clothes and go frantic, a high risk, high reward mode with high damage but pitiful defenses. Each character (there are many, though a fair few play like eachother this isn't really /bad/) has two Ninja Arts, powerful attacks that you have a limited supply of energy for--gained from items in the stages or by dealing damage. If you finish off an opponent with one of these attacks, and their clothes are destroyed down to their underware, their bra or panties will be demolished. By default, this leads to very cute censorship of a chibi face over their naughty bits. I'm not ashamed to say that I'm a horrible pervert, and I've found mods to take care of this. It's a cheesecakey game about cheesecake. I respect it not being over the top due to standards you need to sell games, but I also appreciate it doesn't really add anything once the humor wears off.

The story is good if you like these characters-- which I do. Yeah, the writing can be a bit annoying with characters claiming to "not be using their full power" after you beat them up, but that managed to not get on my nerves too bad because I knew I'd be kicking their asses and having them eat their words later. The characters are all pretty lovable, and the sory revealed details that weren't in the anime or first game which I found thoroughly enjoyable to explore. I'm only 1/4th done with the story, and while it isnt complex the character interactions are great!

Oh that's the thing, too. You get four plots, and four sets of character stories to play through. Lots of content. A bit redundant, repetetive? Sure. There's multiplayer, too, but I haven't taken the time to explore it. Yet! May update this if/when I do.

And you can play dressup. Sexy dressup. Unlike the Vita version, all of the DLC is there by default. You don't get everything auto unlocked, but when you fight battles you earn money. This money is ONLY used to unlock clothes, soundtrack options, etc. So it's basically just for fun. It's enjoyable as ever to give Yagyu two eyepatches, or dress up Asuka like Rin, or put Katsuragi in even skimpier outfits, the like of which she first wanted to be using for her shinobi transformations anyway.

If this sounds at all appealing, you will enjoy it more than you expect to! If not, I apologize, but it has been a heck of a riot for me :)

23480051.review:
Having played Burst and Deep Crimson (the main series and first two installments), I can safely say if you're new to the games, SV is a great place to start. SV has more character customization than the rest of the series, runs on any computer (currently running it on a 2014 non-gaming laptop with no strain on my computer), comes with all DLC, and even if you haven't played the main series, they still cover all the important parts of the story. If you have played the main series, you'll love seeing Hanzo and Crimson Squad back interacting with two new schools.

Compared to the mains, the combat is different. The original two were 2.5D side-scrollers, whereas SV is fully 3D. For me personally I feel as though the translation for some of the original characters to 3d combat was rough and deserved a little more attention (*WHEEZING COUGH*mirai*HACK HACK COUGH COUGH*), but none of the new cast shares the same problems.

  If you're looking for a serious fighting game that requires strategy and has deep and meaningful story you'll have to look elsewhere. Many of the characters you can cheese through the game (and 2 or 3 outright are unfairly overpowered), whereas only a few characters arguably require at least a little thought when it comes to playing. The story is relatively simple to follow, but if you're really hooked on the actual plot then I would recommend Burst and Deep Crimson over SV (plus you get to see how Hanzo and Crimson first met).

  Overall I would give this game a 7/10 as I preferred Deep Crimson altogether but I enjoyed SV for a refreshing new cast and better customization.

23466178.review:
I bought this game because it was a hack and slash, and because I thought it would be a good time waster that night.
I then went on to play it in binges of almost 6 hours.
The game was really fun, and it actually made me laugh at points.  
Most people are going to look at this because of "anime tiddays", but there's actually more to the game than that.
On it's own, it's a pretty well crafted game.  The combat felt good, wasn't overcomplicated, but still had a bit of depth to it for those who want to try the game on hard mode.  For example, you've got air raves, dash canceling, a parry system, an emergency escape, and every character has 3 "modes".
You start in the "Flash" mode, and from there you can switch to either "Yin", or "Yang". 
Yang restores your lost health and gives you a form change and a different moveset (varies).
Yin, does not restore health or change form, but it changes your moveset, lowers your defense, but greatly raises your damage.


Now this is all just one huge wall of text, but It's what I thought I needed to write.
tl;dr:  The games more than just anime and boobs, and it's pretty fun.

23464691.review:
Senran Kagura es un juego que me ha enamorado, lo que resulta muy curioso, porque hasta ahora no me gustaban ni los juegos de lucha, ni los juegos altamente sexualizados. Pero bueno, intentaré dar una opinión imparcial y resumida:

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*] Humor absurdo y tronchante
[*] Conversaciones disparatadas y originales que te pillarán desprevenido
[*] Mecánicas de combate bien trabajadas
[*] Combate frenético y muy satisfactorio
[*] Todos los personajes son únicos tanto jugablemente como en la personalidad
[*] Mucha profundidad en los personajes,  ninguno es plano (física ni psicológicamente, excepto Mirai, que es una loli)
[*] Duración bastante decente
[*] Rendimiento impecable, incluso mi lavadora puede ejecutarlo a 60fps
[*] Las escenas de destrucción de ropa, transformación y artes secretas se pueden desactivar a placer
[*] Mods
[*] Tetas
[*] Hanzou
[/list]

[h1]Contras:[/h1]
[list][*] Muy difícil de jugar con teclado
[*] Humor absurdo
[*] La historia principal no es nada del otro mundo
[*] En algunas partes del a historia hay tochos de texto con una imágen estática de fondo.
[*] Las misiones se pueden hacer repetitivas (limpia estos enemigos inútiles y mata al boss)
[*] Curva de dificultad inestable, teniendo niveles muy fáciles seguidos de otros frustrantemente difíciles.
[*] El juego puede resultar demasiado fácil, incluso en modo difícil, si se usan mucho las técnicas ninja.
[*] Excesiva cantidad de tetas (solucionable con mods)
[*] Censura (también solucionable con mods)
[*] Para cerrar el juego hay que retroceder un montón de menús hasta volver al menú principal
[*] [Strike]El juego crashea si tienes una tableta de dibujo o cualquier dispositivo parecido conectado al ordenador (desenchufarlo es suficiente)[/strike] Arreglado en la versión [1.03]
[/list]


[h1]Opinión final:[/h1]
Si tieneís un mando y no os molesta ver continuamente chicas con poca (o ninguna) ropa, recomiendo que le deís una oportunidad. El tiempo que he pasado jugándolo me he divertido muchísimo y a parte de las pegas que he mencionado arriba (de las cuales la mayoría tienen solución) no le he encontrado ningún problema. ¡Estoy seguro que os encantará!

23458528.review:
This is another port I was not expecting to come on PC, but I ain't complaining, at least not too much. While the port is not perfect, at least it's better than some other Japanese developed PC ports like Phantom Breaker: Battlegrounds, Akiba's Trip, and most ports from Koei Tecmo. For the most part, it is recommended to play with a gamepad, but you can use the keyboard just fine, but you have to go into the setting to look up the binds and change them accordingly to what feels comfortable to you since the default bindings are not that good. Like most ports, they still give you button prompts for a gamepad hence gives you another reason to look up the key bindings in the settings menu. Also mouse support in the menus. THE MENUS!!! WHERE ALMOST EVERY SINGLE PORT FROM JAPAN DOES NOT GIVE YOU ON PC!!!!!

I gotta say, the brawling feels immensely satisfying with the fast-paced animations and flashy effects, but initially when a character is at level 1, they don't feel that interesting to play, but it is easy to get out of that. Speaking of easy, aside from unexpected stun locks, the overall difficulty is pretty easy despite the existance of a harder difficulty setting so fighting the minions get pretty boring afterwards so the only saving grace for me are the character duels [spoiler](expect to see a huge difficulty spike on Daidoji's final mission in her story arc while Rin's last story mission is not as hard, but still can destroy you)[/spoiler]. 

Despite it being a bit of a mess, an online multiplayer mode actually exist. I didn't really touch the multiplayer all that much, but what I found was that my keyboard controls were completely botched and the framerate was noticably worse when playing with 3 other bots for some reason. As for the overall power of the characters, they seemed to be toned down to a degree to keep certain characters from being straight up better than others, more specifically ones that have elemental stunning abilities like freezing and electrocution. Because the power level has to be toned down, it also sacrifices the satisfaction of watching flashy combos so most of the excitement from those ridiculous combos are just nowhere to be found, at least that's what I thought.

As for the economy system, you can pretty much buy clothing for anybody of your choosing just because you can. No stat boosting, no side effects, just purely cosmetic for your virtual waifu. And yes there is a slot machine section where you unbox undergarments because reasons, but hey, it's there if you need to unbox stuff without spending $2.49 for some stupid CS GO skins or something.

Is there a story? Sort of, but it's really nothing to write home about so I ended up skipping the dialogue since it really is just typical anime so you ought to just take it or leave it as is. Music is great though, I'm always a sucker for music.

Is this worth your $30? If you like watching busty anime high school girls fight with each other along with some pretty simple, but satisfying combat mechanics, then Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus is the game for you. However, if you're looking for a game that provides a more challenging experience, why did you stop playing Dark Souls just to look at this?

#updated July 6, 2016
At first glance one may assume it is a fan-service game of dressing a character and destroying opponent clothes but it is not just about fan-service. The game provides an intriguing story filled with drama & comedy which are very meaningful per character and their schools. The story may seem intertwine at first but it's actually very distinct or follows a different storyline per school. In addition it has an online PvP system where players can create a challenge for others to participate or just compete with AI, a bonus for this game.

Gameplay: 8 (Each character distinct moveset)
Music / BGM: 9
Story: 9
Overall: 8.7

Pros:
1. All DLCs are bundled together with the game
2. An arsenal of 22 characters (4 schools)
3. Fan-service
4. Intriguing story (comedy, honor, etc)
5. An array of music to entertain you
6. Gacha system for the lottery with ingame currency (no need to spend real life $$)
7. Loads of costume (customizable per character)
8. Each character includes their very own personal story (which sort of keeps players in touch with the character)
9. Option to turn off cutscenes of Shinobi Transformation, Ninja Arts and Clothes tearing

50/50
1. Missions sometimes just follow suit after completing one mission
2. Grinding business of the flower of balance (Yin, Yang and Flash)

Cons:
1. Presently the opening video has some issues of flashy stripe
2. Some FPS issues in some PvP map 
3. Repetitive introduction (unskippable for the character the player is using for a mission and intro is replayed for bosses)
4. Only 3 types of final strip ending

23444463.review:
nach 35 Stunden Spielzeit hab ich das Game auf 100% (Erfolge) gemacht, jedoch wen man in jeder Mission A und alle 3 Spezialleisten (Flash, Yin und Yang) füllen will mit jedem Charakter dauert es sicher 130 Stunden um alles abzuschließen.

Story unterteil sich auf 4 Schulen (3 Schulen und 1 Shinobi Abtrünnige) die jweiles eine andere Story erzählen, jeder der einzelnen Stories dauern wen man sich die Gespräche und Ereignise durchliest um die 5 Stunden, die Geschichten sind großteils lustig aber versuchen auch hin und wieder ernst zu werden aber die ernsten Gespräche werden oft vergessen wen man dann ins Kampfgeschehen kommt und man die Riesenberge der Characktere sieht. 
Ich finde man sollte nicht versuchen diese Story melodramatisch machen.
Die einzelnen Stories hingegen sind immer lustig und die Bilder danach sind einfach süß, lustig und oftmals etwas pervers.

Gameplay: Mir persönlich macht das Gameplay richtig Spaß vor allem spielen sich alle characktere anders und daher ist für jeden was dabei. Das Spiel besteht aus 2 verschiedenen Kampf-Arten:

1. Mengen-Kampf: Der Mengen Kampf ist schon wie gesagt gegen viele einzelne Gegner die zwar viele sind aber nicht gerade stark.

2. "Boss-Kampf": Diese sogenannten Boss oder Leaderkämpfe können entweder ein 1 vs. 1 sein oder ein 1 vs. 2 (gegen 2 stärkere Main Chars, jedoch kommt das nur selten vor) und in einem Fall sogar ein 1 vs. 3 Kampf dieser jedoch taucht nur 1 mal auf und dann gibt es was häufig der Fall ist, einen Boss Kampf inkl. vieler schwacher Gegner.

Grafik: Die Grafik ist für einen Vita port richtig gut gelungen und das sag ich nicht nur weil man Brüste in HD sieht sondern weil es nichts anderes als die Wahrheit ist, die Umgebung und die Schatten sehen aber jedoch eher meh aus aber dennoch für ein Vita Port okay. 
Die Characktere sind jedoch wirklich gut designt auch wen die Animationen mancher etwas "glitchen".

OST: Der OST (Soundtrack) ist ganz in Ordnung, in mancher hinsicht jedoch etwas nervig weil sie in vielen Szenen immer und immer wieder kommen. Der Fighting OST der sich von char zu char unterscheidet ist aber im Ausgleich richtig gut.

Multiplayer: Hab ihn nicht wirklich getestet 3 Spiele für die Erfolge, jedoch was ich so gesehen habe nicht so interessant für mich vorallem ruckelt und nein es sind keine laggs sondern ruckler (so kleine Frameeinbrüche) es häufiger vorallem wen 4 Kämpfer auf dem Feld sind.

Charackter-Gestalltung: Da bei diesem Port alle DLC's inbegriffen sind hat man eine Menge Auswahl an Schüleruniformen, Shinobi-Uniformen, Unterwäsche und Accesoirs. 
Mit viel Geld kann man hier sich seine Lieblingssets locker und einfach zusammenstellen.

Größte Pluspunkte:

Viele Characktere zur Auswahl die sich alle anders Spielen
Witzige Nebenstory
Viel Auswahl an Kleidung für die Characktere
Einfach zu spielen und ein sehr leichter und gelungener Einstieg
(Für die Männer) Brüste, RIESENBRÜSTE

Schlimmste Minuspunkte:

Hauptstory viel zu langweilig und anstrengend mit der Zeit
Nebenstories dauern lediglich 20 Minuten
Nachdem man alles gekauft hat kann man mit dem übrigen Geld nichts machen.
Gameplay wird bei längeren spielen öde.


Fazit: Ein sehr gutes und lustiges Spiel, ich hatte meinen Spass und hab meine 25€ gut gespendet jedoch würde ich falls ich nochmal die Wahl habe es zu kaufen es für 20€ oder weniger kaufen.

40 Stunden Spielspass und für manche sogar etwas mehr.

TL:DR - if you have any doubt "to buy or not to buy"- go watch Senran Kagura anime, at least first 3-4 series.If you like stuff like this, then you should probably get this game(on sale), if would entertain you for an evening or two.
---
Now to the point.
Well, don't get me wrong - i like this game, really like. Altrough how could i not like it after if i watched the original anime and found it to my liking. But let's be honest - "Senran Kagura The Game" is very over-hyped and overrated game, and does not deserve its 98% review score. In reality, it is very mediocre:

Mediocre keyoboard facerolling/smartmouse programming skill challenge
Mediocre port - it does not crash, but it has all the bunch of typical ported by lazy devs usually do when they wanna earn easy'n'fresh cash from their old games. I wonder - have they ever tried to play this with a keyboard? Meh
Mediocre graphics
Mediocre story(dialogues are very short and mostly it is all the same)
Mediocre character customisation possibilities.
Madiocre fighting
Mediocre fap - even such a simple features as customizable training vs AI girls(i mean main characters, not generic mob of clones),is not present here
Mediocre cooperative MP
Mediocre...damn everything!

And yet this game gets 98% rating. So because it is not fair i'll giving it a negative review. Because score over 95% is how youfind the best games around the world. And this is NOT one of them. Unfortunately.

23435921.review:
I'm going to recommend this game, But I'm doing it with caution. The story is really great. The gameplay however is tedious and only seems to achieve any level of challenge through locking up your contoller and preventing you from moving entirely. I don't understand the sudden fascination with stun attacks in games, it's a trend I really wish would die. Three simple rules for game design: 
1. don't interfere with the controller 
2. don't obfuscate the screen 
3. don't make my success dependent on an NPC

Senran Kagura does very well on 2 &3, but holy crap does it violate number 1. The balance in gameplay is way off, most of the fights are so easy it's ridiculous. When you encounter a challenge it's going to be because your controls are totally gone for the duration of the fight. Hit your counter button all you like it won't matter one single bit. 

So why am I recommending this game? The reason I'm recommending this game is because it has an absolutely wonderful storyline. Despite the T&A there is an underlying storyline that is just beautiful. And despite having a few moments that are beyond frustrating, they are passable and the other playable parts are entertaining enough to keep you going. I wouldn't call them revolutionary by a longshot. But they are alright, monotonous, very repetitive and overly easy but alright. The combat is the definition of unbalanced and to be honest poorly designed but it is well enough to keep you going through the story and the story is expansive and wonderful. It is expansive and the characters actually grow and learn, and it has some really touching moments. From just a gamplay perspective I'd say to avoid this, but the overall experience was definitely an enjoyable one. So I'm recommending this, but I'm doing so hesitantly.

23422251.review:
游戏粗看有点类似于三国无双，打小兵后打BOSS，打小兵的时候手感很不错，招式华丽爽快，应该是因为掌机机能问题，小兵刷新机制比较迷，小场景里面原地刷新出来，略诡异…通过打小兵积攒卷轴（放大招、变身用的），再与另外两个学院的人对战。但对于占据了游戏近一半的单对单BOSS战，我不是很满意，游戏反制招式稀少，并没有势均力敌的临场感，不是你连我就是我连你，被追着打的话基本只能靠反弹那招强行逼开对方，但那招可是耗血的啊……听说还有防御反弹？话说那技能真的存在吗？我真的是用不出来的！！等我明天再熟悉一下系统，尽量试试看吧……目前就玩了一个学院的人物，人物招式还是比较鲜明的，重复度不高，释放机制类似无双，操作相似技能不同。
    然后游戏的另外一个玩点就是收集系统。通过做任务积攒金钱，解锁并购买商店物品（衣服、装饰、画册、原声之类的），商店里面还有一个类似扭蛋的机制，用金币随机解锁胖次款式……升级解锁新技能（连招），但升级贼快，就是不知道上限是多少啦…通关以后应该就是靠挑战和这个系统来维持游戏生命了吧，应该算是另一种意义上的刷刷刷了。作为福利的换衣间也是建立在此之上的，没有好衣服摸起来都没手感#滑稽
    作为一个手柄V移植过来的游戏，人物材质还行，模型尚可，即使在PC上也没有太明显的硬伤，日呆游戏里面算及格啦~就是某些线条的锯齿比较明显（我用驱动强开了FXAA什么的，感觉改善也并不明显），还有某个部位的抖动像个水袋一样不太科学……但场景方面就不堪入目了。原作受限于掌机平台，一些掌机平台上的通病还是比较明显的，比如说频繁的读盘，场景切换突兀，过场过于简单，场景简陋而狭小、流程短，碰撞体积判定有点奇怪，即使移植到PC上，上面的几个问题也不会有太大的改善，我想玩过掌机的玩家应该多多少少都曾体会过这种感觉吧……但该游戏算比较良心了，键位合理且可以自行设置（鄙视某街头互殴5），画面设置不算丰富但该有的基本有了，自带全DLC，就HD化的游戏里面我觉得绝对水平线以上了。比较遗憾的是，切换命驱状态时小V上明显是要在角色胸前左右滑动（类似撕开衣服的感觉），提示都没改，但PC上却只按一个键，没代入感啊~

购买建议：日呆，无双刷刷刷患者可以一试，其他的等打折吧

================================

23416672.review:
I'll sum my experience with this game up in two words: "Surprisingly endearing".

So, that probably sounds sarcastic, right? Well, before taking the plunge and buying this game, I was really concerned this would be mindless button masher that depended on the gimmick of stripping and bounce physics to be entertaining. Now mind you, the gimmick turns out to be a welcome addition, considering that this game overall is actually fun. 

There actually is story to this game, and to me it seemed on par with any fair, generic anime you see around.  Is the story weak in small areas? Yeah, but most animes are, so I find it forgivable. 

Pro's
-Over 20 characters (counting the included DLC), each unique with a quirky personality type and combat moveset.
-If you find it too easy, there's a hard mode
-Dojo mode lets you do online or AI battles, always a nice addition
-An unexpectedly long story, played out from different points of view of 4 ninja schools, each with 5 characters.
-A ridiculous amount of buyables/unlockables, allowing for some pretty great customization, up to 4 accessory slots per character. 
-Looking at total missions completed, I'm about 15 hours into the game so far, have been focusing on playing Story Missions, and I'm not even halfway done. So, you absolutely will get your money's worth in terms of gameplay time.
-The clothing damage and jiggles certainly could not be anything but a Pro.

Con's
-The graphics aren't nearly as nice as Estival, a sequel to this game. It's a port of a PS Vita game, though I am told the graphics have been updated to be better than the Vita version.
-Some of the story is played out of points of view of characters that tend to prattle on when they narrate. There's going to be a fair amount of narration that you'll probably be skipping and skimming.
-With Frenzy mode, it's possible to end some of the NPC battles in an instant due to overwhelming damage. So the longish load times can often make it frusrating. 

------------------
Neat Gameplay Features 

-In a battle, you have your basic uniform (whichever one you picked), and your basic moveset (aka the Flash moveset). The more you play with your basic uniform on, the more bonuses and techniques you unlock for Flash
-During a battle, you have the option to pick between two transformations, both are very strong, grant new skills, and activating either one fills your HP to full (so use it wisely, as you can't undo it once you've used it in a fight). These two modes you can activate are Yang (Basically your "super hero" costume) and Yin (Strip down to your undies).

-----------------------------------------------
-This next part I've borrowed from the wiki, just to save you some time, and to show that the combat is deeper than it appears.

Yang: Yang mode is unlocked by utilizing your Shinobi Transformation and Secret Ninja Arts. Maxing out your Yang affinity gives you access to longer combos, Yang moves, an extra Aerial Rave loop, enhanced damage and invincibility on your dash and auto recovery on your Health gauge and Ninja Art gauge. Making you an even tougher target to take down, you will no longer be stunned from being hit. 

Yin: Stripping down to your skivvies and going Frantic is what unlocks Yin mode! When Yin mode is fully maxed out, you gain access to a bevy of bonuses, including increased combo length and a longer combo timer, the ability to recover both your Health gauge and Ninja Art gauge by taunting, Yin moves, higher damage, more invincibility frames on your dash and an overall boost in attack power. Additionally, your Limit Break will only consume 5% of your health instead of 10%. However, your defense will take a huge hit, so you better use all that additional offensive power to end the battle decisively! 

Flash: Staying in your standard uniform is the name of the game for unlocking Flash mode. No need to strip down or perform a Shinobi Transformation—just fight as you are! Fully unlocking Flash mode grants you higher damage and invincibility on your dash, faster building of your Ninja Art gauge, infinite Aerial Raves, increased timing to pull off a parry, an enhanced guard and an impressive 1.5x increase to both your attack and defense. If all of that wasn’t enough, maxed out Flash mode gives you increased experience and zeni.

23415419.review:
[h1]งานพอร์ทจาก Vita ที่มีดีมากกว่าแค่ความ 'วาบหวิว'[/h1] 

Senran Kagura Shinivi Versus เป็นเกมแอคชั่นต่อคอมโบฟันดะที่เน้นจุดขายเรื่องความวาบหวิวของตัวละครเป็นหลัก อย่างการสู้กันจนเสื้อผ้าท่อนบนและล่างขาดกระจายด้วยการต่อคอมโบพิเศษ ตลอดจนคอนเทนด์ต่างๆ อย่างการปลดล็อกชุดที่ทำมาเพื่อขายความเซ็กซี่โดยเฉพาะ ตัวเกมเป็นงานพอร์ทมาจาก PSVita แต่ก็มาแบบคุณภาพ 'ดีเยี่ยม' เกมรันได้ที่ 60fps ภาพคมชัดระดับ 1080p เล่นได้อย่างลื่นไหลไม่มีสะดุด ส่วนการควบคุมรองรับทั้งคียบอร์ดและจอย แต่ผมแนะนำว่าให้เล่นด้วยจอยจะดีที่สุด เพื่อประสบการการต่อคอมโบอย่างลื่นไหลไม่มีสะดุดครับ

ถ้าผมเข้าใจไม่ผิดเกมนี้มีอนิเมะของตัวเองด้วย และเกมก็ base-on อนิเมะโดยหยิบเอาโรงเรียนนินจาสาวทั้ง 3 แห่ง มาสร้างเป็นเรื่องราวในเกมนี้โดยจับตัวละครต่างๆ มาประลองฝีมือกัน ตัวละครที่คุณเลือกเล่นได้ก็มีมากกว่า 10 ตัว (โรงเรียนละ 4-5 ตัว) โดยแต่ละตัวก็จะมีสไตล์การต่อสู้ การใช้ท่าพิเศษและบุคคลิกที่เป็นเอกลักษณ์ไม่เหมือนกัน แถมยังมี Progression ให้ไล่เก็บเพื่อดึงดูดให้คุณเล่นต่อไปด้วย อาทิ มีการพัฒนาเลเวล เก็บทักษะการต่อสู้ 3 รูปแบบ รวมทั้งการปลดล็อกคอมโบใหม่ๆ อีกมากมาย ส่วนใครที่ชอบ customize ตัวละคร เกมนี้มีเครื่องแต่งการและไอเทมพิเศษมากมายให้คุณเอาไปปรับแต่งตัวละครให้ออกมาเซ็กซี่ได้ตามที่คุณต้องการ

ตัวเกมแบ่งออกเป็น 3 โหมดการเล่นได้แก่ เนื้อเรื่องหลัก เนื้อเรื่องของแต่ละตัวละคร และ Multiplayer สำหรับ 2 โหมดแรกเกมเพลย์หลักจะคล้ายกับการเอาเกมในซีรีส์มุโซมาผสมเข้ากับ DmC คือ เดินลุยเป็นฉากๆ ตบกับกองทัพศัตรูไปเรื่อยจนเจอบอสประจำฉาก แต่การต่อคอมโบต่อสู้จะดุดันรวดเร็วหลายลีลาประมาณนั้น ส่วน MP ก็คือการเล่นสู้กันระหว่างผู้เล่นกันเองฮะ และเนื่องจากเกมเน้นจุดขายเรื่องการเซอร์วิสผู้เล่นด้วยความวาบหวิวเป็นหลัก ระหว่างการต่อสู้ถ้าคุณถูกศัตรูรุมยำมากๆ หรือศัตรูจำพวกบอสถูกคุณอัดรัวๆ เกมจะตัดเข้าสู่ฉากอนิเมชั่นที่แสดงอาการ "ขาด" ของเสื้อผ้าท่อนบนและล่างไปเรื่อยๆ และหากคุณพิชิตบอสได้ด้วยท่าไม้ตายพิเศษปิดท้าย เสื้อผ้าอาจขาดถึงขั้นอันตธานหายไปกันเลยทีเดียว กระทั่งการแปลงร่างของตัวละครแต่ละครั้งก็ทำมาเป็นอนิเมชั่นให้ดู ซึ่งการนำเสนอตรงนี้อาจจะทำให้คุณรู้สึกว่าเหมือนเล่นเกมไปด้วยดูอนิเมชั่นไปด้วย มันค่อนข้างดึงดูดดีฮะแต่เมื่อเล่นไปนานๆ อาจจะสร้างความรำคาญได้ เพราะทุกครั้งที่คุณกำลังต่อคอมโบใส่บอสอย่างเมามันส์เกมก็ตัดไปให้ดูฉากพวกนี้จนอาจเสียจังหวะกดต่อคอมโบ นอกจากนี้ตัวเกมยังมีการ Loading บ่อยมาก เรียกว่าแทบจะทุกครั้งที่ตัดฉากหรือจบภารกิจ กระทั่งแค่สลับจากฉากต่อสู้ไปเป็นสรุปคะแนนก็ยังต้องมีการโหลด แม้แต่ละครั้งจะใช้เวลาไม่นานนักแต่เจอบ่อยๆ ก็น่าเบื่อเหมือนกัน ตรงนี้อาจนับเป็นข้อเสียของเกมได้เลยครับ

เพลงประกอบทำได้ดี ทั้งยังมีจุดขายรองเรื่องระบบต่อสู้ที่สนุกและรวดเร็วไว้รองรับผู้เล่นที่ไม่ได้สนใจเรื่องความวาบหวิวเพียงอย่างเดียว รวมๆ แล้ว Senran Kagura Shinivi Versus เป็นเกมที่น่าประทับใจ คุ้มค่าไม่ว่าจะกดราคาเต็มหรือลดขนาดไหน เพราะตัวเกมรวม DLC ทั้งหมดที่ต้องแยกซื้อบน PSVita มาให้เลยแบบฟรีๆ แถมเกมยังให้อารมณ์กึ่งๆ อ่าน VN ผสมดูอนิเมชั่นแบบนิดๆ ด้วย ถ้าคุณกำลังมองหาเกมแอคชั่นที่สนุกเล่นง่ายและแปะป้ายว่า "ความโมเอะชนะทุกสิ่ง" นี่เป็นอีกเกมที่น่าสนใจครับ

8.5/10

23411271.review:
I'm gonna start off this review with two words - boobie fiesta. Besides gameplay, you're pretty much going to be swarmed with it. The feminist door is [i] that-a-way. [/i]

Once again, it's another game that I've seen and enjoyed. Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus is definitely a great game to play, if you have a good enough computer. With my own computer, however, I was able to keep the 60 FPS cap at all times. The graphics aren't customizeable, meaning that you'd have to stay at whatever framerate you have. Or maybe you need to reduce the resolution. I haven't tested it myself. 

Besides being a big mountain of fanservice, the game is basically a big "beat em' up", one of my now favorite genres of games. I enjoyed the mechanics of the game - it made it challenging but at the same time relaxing, knowing how to perfect combos and such. Guarding is one thing I haven't used [i] at all [/i] though, so it's still frustrating to get comboed myself. The game also revolves around the "Shinobi Tenshin", which basically transforms your character into a different suit, with different buffs. (And all the more fanservice, too!)

The game is also very customizeable - both in accessories, controls, and many, many outfits. In my runthrough of the Hanzo Academy, the shop allows you to buy clothing and lingerie from the shop, along with many songs, pictures, and a few other characters. There's also something called the "Lingerie Lotto", where you donate a certain amount of money to reach a quality of pantsu. (I've gotten one "Climactic!" before, and I wasn't NOT amused.)

TL;DR:
[list]
    [*]The game revolves around oversexualized women. (or lolis, if you're into that)
    [*]Running it will take a "more than decent" computer, but it should still be fun.
    [*]The game's a breathtaking beat em' up that keeps you at bay.
    [*]ALL OF THE FANSERVICE.
[/list]

Overall, I enjoy the quality of this game. Besides the very obvious sexualization, it's still a fun game to play just for fun. There is a possible multiplayer mode, but I haven't tested that out myself yet. More will come later. Maybe if I care. It's definitely worth the money ($26.99 on sale) if you can run it, and it'd be best if you can get it ASAP.

Who's your favorite girl from the Senran Kagura series? List down below. (Katsuragi ftw)

23410575.review: Ok, lemme preface this by saying i own every single game in the franchise. The franchise as a whole has grown in mechanics a whole lot since the first game. the original game on the 3DS can actually get kind of challenging, and i played it to death, and i have 100% on that game. This is the second game of the franchise, and when you consider the hardware differences between the 3DS and the Vita, they definitely had a lot less hardware limitations when they were developing this game. I own it one vita, but never got all of the dlc. The steam version however has all of the DLC and was pleasantly surprised to find them available to purchase in-game in the store. Senran Kagura 2: Deep Crimson on the 3DS doesn't play as well as this one to be honest, but the 3ds games are more of a side-scrolling style beat'em up with weird camera controls. Deep Crimson, although is on the 3ds, has much higher quality character models and environments, and has different models for the weapons, but the tag system in it isn't as much fun as the fast paced aerial-raves in this one. Shinovi Versus plays well, no problems with framerates, fanservice is gratuitous and fantastic, and the story is much less serious than the first one, but that's ok because more tits.

23408325.review:
Ok Ok non volevo fare la recensione  , ma ci sta per dovere di cronaca per utenti italiani.
Senran Kagura e´ un gioco giapponese , e gia da questo capirete che non troverete niente di simile nel mercato europeo-americano. Ed e´uno di quei giochi che non vuoi assolutamente mostrare ad amici o parenti.
Il gioco in se e´un ottimo port dalla versione playstation vita. E questo e´una  cosa fantastica , dato che il gioco e´estremamente leggero per la gran parte dei computer di fascia media. Io non girero´ dark souls 3 a 60 fps , ma questo gioco si. E l esperienza e´ necessaria viverla alle massime velocita´ .

------------------

Ora parlando di gameplay , il gioco e´molto simplicistico e abbastanza ripetitivo . Ma questo e´un dato di fatto per il genere Hack n Slash/Musume/beat em up ; che si ritrova in giochi tipo Dynasty Warriors , Pirate Warrios o Samurai Warriors della Tecmo Koei .
A differenza di Dynasty warrior ci ritroviamo a giocare nei panni dei classici archetipi anime/manga di ragazze liceali giapponesi , dalle piu´bizzarre abilitä , stili di combattimento e....... vestiti.
Si , e´un gioco che se ne frega della pudicita´ e mostra tette e culi ovunque , tutto naturalmente censurato a modo.
Non troverete maschi in questo gioco , solo ragazze. 

Il gameplay e´semplice e veloce , il personaggio puo´ fare delle lunghe combo per distruggere piccoli gruppi di nemici per poi dover affrontare (sempre alla fine di ogni missione) un boss , che e´sempre uno dei personaggi giocabili. E in caso di vittoria o sconfitta si ..... possono ammirare le forme della ragazza sconfitta , ebbene si ogni volta che si subisce un tot di danni , il personaggio perde una parte dei vestiti , rigorosamente mostrando o le tette o il culo.

Il gameplay e´ripetitivo perche´una volta raggiunta una soglia di exp i personaggi useranno sempre le stesse combo , quindi se trovate noioso usare le stesse cose ogni volta , questo gioco non fa per voi. Comunque essendo io un fan del genere dynasty warrior mi so ritrovato una meraviglia . E il fatto che il gameplay e´molto piu´ terra-aria degli altri giochi comunque era una piccola differenza simpatica.

Se siete invece degli appassionati del genere anime/manga (trash  o ecchi in questo caso) , non vi da fastidio ripete una gamma di abilitä piuttosto limitata e di giocare diverse missioni per sbloccare ogni singolo costume o ....( si , non scherzo ) ogni tipo di lingerie nel gioco questo gioco vi dara´ una buona di quantita´di tempo da buttare.

I personaggi (21 da quanto ne so) sono tutti belli colorati e unici in se , e sono anche facilmente personalizzabili in molte cose come tagli di capelli , vestiti e uniformi (la Super forma per intenderci) e tantissimi accessori trashosi che solo in un anime potreste trovare . Naturalmente per i fan degli stereotipi anime vi e´ l imbarazzo della scelta e una ragazza per ogni gusto.

Il gioco lo consiglio a chi conosce gia il genere beat em up alla dynasty , altrimenti si potrebbe ritrovare  con un gioco senza senso e privo di direzione in se , se non eccessivamente ripetitivo.
Lo sconsiglio a chi vuole prenderlo seriamente come concept di gioco o per la storia perche´e´  uno stereotipo giappominchia in formato videoludico , i personaggi possono essere fastidiosi e la storia beh...non e´un granche´.
Alcune persino a me danno un pochino fastidio per quanto sono....cretine. (cringe) 

--------------------

Il gioco in uscita costato 25 euro e´un affarone , a mio avviso , eccellente. Dato che offre gia incluse le dlc che uscirono anche su ps vita. 

----------------

Parlando di cose negative , il multyplayer e´al momento buggato e ha un tremendo crollo di fps per colpa ......si....delle mutandine che piovono dal cielo durante una mod  (ve l ho gia detto che sto gioco e´ proprio trash`?)
E le missioni so estremamente veloci , io avro´concluse molte missioni in meno di 2 minuti!!! altre anche in meno di 1.
A differenza di dynasty il gioco ha mappe piccolissime e si concentra molto sulle "boss" fight e non ci sono orde di nemici come su pirate warrior o dynasty.
Il gioco in se´ non e´difficile , in normal difficulty e´tremendamente facile e in hard la differenza non e´veramente alta , questo gioco non e´per chi cerca delle sfide difficili.


_________________

Se avete i soldi e volete un gioco serio del genere puntate su dynasty , pirate (basato su one piece) o samurai warrior. Poiche´questi hanno molti piu´personaggi , molte mappe e storie molto lunghe.
Se invece volete rilassarvi su un gioco ecchi nosense e molto piu´piccolo nei contenuti (e siete piu´maniaci di gigi la trottola) , questo gioco comunque ve lo consiglio. Perche´nonostante cio´ e´ben fatto come prodotto. Le abilitä sono tutte diverse , i personaggi sono totalmente differenti e unici , vi sono tantissime cose da sbloccare e il gioco va che e´una meraviglia , niente problemi di audio,grafica , bugs o altre cose simili.

_______________________

23407220.review:
É PEITO Q NÃO ACABA MAIS!

O jogo em si é bem simples, tanto é que é um PORT do PSVITA... Comandos simples (ao menos utilizando um controle), poucos combos porém muitos personagens para se jogar. Os cenários também são simples e curtos e as missóes se baseiam em derrotar alguns inimigos e, no final, um boss, e é sempre isso. Existe uma boa customização das roupas e acessórios das personagens, o que é um ponto positivo.

As configurações gráficas se limitam apenas na resolução e se rodará em janela ou full screen, nada mais que isso.

Os sons, no geral, são excelentes, principalmente as vozes das personagens. O áudio é apenas em japonês.

Enfim, apesar de toda essa simplicidade o jogo é muito divertido, ainda mais para quem é fã da franquia e do estilo hack'n'slash.

Ah, vale ressaltar que o jogo não é um PORT perfeito, possuo um pc muito bom, com uma VGA GTX 980 G1 Gaming e mesmo assim, em alguns poucos momentos, existe uma queda de frames, nada que atrapalhe o jogo, mas, por ser um jogo tão simples, não deveria acontecer isso.

NOTA: 9/10.

Obs: o jogo TEM CENSURA! Vamos aguardar um patch para "corrigir este problema" hehehe

Edit: Já tem o patch da alegria! =]

23402823.review:
i came to this game as a fan of the manga and wasn't dissapointed in the feel of the game. it has some issues chugging for me when there's a 100+ enemies onscreen or during the opening video (along with some screen tearing which leads me to think that its an issue with being upsized from the vita but meh) but beyond that it handles rather smoothly and displays a level of robustness that you wouldn't really expect from a fanservice title.
------------------------------------------------
pros:
fan service
decent gameplay
native controller support
smooth running
------------------------------------------------
cons:
screen tearing during cutscenes 
some gameplay aspects (ultimate ninjutsu) either poorly explained or missing entirely
censoring (chances are i'm over the age of 18 to play or buy this product, you already put in parental controls steam....maybe trust adults to be responsible?)
resolution support could be better
------------------------------------------------
final verdict: 9.7/10 well worth a bit of time and cash for fans of the series or those just looking for a fun fanservice beat em up game

23398598.review:
I'm enjoying this. It's really basic beat 'em up game, and it's probably safe to say that most of the budget went into things that are not the gameplay, such as voicing, Nan Yaegashi's funky art/designs and opening animation.
You know how Neptunia games are essence of no-budget JRPGs? Senran Kagura is the same thing for beat 'em ups. The stages are recycled harder than in Dragon Age 2, they are very short(though this keeps each mission from overstaying its welcome), there are probably less than 10 types generic mooks to beat, if you fail a mission and want to restart it you'll have to sit through two loading screens before pressing Retry, whenever a boss character appears in the middle of the stage game has to stop to load, non-skippable animations and loading screens regularly break the flow of the game, the port is very bare-bones with only options for resolution(up to 1080p) and window options...

But like I said, I'm enjoying this. Unlike Neptunia, the gameplay does have some proper weight, so whole package isn't carried solely by the silly story and cast. And speaking of cast, oh man. This is easily where the meat of the appeal is. Every character has their own play-style, and you'll have chance to experience all of them. Though this also means that you'll be playing with some which you don't definitely enjoy, but there are more hits than misses thankfully.
And the characters are all wonderfully over-the-top archetypes. Protagonist brimming with positivity? Masochist who loves being abused and called names? Poor girl spending her days growing bean sprouts because they are best food ever? It also helps that most of them are very positive characters, keeping with the overall happy tone of series.
The story does make an attempt for seriousness, but it kind of comes of ham-fisted. This is a series that revels in ridiculousness, but serious moments make you appreciate those all the more.
[Edit]
I wrote this review before having completed the whole game. Story of one group goes so far against usual tone of the series that it's actually really refreshing. Though with things that happen in it, who knows what it means for canon...
[/Edit]
Customization of character appearances is usually big deal to people, and it doesn't fail here. You have tons of clothing options, accessories you can place whenever you please, hairstyles can be switched... And whatever you, those changes will stay on. So you can dress one group of characters however you like, switch to others and those clothes will stay on.

Even if you complete everything as fast as possible and don't shoot for high-grades or replays of missions, you'll be definitely getting your money's worth. The missions are short, but there's lots of them. And story segments between them are short enough so that they don't get in way of action... As said before, other things do that.
Senran Kagura is definitely rough, but if you enjoy beat 'em ups and clunkiness like what was common in PS2 era, this is totally safe bet.
Oh, and if you want an actual challenge, make sure to play in Hard Mode and to ignore solo-stories until you're done with main story for each group.

NOTE: This review has been edited as of 12/28, to note changes patched as of now.

NOTE: This review has been edited as of 6/13, to note changes patched as of now.

Note: I originally played this on the Vita, and cleared a large percent of it there.

I want to avoid the standard "This is about blah, and what you do is blah" kind of review, as there are plenty of those here. This review focuses more on the technical side of things.

For comparison, here's my specs:

CPU: Intel Core i5 750 @ 2.66GHz
RAM: 6GB DDR3
GPU: Sapphire Radeon R9 280X

Now, the required specs on the store page made it out as if I'd have a hard time playing it, mostly due to RAM and CPU. This is not the case at all. I run it windowed at 1600X900, and it plays flawlessly. No issues performance-wise.

Originally, there were a couple bugs when this game launched. As of December 28th, 2016 (and as of earlier, though I have no recollection of the exact date), all of the bugs I can recognize are fixed. This game still plays flawlessly, and now there's no bugs or glitches one needs to be concerned about before purchase.

This game is perfectly solid. The game runs well, it's even more responsive than the Vita version from running at 60FPS, it's gorgeous at higher resolutions, and it comes with all DLC. On top of that, they seem to have rebalanced things so you unlock outfits and such a little differently to compensate. This is an incredible port and a worthwhile investment.

23396284.review:
==ADDITION==
Apparently, some people are getting frequent crashes. I have never encountered a bug or crash myself, so this review is of the game itself, and I can't comment on those issues.
==AND NOW FOR THE REVIEW==

This review is basically a load of buts.
Not butts. Buts.

A Vita port of an ecchi game sounds like an awful idea, BUT against all odds, it is actually pretty good. It's not quite DOA levels of whoa-this-is-a-really-legit-game, BUT it comes close.

It's not going to blow anyone away, but the fighting mechanics are solid and varied just enough to keep you entertained. The story and characters start pretty one-dimensional and fanservice-focused, but for some bizarre reason things get grim and actually kind of interesting after two or so hours. This could've easily been a mindless mess with terrible gameplay, but you could play this and have fun in more ways than just sexy kinds. It even has okay online, so you can beat up friends. As long as your friends are all pervs, anyway.

Nothing about it is perfect, of course; the masses of small enemies are repetitive to fight and are actually really tedious as some characters, and they just serve to pad play time before you get to the real one-on-one or two-on-two fights. Some of the less serious dialogues are at best annoying and at worst genuinely uncomfortable, even for someone who's already on board for the sexy stuff. Being a Vita port, you don't get many settings, and the animations don't look good on a larger screen. It basically all feels one step up from a doujin game, BUT I've still managed to spend hours in the Vita version and now this one.

Also, there's no real overt porn. Like, no sex scenes, no getting a boyfriend, no real mentions of sex at all. It's just girls in skimpy outfits jiggling and occasionally making cutesy gay comments to one another. It treats itself like a game about ninjas killing each other, even if it relies heavily on T&A.

So basically, it's one of the better ways to get off, and you even get to play a game and hear a story with it. Plus, it comes with the DLC characters and ALL the outfits.

23395286.review:
友情提示：破解版的画质明显要比正版差点，这难道是日厂新的黑科技？
优点：
1、支持键盘键位修改，默认键位符合大多数PC用户习惯，也就是没有奇怪的键位设定，至少说明厂商有认真的考虑过键盘党的体验。
2、福利满满，虽然晃动的像气球
3、画面合格（主要是第二个学院的建模锯齿比另外三个学院明显，场景布置贴图质量也好低），隔壁的御姐玫瑰一定是来自厂商的恶意
4、没有继承日厂恶劣的阉割传统，至少日语文本没有被砍。这点比海王星的地雷社等大多数日厂的要做的好多了，英语我只能看懂10%，虽然日语能看懂50%。但我还是希望在未来日厂能正视中国作为世界第二大日呆市场的事实。（艹猫成功的秘诀有一半是因为优化的画面+中文）
5、自带全DLC，逼近是旧作dlc在收费就太坑了，要是PC也是同步主机发布DLC价格只要合理广大绅士还是买买买买。
6、存档通用，方便急性子和强迫症患者
----------缺点---------------
1、由于是系列第一次上PC，画面不如海王星PC版的第一作，优化也有待提高，目前最大的问题是画面撕裂问题希望后续补丁能修复这个问题。另外PC应该给予更多的画面设置选项，这样玩家可以根据自己的配置灵活调节画面水平。
2、打击感一般，日厂里打击感做的最好的应该是卡婊了
3、建模质量有待提高，我记得在日本起动战士这个游戏的MOD界有个日本的平滑帝，也许你们应该招募他。
4、部分剧情黑屏+文字真是太懒了，好歹加个背景什么的呀，PC屏幕都是很大，放在PSV上的黑屏没什么，PC上就显的过于懒惰了。
5、最后我希望能更加快速的跳过片头各种标识

23388040.review:
I'm kind of surprised I like this game as much as I do. It's actually pretty fun to play. I don't play a lot of these musou type games, but I can say the gameplay is more fun than Neptunia U. I've played through one school's arc (Hebijo) and did all 5 characters arcs for the girls in that school. It took about 9 hours and never really felt like grind. The story was actually alright and not complete garbage like some people might expect. There are some wierd things on the technical side that could probably use some work. If you play on a 1080p monitor, you probably won't have any issues, but on a 1440p monitor, Fullscreen resolution is maxed at 1080p. If you set the game to borderless window, menu elements will be 1440p, but the game is still rendering at 1080. Someone could probably fix that. I don't mind it much though. It's a pretty good looking game for a Vita port overall I suppose.

Edit: Look up gedosato, this program fixes the resolution issue. I've forced 4k and downsampled it to 1440p, looks much nicer now.

Ryobi best girl

Oh and I guess the Online works pretty well when I can get into a game. A few times It just said "Failed to Join room" for no apperent reason though, which is kind of annoying. Actual matches were lag free though, and there's a decent amount of players, 5-10 rooms whenever I checked. That's in the first week though.
